THE SHOES WERE CUTE, HOWEVER THE SIZES WERE NOT ACCURATE. I USUALLY WEAR A 9 - 9.5, AND ORDERED THE SIZE 10 AND THERE WAS NO WAY THEY WOULD FIT, NOT EVEN CLOSE. SO I HAD TO RETURN THEM.

These ballet shoes are nice quality and my 3 and 4 year old girls seem to really like them. I had to order a number of pairs to finally find the right fit. They seem to run a bit wide to me. The narrow sized worked well for my 3 year old. The "lace" would never stay tied, no matter the knot I used. Our dance teacher told us to use clear nail polish and it would keep the knot from untying. I, however, decided to just clip it off and it hasn't affected the fit.
These boots are extremely comfortable and very waterproof. I use them for powerwasher and stay dry and comfortable even though I am on my feet for many hours.

I bought them thinking they would be like my keds I've own for sometime. The are called the original. They looked the same unless you get really close and see the inside isn't terry cloth they are cheaper made. I bought a med it is what I wear but i'm in the process of trying to stretch them out. Wetting them and putting them over objects to stretch them since they are so tight. Length is right but they are narrow now with wetting them the blue from the soles have come up and i'll now have to deal with that. So what can I say - could have returned them you have always been great but thought I could stretch them out since i've been unable to find the ked original in the store.

I ordered this pair of topsiders, looking for some cute summery shoes. (Gold Metallic) They are fantastic! I already own 1 pair of Sperrys (Bluefish 2 eye in Linen/oat) so I know how comfortable they are and how great they look with pants, shorts, skirts, and dresses. The color is almost exactly like the picture, more of a gold than silver. They are a different style than the pair I am used to, so I did order 1/2 size smaller than my other (7.5) I tried they on at my local Macy's, and knew I needed a little smaller since they have less padding and smaller sole than the Bluefish. The only thing I didn't anticipate in since the shoes are a metallic leather, when my feet sweat, they kind of squeak from the inside leather rubbing on my feet. I bought some slim socks that are made to hide in flats at Target and that solves the problem (They probably don't smell as bad either!) I was slightly disappointed with the leather cord they used as shoelaces. It feels kind of cheap and it's REALLY stiff. They may just need some time to soften up a bit, but for now they're hard to tie and keep tied. I could always buy some leather cord at Michael's too, but I'm hoping they soften. These are great shoes and I LOVE them! Have been wearing them 4 times a week for the past 4 months! I recommend them to anyone looking for cute summery shoes.
I'm not very pleased with these slippers. They don't fit very good and keep slipping off my heels, making it a little difficult to walk safely. What is your return policy? Respectfully,

Being a female college student, I felt a necessity to own a pair or two of Uggs. Everybody wears them, but after my first winter in Michigan, I don't really understand why. Although they are super warm, they aren't waterproof (sucks for slushy days and wet snow), they don't have good traction (difficult to walk on snow and ice), and being made of sheepshin, they're difficult to clean. The salt put on the roads here damages them. I own the Ugg cleaning/care kit, and even that isn't enough to keep my Uggs looking good.I wouldn't recommend these for anyone who lives in a snowy place. Invest in some real snowboots.

Dada's are some of the best basketball shoes i have ever had. The only bad thing i have found is the price difference between youth and large. $20.00 more for a bigger size is rediculous, but other than that they are really cool shoes especially how you can personalize them with your teams colors and your team name, your name, and your number. Some of the reasons they are really good shoes are because they are comfortable, have good traction, and just look good.

These were for my brother who requires sturdy and supportive sneakers with velcro closures for daily use. The extra wide width was a bonus, and they're very comfortable for him. They also arrived within very quickly. We're very satisfied.

I have been a fan of Converse since the day I saw Will Smith unpack a brand new pair in the movie iRobot. I wanted one for myself, where else amazon is the best place to buy. Great product and very true to size. I would buy this product again. Thanks for making a shoe for a real woman....

although i got my usual size, it was longer than i expected it to be, but it's very comfy and light. I like what i got!

I have always like Grasshopper shoes and was pleased to see Amazon had a pair that would suit my needs. They arrived promptly, but sad to say, they were the wrong size. I love these shoes and have them in blue, white and black. I find them very comfortable to walk in which I appreciate since I usually need orthodic inserts. fit true to size.

I bought these sandals for my mom because they looked nice and were from Softspots a company I love. She hasn't worn them out yet but reportrd them to be very comfortable. Just what we were looking for. Excellent product as usual. I highly recommend,

These boots are water proof as advertized but they are not comfortable. I had to get some inserts just to wear them for a day. The lace hooks do not grab the shoe lace and hold so it is a pain just to lace them up. I would not recommend these to anyone.

These are very nice shoes, but the site showed them available in a triplewide but what was shipped was a double wide. So, they were too small for my mother-in-law to wear. This was real frustrating because she has such a hard time finding shoes that fit and my husband spent quite a bit of time shopping on the internet. They were sure they had found an answer when they ordered these sandals. We got our refund (minus shipping) and that's all good, but we wish the shoes had been what they were represented to be in the beginning!

Ordering my third pair, no break in time,look fabulous too. I wear these boots about sixty hours a week for work and still are the first pair of shoes I grab to wear when I am not going to work. They will stretch fast so should be snug when first bought.

I am a highschool junior, who didn't start seriously running until track season of last year. I have a wide foot with low arches, and some amount of overpronation. I tried several pairs of Asics and Nikes last spring and over the summer, yet my knees were always sore, I was having ankle injuries, shin splints, etc. Finally, come XC season this year, one of the salesmen at a local shoe store told me I "had to try" these shoes. They were perfect. The shoes are supportive without being restrictive, and they corrected my overpronation without feeling unnatural (which was my complaint with one pair of Nikes I had.) These shoes have held up well. I've ran on average a little over 40 miles per week from the beginning of August until the middle of November and continued to run a little less than that for these past two weeks, and the shoes have held up very well. They feel as if they could very easily hold up another running season, though I've just ordered another pair of the same shoes to replace them.The shoes are supportive, yet non-restrictive and also light weight. The only complaint I have about them is that they seem to retain odor more than most running shoes. If you have feet that start to smell really bad (like mine) plan on using shoe deodorant.This is an excellent shoe for those with low arches, especially, but not only, those who require a wide toe box.
These are awsome. just like shown. shipping took a while but it was over christmas so it makes sense. Just as nice as the pictures showed! Love the new CHucks

I really thought these were going to be cheaply made super small pouches.I was REALLY wrong. The construction is at least as durable as my $45.00 M.O.L.L.E. mag carrier, and they are large enough for an Iphone, an extra mag, and still has room for other items.If you are looking for good gear, Rothco items have served me well. Any time I look for gear Army Universe and Rothco are two names I look at FIRST.
These shoes are great,they can be worn down with jeans and a tee or worn with nice dress clothes.I'm getting the ones in pink.Get these shoes if considering.Very comfy also[Holla Back]

This is a beautifully classic shoe and quality is nice. The heel composition is the exception. It is a hard, hard plastic or rubber. It is very slippery on tile or brick floors. Be careful. As other reviewers indicated, the sizing is off. Consider ordering a half size larger.

The boot is attractive but the pictures make it seem as if the upper portion of the boot is more rigid but in reality it is not rigid at all. More flexible and doesn't look as good as if it was rigid.

Out of all 4 of my current Air Force military boots, this has to be the favorite. Wearing them, they feel like running shoes. They don't feel like your wearing you heavy combat boots. They're not steel or safety toed, they have a box toe only. If you want one of those installed in this, you're going to have to find a shoe guy somewhere in town to do it (I've seen them charge $50-people told me it's still worth it since they can only have steel toed boots in their job). If you're in the military, buy them at your MCSS (Military Clothing Sales Store) on base. At AAFES, they're under a hundred dollars ($98.95) and not tax of course. I do recommend you buy these. You have an excuse not to shine the rest of the boot since it has cloth and no worries of having it crack at the flexing point. I accidentally used a hose to wash vehicles, and the water didn't go through the cloth. They're not water proof, they're water resistant, so don't walk through a lake in them unless you have to. They dry fast since it's mostly cloth and not leather. My opinion, they look better than regular leather boots and require less polishing. If you do want someone to steel toe them and find a person to do it, they usually recommend to buy a half size larger than your foot.
I love them I wear them every day and have for 10 years now. They are great to work around the farm, ride and show my horses, and go to town. Super Super comfy! Ariats are great boots!

I received my Hi-Tec Altitude boots and am very pleased. I had purchased a Hi-Tec product from a retailer some time ago and was pleased with the fit, in particular. The Altitudes are solidly made, fit very well, are comfortable and as waterproof as described. I have shopped extensively for waterproof boots for trekking through the rain, snow and slush of New York City. I walk 20-30 blocks a day in these and they perform very well. I have been unable to find a similar pair of boots at this price anywhere I have shopped. I recommend these highly.
These sneakers are very comfortable and I am very pleased with the look and price. I would highly recommend for a casual flat everyday shoe.
I own 6 pairs of these shoes in different colors. They are classic flats! I wear them to work and for both casual and semi-formal events. You simply cannot beat them for comfort and style!
nice shoe...pretty comfortable...just runs really small. From past reviews elsewhere I knew to order a full size up. I did and am so glad.
Bought item for my bro...so all i can say is delivery was on time...Thank You!

I've worn these boots on week long backpacking trips through Yellowstone, Grand Canyon and Big Bend National Parks. They breath relatively well versus a full leather upper boot. The Vibram sole has excellent traction and is high quality. The boot is relatively water resistant, although it does not have a Gore-tex liner but water has never soaked through the boot. I really think Gore-tex liners are unnecessary unless you like to hike in very rainy areas. I've replaced the insoles with Spenco Backpackers for extra support under load. The only problem I've encountered is the rubber toe protection, which is part of the sole, has started to delaminate from the shoe. Great boot overall.

I ordered this with skepticism due to the confusion with sizes from other users. I took a chance and ordered for my 3 1/2 years old a size 9.5 M and it fits her perfectly. If it is a bit "wide", you can tighten the string to better fit the child's feet. I'm very happy with it and so is she. She didn't want to take them off.
My husband loves these shoes. We always buy more than one pair at a time so he always has a pair.

I've owned 3 pairs of these.The soles are marking. If you stomp on something or drag your feet, you will leave dark thick black marks.The toe likes to come unglued from the sole. I reccomend shoe goo.The leather, if it can be called such, is coated with plastic of some sort. It's not spit shineable.The boots are decently light and somewhat wearable.

I look at photos of myself that are at least 15 years old and I'm wearing the Grasshopper Ashland or the canvas counterpart. I love these sneakers because they are so comfortable, stylish, and have a slight heel. I have had type 1 diabetes for 40 years and cannot wear sandals. These are great with shorts or jeans year round. I look fit and healthy for a 51 year old woman. It cracked me up when these shoes were delivered with a catalogue in the box featuring 85 year old women. So I say, whether you're 35 or 85, these are a great shoe choice.

After a year of looking at these shoes I finally decided to purchase a pair. I normally wear Vans or Converse but I found that I wear them down pretty quickly so I was looking for a change. Once my shoes were delivered I tried them on and instantly knew these were going to be my new favorite shoes. The soles are thick which is good for someone like me who walks everywhere and wears down shoes fairly quickly. The shoes come with extra cushion on the inside which provides perfect arch support so I don't feel as flat footed. I no longer feel like I'm walking around barefoot the way I did with my Converse. I was worried about the sizing being that I had never tried them on before but they fit perfectly, not too big and not too snug. I would recommend these shoes to everyone. In fact I already convinced my roommate to purchase a pair for herself.
Bought this for my wife and she loved them! Warm, comfy, etc., but they're not great in the snow. Not much more to say. Overall a good product...just wish they were less expensive! :-)

I've been looking at these or some time and saw them for $79 bucks.They normally go for over a hundred and I couldn't pass them up. I normally wear size 10 and they fit perfect. Really like the beeswax leather they stay nice and clean compared to the suede. Got them in quick 5 day via ups ground too. Now I'm a happy hipster!
Great buy, much better than wooden models! I needed to put some rubbing alcohol to help the leather stretch easier, the wooden kind disintegreated, these held up nicely and will last a long time.

This is the 3rd pair of Incans I have purchased. I prefer the model that has a little more structure around the sole but it is hard to find. This model, the neoprene upper one, is very comfy. It feels good with no socks on and washes well after you stink it up from wearing no socks. If you are buying this thinking like I did that it would be a velcro version of the Rhod casual you will be surprised. Though it looks very similar and has the same sole it is a much less substantial shoe. I am a big Tsubo fan but be warned they do no wear well, maybe it is because they are so comfortable that you wear them every day. I have one pair of Tsubos that seem to wear well and they have a leather upper but they fit a little snug so I never wear them all day. Tsubos are like kids shoes very flexible and compliant. They are addictive. They feel good the first time you put them on.
i love these shoes. i ware them alot. i have three pairs red black and royal blue. one bad thing about them is you can not get shoelaces for them in the stores. i had to get them offline.

When I saw these shoes at the store, the sales guy told me Runner's World voted them #1. I looked at him suspiciously and thought, "Reebok makes a good *running* shoe!?" He saw my face and said, "I know, even the RW article said 'we can't believe we're saying this, but...'" So, I tried them on and they fit wonderfully!Although I have fairly wide feet, there isn't any tightness and the heel holds well. Decent stability, good cushioning.... I like that the arch allows your foot to flex (unlike most stability shoes out there these days - the ones with the rigid arch that lays flat on the road). I also have a flat foot and over-pronate; I wear my orthotics in the shoes and still take my regular size.So far, my longest run in these shoes has been about 45 minutes or 5.5 miles. I've worn them about 5 times. I'll update the review if I find anything wrong.Oh - I bought these shoes for $59 at Sports Basement in San Francisco. They were such a great price I bought two pair. But mine are blue, not that nice gray color ;-)

This is just one man's opinion, so take it for what it's worth, but i honestly believe that if Jesus were alive today, he would realize that sandals are for big sweaty comic book readers, and he would wear the sleek aerodynamic adidas Men's Tuscany NYL size 9 (i assume that Jesus' feet are a size 9). This was a very good deal and was a fast delivery. I highly recommend this seller to all.

Now, if you're a typical person, you'd probably find this shoe to be soft under foot. However, I stand for hours a day (teaching) and I found this shoe to be lacking. It ain't soft enough for my long-suffering feet and it's certainly less comfortable than a typical running shoe. If your workplace allows you to wear running shoes, just do it. You'll be happy you did. In that case, may I recommend to you the Asics GT-2170? It has a super-soft MIDSOLE, which is the IMPORTANT PART for comfort. I'm basically a shoe expert at this point in my life, and I must advise those who are looking for a comfortable shoe--I mean really soft!--to LOOK UNDER THE INSOLE AND PRESS THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF THE MIDSOLE. If the midsole (under the insole) is hard, or even hard-ish, you will NOT be comfortable unless you have numb feet that are immune to pressure. So don't be fooled by super-soft-feeling insoles made of puffy, fluffy, light foam. They will compress on top of a hard midsole, and you'll be hurtin' and as irritated as two wet cats in a bag.
The fit is GREAT. The quality could be better, but at that price you can buy a new pair every month.

In case of excessive rain and slush this winter I ordered these CLC Rain Wear size 10 boots. They looked good and when I tried them on wearing the heavy socks I will use with these in winter, they fit well.My normal size is a 9 wide. I like to wear thick socks for comfort and warmth so the size 10 in these boots was just right. They are comfortable, look well-made, have a decent tread that will grip mud, snow, and slush for better safety walking.For people who complain about the top part irritating the leg, well, just tuck your pants in the boot. Or, better yet, wear thick socks, like skiers use, which come up the calf almost to the knee. These will give greater comfort and reduce/eliminate any irritation to the flesh on the leg.Everybody needs boots like these, sometimes. Like now. There is no guarantee you won't have to face flooding conditions, walk in heavy mud, or deal with slush everywhere all winter. These will keep your regular leather shoes and boots from being ruined - at little cost, too! RECOMMENDED.

I am a runner and have worn the "response" for the past three years. It has great cushion, stability and a wider toe box than other brands. I haven't had a blister in years! The breathable mesh keeps my feet cool on long runs and they last - I've put over 800 miles on this latest pair.

I bought these for a four-week vacation in which these were the only shoes I could use as I travel very light. I bought the sandals because they looked well ventilated, they are waterproof and based on the price should be well constructed.Pros: The foot bed conforms to your feet over a periodThey are very comfortable even when walking for several miles over uneven surfaces.They are well constructed and show no wear after walking 300+ miles.Cons: The toe cap will make your toes sweatThey dry very slowly and should not be considered if you are in and out of water... unless you are ok with your feet being wet for 4+ hours.They hold on to odor. After 4 or 5 days, I needed to wash the shoes every evening due to the smell (and they were never fully dry in morning after 8+hours of drying). I have owned Birkenstocks, Tevas and other sandals and never had the same level of issues with odor.These are ok sandals but I wouldn't buy them again.

Resists moisture really well. My feet have stayed dry during snowy/wet weather. Only time will tell about summer time wear on hot and rainy days. However, it's taking longer than I had anticipated for the instep to break in, so my feet feel a bit tired by the end of my work day. Other than that, it's a great boot.
I have been ordering this shoe for my wife for years and she will wear nothing else for comfort and fit
Great purchase -- good price, easy. what more could you want.

With these boots I've walked through floods, traversed slums, worked with the poor, did some constructions, worked at farms, as a humanitarian all across Asia Pacific this past year. Let me tell you these boots have been through some tough conditions and they still look and feel good after a little over a year of rugged use. Sole is still in tack and the laces are still in good condition, the outer wear looks just as it did when I bought it with a few rugged battle dings from my volunteer work.One of the highlighted features of the boot is the waterproof claim, and at feet level right bellow the laces it's able to do just that. I tested this beyond typical conditions if you will...After some heavy weather I was volunteering at a farm and a rain catcher needed draining, except its drain was clogged and it wasnt visible enough to pull out due to build up, so we had to manually bucket out the water. While some of the local farmers had rain boots on, many of the volunteers had none and were warned not to enter the pool because the water probably harbored some diseases. Realizing I had the "waterproof" plate bellow the bootlace I decided to test it out, and it worked! After several hours of standing in water helping clear out the rain catcher my feet were completely dry! (at one point I thought water had seeped in but later found out the water was just cooling off the shoe) Of course anything above the waterproof logo would seep in, its just commonsense after that since the lacing is open.In terms of style, it looked awesome when I bought it (got the "charcoal" one), and the minor dings I got from my volunteer work just added more value to it.I have since bestowed on it the title of my "World Proof Boots"If you don't have a pair, you're missing out in a world of action my friend!

Budget Jungle Boots Avalible From "[...]" - Constant wetness is the main problem in the jungle, with the need for ankle support and protection from sharp sticks and rocks. With rubber soles, these boots keep out water from damp ground while allowing the feet to breath through the canvas uppers. After wading a river, the action of walking squirts water out of special steel vents in the instep. The cleats are wide and deep for good grip on wet ground. This is very good boots!
The shoes were not the size that I thought I was ordering. I wanted a women's size. These will be sent back.

I'm in my forties and I should note that most people of my age grew up thinking of Mizuno as a "speciality sport" shoe. When I started wearing Wave Riders four years ago, the comments I got from friends were along the lines of "I thought they made baseball [or volleyball] shoes."But, trust me: Mizuno makes great running shoes. The Wave Rider is - in my mind - the best 'cushion' shoe on the market today. With this seventh generation release of the model, Mizuno demonstrates it understands three important things about running shoes:- Most runners want a good high-mileage shoe for under $100. [The Wave Rider has stayed under $90 retail for all seven model releases.]- When runners find a shoe they like, they get ripped when the company either drops the model or radically re-imagines it for the next release. The Wave Rider has been incrementally tweaked and improved over the years, but the basic shoe remains the same.- I'm a runner. I don't want a hip, street shoe where style is first, running mechanics second. The Wave Rider is where it ought to be on the spectrum: there's a nod towards style, but I don't feel like a fashion victim.One sizing note: I traditionally take an 11 in all other types of shoes, but I need an 11.5 for the Wave Rider. That's been very consistent throughout the years.

I was a little more than disappointed to see "Made In China" in these boots (I was led to believe that Justin were all Made in the USA, and that's part of the reason I bought these). I don't remember exactly how long I have owned my first pair of these boots but I know they are at least 6 to 7 years old and still going strong. They have been my daily wear boots for at least 5 of those years and have seen hundreds if not over a thousand miles. They are by far the most comfortable boots I have ever owned. The square toes give you plenty of room and the insoles are perfect. The soles are finally wearing through but are definitely still good enough for daily use. I use them for everything from hiking in the summer to snow blowing in the winter. I apply waterproofing (sno-seal) once a year and I have never gotten wet feet. I intend on using my new boots as more formal boots while still using my old ones for daily use. I simply cannot say enough good things about these boots!!!!

I hike several days a week all year in rough mountain terrain, much of it off-trail and over rocks. I've gone through several pairs of these Hi-Tec Altitude boots over the years. The factory supplied insoles are comfortable initially, but are made of a compressible closed cell foam that eventually does not rebound from compression well after some months of use. When the foam becomes compressed, the padded effect is lost and my feet begin to hurt. This can be solved by purchasing and installing an aftermarket pair of insoles such as the Sole Softec Ultra foodbeds, or another quality insole.This problem is not exclusive to Hi-Tec, as I've seen it with other boots and running shoes also. Some aftermarket insoles/footbeds are made of resilient material that does not tend to stay compressed with heavy use. I am not sure why the manufacturers of boots and shoes don't just use suitable footbeds in the first place, but I assume that they save a little money by doing what they do.Aside from the poor insoles, the boots themselves are comfortable, keep my feet warm in fairly cold weather even though they are not insulated, and the soles provide good traction.

I've been doing ballet-style workout DVDs at home lately, and wanted a pair of ballet shoes to use for those workouts so that I'd have better grip and support. I can't speak to how well these work for ballet classes, but I thought that my review might help others like me who are buying these for the same reason.Based on some reviews, I ended up ordering these at first one size larger than what I usually wear in my street shoes. The 8.5 that I bought (instead of my usual 7.5) were huge, but (thanks, Amazon, for your great return policy), I returned these and ordered a 7.5, which fit perfectly.The ribbon at the front of the shoe can be pulled tight to adjust the width of them, and they are very comfortable. They don't have a split sole on the bottom; instead, the sole is one long piece that stretches down the length of the shoe.If you're looking for some at-home ballet-style workouts, I also recommend Mary Helen Bowers'Ballet Beautiful: Total Body WorkoutandBallet Beautiful: Body Blastand Leah Sarago's four workouts, especially her newest oneBallet Body Signature Series: Total Body. All of these are a lot of fun to do, and make me feel like a ballerina!

I started wearing these shoes when I was 19. Five years later, I've gone through two pairs (about to buy my third), but they've been my one and only pair of shoes. I've worn them for nearly 12 hours a day, every single day, year-round, working at a job during the day that requires constant movement, and then walking around the city at night. You can't really tell by looking at them that they've been literally everywhere with me. They could use a bit of a polish, but other than that, nothing's worn down. I suppose if I wore more shoes, I would only need one pair of these, and they'd last longer. But thats not stopping me.

I have made these shoes my summer shoes the last 5 years, one pair white, one pair brown. Love this since I can just slip them on and go. Good enough for my work and great for casual. After wearing these shoes for a couple of weeks I think they are descent.They felt a little low around the ankle at first but I dont notice that any more. Soles are very quiet and have good flex. I walk a lot and find that the inserts dont have great cushion but may be alright for others.

This pair of converse was just what I expected; they were one my son's Christmas presents. The colors available were more varied than those I'd seen in local stores and the price was better. This item arrived sooner than promised, too. Needless to say, my son was pleased.

Alone. On the streets of Playa, searching for size 5 Pampers, I longed for refreshment and inspiration. Spotting a corner bodega, I determined that a cervaza was the only remedy. After making my purchase and setting out renewed on my mission, I realized my fatal error. The cap did not twist off. Distraught, I accepted it was not meant to be...it was then that I remembered the hidden church key in the bottom of my Fanning Sandals (Men Sizes 4-15). My mission and my faith were saved.

I've gone through three pairs of these shoes in the last decade. Yes! Ten years! I'm about to turn 29 years old and got my first pair at the end of high-school from a friend. The second pair is still with me and has worn all the way through the sole but they are still comfortable and very wearable. IMHO there isn't a better casual styled shoe out there in terms of comfort, retro style and look.I will admit that I have fairly flat feet, and the slight lack of support might be part of what makes these a little more comfortable for me.In my opinion, for fifty bucks or less depending on where you buy them, getting three to four years out of a pair of shoes is simply awesome. And I don't own a bunch of shoes I wear these every day!

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE these boots! They are absolutely the most comfy boots I've ever owned! Cute AND perfect for tromping around the hills on the farm. I had a perfect pair of boots back when I was about 12 or 13 -- loved them like crazy and wore them til they fell apart. No boots have ever compared -- 'til now!! Thank you Ariat. These have quickly become my daily go-to shoes. In fact, the last three days, I have planned my outfits so I could wear the boots! :)
I love these so much. When my last pair died, I bought them here. When that pair dies, I'll buy more. I hope they never stop making them.
Great purchase! Great service! Great delivery! my boyfriend was very happy with his present. Thank you for making it so easy

I have owned these boots for several years now. They fit well, are quite comfortable, and seem watertight. However, about 1 year ago I was on a hiking trip in Costa Rica. We were on a trail that needed to cross several streams to reach a waterfall. The guide took one look at my boots and told me I would have problems because several past clients had slipped on the wet rocks in similar boots. Other brands of hiking boots did not have the same problems. I noted that anytime you have water and rocks together there are potential problems of slipping, especially if there is moss. Thus, I discounted the warning. Later, at one of the waterfalls it was necessary to step on several wet stones. I found that my boots could not get any kind of grip on the slick rocks. I had never experienced anything so slick. The others in my party did not have the same problems. I usually am one of the most sure-footed hikers, but these boots made it feel like walking on ice in dress shoes. I finally had to take off my boots and go barefoot, which did not pose the same problem of slipping. One of the other men in the group told me that he was a pilot in the US Air Force and that in his squadron these Hi-Tec boots had been prohibited because there were too many injuries coming in and out of the cargo planes when it was wet. Ironically, even though these boots seem to be waterproof, you would not want to use them in a wet area that could also be slick. They seem to work fine on rough ground, even when wet. Finally, after wearing these boots for several seasons (primarily when I am outside in snow and slush), they have developed some very annoying squeaks. So, it is embarrassing walking in a group because my boots make so much noise. Otherwise, these boots have been fine.

This is a funny shoe. The bottom is flat,with no arch on the outside ( the inside arch is well developed) and the toes curls up. Works well running but feels odd walking. Works well for me, a heavy runner, and has held up well. Big toe box and true to or slightly large for size.
I bought the Eurelle Slippers for my husband's birthday. They arrived quicker than I expected. He loves them and wears them every day.

My wife says it's a very comfortable shoe but a bad color, and she asked why they don't make it in classic white. She also asked why Reebok doesn't make more women's shoes in a size 10.5, which is large enough to accommodate her orthotics as well as socks. Reebok has been her favorite manufacturer for years and she's sorry to have to start buying from others now that she has to buy a larger size than in the past. All in all, however, she says they fit very well, are light enough and are a great product for a very reasonable price.
Unfortunately these run a bit tight. Length is fine but width is actually tight. I wish I could fix this issue but I really do not want to have to send these back...

I have several pairs of these and have poor balance and a bum foot. This allows me to walk my dog in the park on days I would never have before. These are some of the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn. They are great for work and I do lots of walking every day. Slip on is practical and stylish. i loved my old ipaths. i used to get a leather aligator designed black ipaths that dont exist anymore? i got them mainly for the pockets and i thoughts all or most had them and yet these dont? im kinda disapointed cause i have other shoes but i guess an extra pair. they look nice tho but NO POCKETS!!!
Boots great, arrived timeley and price was as good as found anywhere. I will buy here agaion in the future.

These are great light weight boots. They keep your feet warm, but not hot. I wear them ever day, and they required no break in period and were quite comfortable right out of the box. One word of advice...these boots are sized smaller than I expected. If you wear a size 10, I would consider ordering a size 11. Other than that, they're just what the Dr. ordered.

I really like these shoes. I've been wearing store brand knock-offs for ages and I finally got a pair of proper all-stars and I'm so freakin' happy. They're more flexible and comfortable than I expected and I'd say these are comfortable enough to jog in - if I every jogged :P. But yeah, great shoes, and for this price they're totally worth it.I feel like Dwight from Sin City when I wear these xD.

Already have Chucks in white, which I wore for the b-ball team in high school...yeah, when Chucks were the shoes to be wearin'!! Decided to re-live days of Sandlot Black PF Flyers with the magic wedge, make you run faster, jump higher! But when I got them, they were about a 1/3 size too small and the shoes felt uneven (one bigger than the other, both still tight). Thought I could wear them in and couldn't. Chalked up to a loss. After much research I found the (Campus) Frye Boots I wanted on Amazon. I did a lot of price checking and found the boots for $236.00 instead of $299.00. What a great deal! The Hi-Tec Men's Altitude waterproof hiker has out performed more expense boots I have owned. With the December snow storm in the east,it was a great test. I gave my old Hi-Tec hikers to my son because he liked them so much. That's why I purchase another pair.

I bought these boots to replace my three year old boots that I had bought to replace my summer weight non waterproof boots that I still have and use if I know water won't be involved. All the boots I have bought in the last 5 years have been Hi-Tec. They fit and feel like a sneaker once you get them broken in. I am in the process of breaking these new ones in, it has only been two days so they are still a little stiff. I figure that by next week I will be good to go in these. I use these for work, daily wear, hiking, walking, walking in rain, steeping in streams, walking in snow, mowing the lawn, using the snowblower, snowshoeing, and they work great with my yak-trax when I walk on ice. The only reason I replaced my old ones is because they were starting to leak water when I submerged them for more than a few seconds. Great boots, I don't regret any pair of Hi-Hec's I ever bought.1/23/12 UPDATE! I am now on pair number 4 of these boots and I will say that while these are every bit as good at protecting my foot as every pair of Hi-Tec boots I have owned there was a down side this time. It has taken over two weeks of daily wear to get these broken in, and they still need a little more work. Mostly they are tight in the ankle area but softening. I really like the boots, but over two weeks to break in is a little much.

What else can I say? Converse's Chuck Taylor High-Tops have been tried and true for decades. They are comfortable, fun and in my case, red. I am 51 years young and I receive more compliments on these shoes than any other item of apparel that I own. Love them.

They look cute - although the toes are a little too pointy for my taste - and the colors are pretty. They fit well. However, the rubber soles on these shoes squeak horribly on my wood floors with every step! I wouldn't buy these again for this reason.

The bag is great quality. It's just as cute in person. If it gets dirty, I can empty it and throw it in the wash. The inside has two pockets on one side (great for keys and my phone) and a zippered pocket on the other side. I originally bought this to carry in addition to my smaller Bungalow360 bag for notebooks. It does fit my 3 ring binder in it quite well.If you are looking for a cute bag for school or day to day, this is it!

I've been riding with this pair of shoes for about a month now and I have nothing but good things to say. They are stiff, light, comfortable, and breathable (which is a great thing if you are going to ride in say California, but not so much fun during the winter in Boston). The Velcro straps are very secure and keep the shoe on tight for the entire ride. I've taken the shoes out on trails numerous times and they still look like new - great durable material. I've tried them with the Time ATAC pedals and the Shimano m540 pedals. As you would expect, both worked great as well. If you're looking for a good shoe that will last, I'd recommend this one.

This is the second Converse Low Top I bought this week because of sizing error(my fault). I ordered a size 10 in Mens the first time because I'm a legit size 10.5 Mens in every other shoe I wear. The shoes were received quickly by mail and the quality is great. When I tried them on, I had a good amount of space inside the shoes to move my toes which was too much for me. These size 9.5 shoes are a perfect fit. The sellers advice is spot on about sizing. Order 1 size down from your usual shoe size if you want a good fit. Other than that, these shoes are great for casual walking and weight training. I use them for dead lifting and squatting. Definitely recommend these shoes to anyone!
My son loves the boots. Seem to keep his feet dry even on rainy and snowy days. These are durable all-purpose boots.

I love this shoe because it is dressy, classy and comfortable...and a flat. I search extensively for the shoe with the proper look to wear with my suits. This shoe is it!! In addition to coming in various colors -- it comes with a patent tip/heel. And did I say comfortable? There is no traditional break-in period. The shoe just molds itself to your foot (soft leather). A must have.
These shoes fit me just fine. Of course I had to buy it one size down which is typical for converse shoes, but otherwise I have nothing to complain about.

I switched out my military issue jump boots for a pair of these Bate's zip-sided Enforcers. The construction is solid, and the cushioning is greatly superior to that in a standard issue military boots. If you've never worn boots with a zipper, I highly recommend them. The zipper makes getting out the door much easier. I do not know whether or not I would deploy without a backup pair of boots. If the zipper were to fail on these (in a deployed environment), you'd have a heck of a time keeping them on your feet. For stateside use (e.g. everyday Police use), they are a great boot.

LAST CHRISTMAS I ORDERED THIS BOOT AND NOW THIS YEAR THE PRICE HAS DOUBLED. I AM WISHING THAT I HAD ORDERED MORE THAN ONE PAIR. I WILL ORDER ANOTHER PAIR THIS YEAR. I LIKE THE SOLES AND HEELS ON THIS BOOT BECAUSE THEY LAST LONGER THAN MOST AND THIS IS THE FINEST LOOKING DRESS BOOT MADE AS FAR AS I AM CONCERNED. IT IS THE MOST COMFORTABLE BOOT THAT I HAVE FOUND. YOU WILL GET SOME RESPECT WHEN YOU ARE SEEN IN THESE BOOTS. THESE BOOTS ARE "BOSS" TO SAY THE LEAST.
I love, love, love these sandals, they are the most comfortable sandals I have ever worn. Wish I could find them in more colors!

I've never been much of one for fancy shoes. Sure, I love the way they look, but I end up wearing them once, then stowing them to the ever-growing stash in the bottom of my closet.When I bought this shoe in the blushing bride/heather color last fall from a catalog, I expected another candidate for that stack in my closet. A shoe with the playful, sporty, yet somehow feminine details of this one simply isn't practical...right?Then they came and I tried them on.I hate to admit it, but I am now a Puma athletic shoe addict. Every pair is sporty and trendy, yet has a classical styling that is somehow sophisticated and traditional. They work for me because they're pracitcal enough to go running in, but stylish enough to wear with jeans or a sporty minidress.There's not much else to say. These are the most comfortable cute shoes I've ever had, plain and simple. They are, by far, the most versatile shoes I've ever owned. BUY THEM!

These shoes were counterfit. I own a real pair of these shoes.The interior lining was different, the impression on the bottom of the sole was different and the top of the shoe was not reinforced with extra canvas to give them dimensional stability. The elastic on the side of the shoe was not up to the quality of the real shoes.
