these shoes are jst simply phenomenal. the way they feel on your feet are jst great. so comfortable, durable, and good looking.i would definately recommend these shoes ot anyone who adores bowling.

I bought these at the same time I bought a pair of Nike Basketball shoes.. both in size 12.5, I used the sizing guide on Eastbay to confirm the size I should buy. The Nike are a perfect fit, however these Adidas are way too small, and it is a very narrow shoe..The size is more like an 11 or 10.5, and the regular width is more like a narrow fit..Great looking shoe, very lightweight - just watch your sizing when you order this. I'd go at least a size larger, and a wide width if avaiable.
comfy, and durable.. great for running around. really like the soft pliable suede.gray if warm. but fashionable, really nice shoe
Bought these for Christmas for my 13 year old daughter and they were a huge hit.

This is a warm and beautiful boot at a great sale price, but the fit is too snug on the top of the foot just under the ankle strap. The leg part of the boot aroung the ankle strap is cut narrowly; thus, even with thin socks and the buckle unfastened on the ankle strap, the fit on the top of my foot was too tight. Lesson learned: Buy shoes/boots ONLY after trying them on first no matter how beautiful and well-priced.
We weren't sure what size to get, and they are a little big. However, my son is only 11 and still growing, so we intentionally bought big. Overall very happy.

After I got the right size these where the most comfortable dress shoes. I don't dance I just wanted a pair of dress shoe that I could actually walk in. I had to get a whole size larger then my normal tennis shoes. I normally where a 9 But I had to get a 10. I first got a 9.5 but they were just a bit to small. Unfortunately the company has a restocking fee which make sending them back cost almost as much as the shoes. So do yourself a favor and get a whole size larger.
this is the best shoe I have ever bought. I love them and will never go back to pumas or addiadas ever!

Thank you for sending this fast and correct! These are my daughter's favorite shoes and when her old pair finally got holes in the soles she put these on her Birthday list. She unwrapped them and immediately they were on her feet!

I got this on sale for a really good price. I have always been a fan of Adidas shoes but I thought I gave Converse a try for the good price. Currently, I also wear Adidas Team MAC 2, which I bought for a few dollars more than the Converse. The Team MAC 2 defnitely has much better feel and support, especially when landing after a jump. I have worn Nike, Reebok and other brands of basketball shoes of about the same price and the support provided by the Converse is only average. For example, the tongue of the Converse is thin while the Adidas is breathable mesh and much thicker. I feel like I am wearing a cheap, store brand basketball shoes with the Converse. Don't let the ICON system fool you, it doesn't do anything special and is no comparison to Adidas's AdiPRENE+, Torsion System and A3 Structure. In my opinion, Adidas has the best fit, feel and support for about the same price. I currently own 4 pairs of basketball shoes and one pair of running shoes. All are Adidas with A3 or AdiPRENE+. All are remarkably comfortable. I know, but they were all on sale for very low prices. So I stocked up.

These boots have that classic hiking boot style to them. The NuBuck leather looks great and the boots are comfortable and seem well made. I'm not really a hiker. I just like to wear hiking boots in the winter and these are perfect so far. I wear them everyday and I like them so much, I was thinking of ordering another pair!

I have never gotten a pair of character shoes before, so I thought they were going to be sooo uncomfortable and hard to dance in like regular high heeled shoes. They were sooo comfortable. I wore them out first and my feet were not in dire pain when I got home. Instead of half a size difference from my street shoe I got a whole size difference, which worked well. They are comfortable and easy to dance in. I definitely recommend them for a short dance for a beginner.
Comfortable, easy care and great for traveling. I have several pair and recommend them to all of my friends. Love the color selection and thrilled that they can be washed.

this is the second pair of softspots, but this pair the leather is not as soft it is stiff, and hopefully will be more comfortable when I break them in. The other pair exactly the same that I had purchased years earlier was and is so soft.

First I like the boots, but I have calf's that are larger than 14"s. That is why I ordered a lager size. They fitted fine, but when I was removing them the zippers got jammed and on one I had to destroy the zipper to get it off and the other I was able to remove with the zipper still jammed. I whish they made a boots that are not all the way to below the knee. I do superhero costumes and I like the range of colors they have. I would to liked to know more information on getting boots for a larger calf's I am not the only person that has this problem and now I may have to order a second pair of boots to replace the ones that got damaged.
Have two daughters and both have a this boot. Is well made stylish and holds up to wear and tear. Older daughter has had hers almost 2 years and still fashionable and little wear.

I have had several pair of these in the last 25 years or so. These are so comfy, no break in time required. I'd like to see more fashion colors, though. I'd love to have pairs in turquoise, bright yellow, orange, kelly green, hot pink, etc. I wear these with slacks and tailored skirts, even certain dresses. They are very soft and comfy, durable, and make your foot look very small. I can't recommend them strongly enough to anyone who needs to be on thier feet a great deal, or who has foot problems, or who simply wants a sturdy-but-stylish walking shoe.
This is the third pair that I have purchased.Drew is a great company and their shoes are the best that I have ever had.

This is my 3rd pair of Modi's they are soo comfortable and I think stylish. I would normally have given a 5 star rating but this particular pair is a little smaller then previous purchases of the same size.

A classic wedge, good value. only complaint- sole should be wider for a wider foot. The leather upper fits well, but you feel like you are balancing on a standard medium width wedge. Comfortable shoe for work/walking.

I love all the sexy and high-heeled shoes out there, but as we age, they are not as suitable as when we were young (and even then probably not). This style of Naot is somewhat magical - I've had many compliments, such as, they look like ballerina shoes, funky, stylish, classy, versatile - can wear them with pants or skirts. They've become my signature shoe - I have two pair in different colours. I can walk for miles in these shoes, they are that comfortable. I highly recommend them.

My son seems to like these, but I don't know if they are worth the amount I paid for them. They are made somewhat like those cheap shower flip flops. I'm afraid the strap will come loose and tear through from the bottom of the flip flops. They do bend easily though and are comfortable. I don't think that if I had seen these in the store, I would of purchased them.

If you have narrow feet that don't fit regular thongs very well, this could be the flip flop for you. Though these are slightly different from typical flops, they are close enough. They have more than the single strap on each side of your foot, which I think makes them look nicer. What's more important is that they fit better.This is my second pair. The first pair died at the hands or should I say teeth of a puppy. lol Now that she's older I think this pair is safe. I sure hope so because I love these so much. Just the perfect go to shoe for summer.

I have this walking sandal in white and tan, as well as the black ones I recently purchased from Amazon.com. They fit great and are very comfortable for all day wear. I wear a size 13 N, and it's difficult to find shoes, so I was pleased to find them on Amazon.com. Another plus was Amazon's price was much less than where I'd purchased the other two pair.

Right off the bat. These shoe's are as light as a feather and perfect for what I bought them for.. Parkour. Although they may have been made for 'Tia Chi', they make excellent shoes for Parkour and Free Running. They are light, grip really well, and have a thin sole that allows you to really 'feel the ground'..... However, if you plan on getting these shoes there's something you should know about the sizing. I was very confused and scared about ordering a size 11 when I range from 10.5-11.5..... I figured I'd be safe ordering in the middle, but I should've gone with 10.5. They still fit perfectly fine, but I have some toe room. Which I didn't really want. So I was extremely angry at shoe companies for being so inconsistent with sizing, 10.5 converse, 11 Vans, 11.5 in a lot of other shoes. These shoe sizes would most compare closest to Converse. So If you own a pair of chuck taylors, then use that shoe size as a guide. I wish more people on Amazon clarified the sizing. Either way, a little toe room or not, I'm still able to do what I want in these shoes and happily. You get a pair of these, you'll feel as agile as Uma Thurman in the Kill Bill trilogy.
Converse Unisex Chuck Taylor All Star Plaid Hi SneakerGreat shoes at a great price! My daughter loves them :)
I love the design it is unique. It a must have for soccer players this boots are well made and you must get one.
They were good shoes. I love Adidas but they shoes were not to comfortable. I might have thought and should of thought about it twice before I purchased them, but good in style and very light.

I'M A RETURNING USER OF THIS PRODUCT, HAVE WORN THIS BRAND, AND STYLE OF HI-TEC HIKING BOOT FOR SEVERAL YEARS. THE SHOE IS BOTH LONG WEARING, WITH ANKLE SUPPORT. I WORK OUTDOORS, IN WINTER WEATHER, SUMMER HEAT, AND RAIN. GOOD PRODUCT FOR THE PRICE. WILL BUY AGAIN. CHARLIE W.

I grew up wearing Clarks shoes. And had forgotten how comfortable they actually are. Well, i received my shoes today, put them on, and was immediately reminded. These shoes are terrific! Amazon should have a category for people who are thoroughly satisfied with any given product. For anyone looking for total comfortability and style, you cannot (repeat, CANNOT!) go wrong with these shoes. I was so satisfied, i purchased another pair (different kind though). Amazon gets props for such a speedy delivery.Tarikh Bandele.
These shoes are comfortable and keep my feet and legs from aching on the days I stand and walk on concrete floors all day long. Great shoe!

These are the most comfortable walking shoes going. I have had many pairs over the years and love every one. However, occasionally some sales clerk will convince me that they have something better. I buy...I'm sorry and then I get another pair of Prowalkers. They are light and you can wear them forever without that tight heavy feeling that so many "walking" shoes get.
These fit my daughter perfectly! I recommend these! Nice flexible leather on the outside and soft flowery print inside. True to size.
We received the sneakers rapidly. They were just what we ordered and at a better price than I could find in the store.
I always wore birk's, but a friend told me about crocs and I have worn nothing else. The help my feet and my low back problems.
Shoes are great. 15 minutes after I ordered the shoes (literally) they went on sale, $5 less. I could not change my order. I would have to wait until I received them then return them. Disappointed.
It took a long time to find the best walking shoe. This is it. You put them on and there is no breaking them in. Comfortable from the first step. Highly recommend!

These are some good quality slip-ons, I've had for about 5-6 months now and they have been great for me. When you first get them you might be skeptical but give them a try like I did and they'll probably end up being something you want to wear almost every day. Style matches the "dress casual" look I'm always trying to achieve.Fit is good, leather is good quality and holds a decent polish but doesn't scuff that easily easily. The shoe is comfortable without any fancy insoles or sole, lightweight and just flexible enough when you're on your feet a fair amount. I even wore them one time while I was moving some boxes for about 3-4 hours because I accidentally forgot to bring a change of sneakers with me. This was after wearing them the entire day at work.Pretty good deal even though they're made in China. Definitely more comfortable than the squared toe lace-ups with hard soles from Nordstrom Rack I had been wearing and quality is about the same. They take a while to break in for some reason, but once you do they will feel like you've had them all along and the cushioned sole, while not impressive to look at when you first see them, is ideal. I expect to get at least 2 years out of them as I do with almost all shoes I've owned (with some light care), even through wearing them at least 3x a week.

I have 2 pairs of this model shoe and love them. After being a Nike fan for years I decided to give something else a try. This shoe is lightweight and very comfortable. I also love the classic style. And you can't complain about the nice price.
These shoes are comfortable and require almost no breakin period. They are a good value for the money and i would buy them again

What a disapointment. Bought them a few times in the past. The only thing that hasn't changed is the look and name. They are a total misfit and give no support. I guess Rockport doesn't care what it sells.
These are the ONLY shoes I've wanted this tear, and i found them here for the best price, after browsing the malls

I previously gave these shoes 5 stars but now have to take back 1. There seems to be a re-design of the tongue and it had been a quite-painful break-in period. The tongue corners poked into my ankles for about 2 weeks. I would pull the tongues up and they stopped hurting but only for a few steps, then they were back to in-pain-position. It took over a week for the corners to soften up enough that they weren't so irritating; another week and the shoes were comfortable. I've gone through 4 or 5 pairs of these shoes over the years, these were the first to hurt; previous pairs took only a 1-day break-in period. I had sworn these shoes off during those painful break-in days but now would buy them again, but will do something to soften up those tongue corners.
I enjoy them every time I wear them. Comfortable, sporty and hip enough so that my daughter's friends actually listen to me.

These shoes fit!I wear a 10.5, I bought a 10.5, and I can honestly say that I've never worn a pair of shoes that fit this perfectly, just like a 10.5 should. From the heel to the toe, adidas has managed to craft a shoe that not only fits, but supports and protects my feet like no other.I've had these shoes for over three months now; I've run hundreds of miles in them, worked out regularly, and occasionally just worn them around town/base. They've aged on the outside like any shoe would, but where the quality of these kicks really shines is the durability of the support and megabounce system. Usually, with what I put shoes through, I'd expect very little from them at this point in their life, but these have really impressed. On a 10 point scale, they're still performing at an 8+.The bottom line: I'm an expert wearer of shoes, and these are the best shoes I've ever worn. Very much worth the price.

Here are the detailed features from the shoe manufacturer:1. The pinnacle high mileage-training shoe that yields the ultimate blend of cushioning and stability through ASICS proprietary I.G.S. technology.2. Impact Guidance System (I.G.S.) combines all ASICS components to direct the foot from heel-to-toe, allowing a more natural gait.3. Lateral rearfoot flex grooves provide rearfoot shock attenuation at initial impact.4. Full-Length SpEVA midsole material for increased shock attenuation and midsole durability.5. Two density trusstic links the rearfoot and forefoot and maintains midfoot support.6. GEL Cushioning System provides maximum rearfoot and forefoot shock attenuation.I have been using these shoes for several months now and here are my feelings toward the shoe:1. Little bit narrower and smaller than the size and width of the show suggest. So always buy a bit larger. I have a slight wider feet so I chose the 2E size and it fits great.2. Cushing is good even though the shoe is mainly for stability (many stability running shoe has the problem of stiffness in the heel area).3. The front part of shoe (inside area) press slight against the feet when running so if this is the first time you use this kind of shoe (I used Asics 990 before) this may take sometime for your feet to breakin for the slightly uncomfortable feeling initially (after several running sessions, the feeling should be ok).4. Very good ventilation at the front part. Your feet won't overheat.5. Don't buy at 100$ price range. I bought it at Zappos, which has sale on this item (you need to find out your exact size since your size may be sold out) and I got them for around 50$. This is a great price for such great shoes.

Pretty to look at and wonderful to wear. No worries here about cold feet and feels luxurious. You ask, what would I need these in Hawaii for? We have snow here too! I would recommend these to anyone who wants it all, warm, comfortable and good looks.
i like this type of shoes, i'm very glad that i bought this pair, i wear this shoes, and i'm lucky ))

this is my first time ordering shoes from this site last time i ordered some shoes from a different site and they were nothing like they previewed on the site anyway i'm ordering now and i'll complete my review when i get the shoe so everyone will know if the companies full of it or not peace

I find this pair of Reebok running shoes to be of excellent quality. They are very comfortable and cushion the shock of walking. I am past the running age, so I need a good foundation and arch support. The price was right also. Reebok is the best name in sport shoes in my estimation. Thank you. I hope this helps.

I looove these shoes. They are supper comfy and match with pretty much anything. You can get cheaper rip off ones at target or payless but they have ugly childish disgnes on them and get damaged allot easier.

i ordered the traditional black converse just three days ago and i just got them in the mail today! they came in my mailbox, from usps, and had the slim converse box. the shoes were in perfect condition and were the correct size and color that i ordered. very great service and impecable shipping speed. i definently will buy from this seller again and i highly recommend shopping with this seller! :)
Was bought as a Christmas Gift. He enjoys them because of the material your feet can breathe much better.

I've ordered another style of Easy Spirit walking shoes and loved those as they fit great and need no breaking in period.... I love it when I can wear a shoe straight out of the box with no problems.This time around I decided to give the Easy Spirit Jumper style a try due the deep discounted price and good reviews. The Easy Spirit Jumper walking shoes took time to break in and were tight feeling across the top of my feet at first. I have a high arch, so this may have been why I experienced the tightness when I fist began wearing them.Also, the Easy Spirit Jumper looks a bit fuddy-duddy and not very stylish looking, but for the price I decided to keep them.

I purchased these shoes for my mom for my upcoming wedding and she just loves them. She says they are very comfortable and will have love use of them in the future. They are well constructed and have a very good width to them. i would purchase them myself and would recommend them to anyone who wants a quality and comfortable shoe.

I just purchased my third pair of Bonnie Lites and own wine, black and taupe. I have knee problems and a hard insole really hurts my knees. The Bonnie Lites are well padded and like walking on pillows. Stylish and comfortable!
Stylish design. Light Weight. Steeltoes bend awkwardly. It's true; you get what you pay for.

My son is on his feet from the time he gets to work until he clocks out. He crosses multiple surfaces so a shoe with good traction is a must have. He also has a very wide foot so finding all the above can be difficult.I've been a fan of Skechers since I bought my first pair five years ago. When I suggested he try this brand, though hesitant, he found them in the wide width he needed, dark, as required by work. He was sold on them the day he came home bragging about how for the first time in how long, he can't remember, his feet did not hurt him. It's now three months later and this is what he's asking for us to get him for Christmas. I've always found Sketchers a well made shoe with unique styles and good soles for those on the go. I would recommend Skechers brand to anyone.
My husband loves these shoes and they are getting increasingly harder to find. These are the best! I ususally order two pair at a time

The shoe that I received looked fine, but it did not fit as well as the one it replaced that I purchased in a brick and mortar store. It seemed a bit larger. I did not realize until I had worn it out a few times that the width was W (wide) and not M (medium) the size that I ordered. I will keep them and hope that with socks they will be ok. I have never ordered shoes by mail, because I did not want to have to go through the return process if something was not right. Unfortunately, it happened the first time and I didn't even realize that the order was filled incorrectly. This order was not fulfilled by Amazon, but by Shoebuy. I buy a lot from Amazon and will continue. Though, I do not think I will buy clothes or shoes by mail anymore.

I enjoy walking 2 miles everyday at lunchtime at work with my colleague, and I thought these shoes would be great for that purpose because they're cute, stylish, AND functional. Before that, I'd put on my old running shoes just for the lunch walk. I thought I could save maybe 5 minutes by not having to switch to another pair.Well, it turns out that as cute and comfortable as these shoes are, they're not really made for walking. Walking around work and going shopping in them was fine, but walking just 2 miles in them ended up hurting my feet because of the lack of arch support.I still wear these cute shoes to work, but I now change into my running shoes for the lunch walk. Not everyone may have the same problem, but I have neutral feet and a normal arch, and it still hurt me, so I thought I'd put in my $0.02.

This is my third pair of these shoes purchased over the past 4 years. I now have azure, natural, and black and wear them all summer long. It's very hard to find summer casual shoes that come in narrow widths, and these are very comfortable as well as versatile. You can wear them with shorts or casual skirts. When I can find them, I wear a 9.5AAAA in dress shoes. A 9AA in the Trinidads fits great.

I REALLY LIKE THE LOOKS AND COMFORT OF THESE SHOES . HOWEVER , THEY ARE IMPROPERLY SIZED . I WEAR A 12D AND THIS SHOE IS ABOT 1/2 TO 1 SIZE LARGER THAN A 12 . WHEN PLACED HEEL TO TOE WITH ANY SHOE THAT I OWN , THEY ARE MUCH LONGER . A FRIEND MADE A COMMENT ON THER LENGTH .
This number is absolute comfort for walking.....much admired here in New Zealand.

I bought this Converse sneaker in black. These All Star sneakers look stylish and good with any casual pants I own. I would have given the product 5 stars, EXCEPT, these shoes are like walking on bricks since they have no cushion in the soles for the heels. I understand they're supposed to have the whole classic appeal... but if you're over 30 years old and try to rock a pair of Converse for an entire day, you may encounter some uncomfortable lower back pain. So 4 stars for fashion.

I ordered these shoes for my boyfriend and he absolutely loves them. They look great and are true to size. He said he wishes these shoes had more arch support because he has to wear insoles, but that is typical of this particular shoe.
These shoes are very comfortable and durable. They fit very well. Would reccomend them to anyone looking for a comfortable pair of shoes

Wasn't the exact boot pictured, but close enough that I am satisfied enough to not wait for them to be reshipped. The boots are fantastic for dress. Would not use them for any kind of work though. They're thin and suede. Very nice looking and fit perfectly, which is impotant considering I couldn't try them on.

this is the second pair of softspots, but this pair the leather is not as soft it is stiff, and hopefully will be more comfortable when I break them in. The other pair exactly the same that I had purchased years earlier was and is so soft.

I would give it 5 stars but I don't like how white it is and that it has a big logo on it. Functionally it is really great. I bought a timer so that I don't leave it on all the time, but set the timer to come on a few hours before leaving in the morning and then again a few hours before coming home to warm up the slippers!
THE SERVICE IS ALWAYS TOP-NOTCH, SAME AS THE SNEAKERS! I HAVE BEEN BUYING THEM FOR YEARS AND WOULD DEFINATELY RECOMMEND THEM TO ANYONE WHO LIKES COMFORT AND A GOOD PRICE.

I was disappointed after reading all the great reviews on these shoes. I could tell they would be really comfortable when I put them on and stood up, everywhere except the toe box. They are bullet shaped, like many other brands. I think most brands are made for a man's foot- I need a narrow heel and wider, deeper toe box. I really wanted these to work for me but I can't stand shoes that rub against my outer toe area and pinch my toes. I don't have wide feet- in fact they are sort of narrow. But they are definitely not bullet shaped. If I got these in wide they would be too wide throughout the rest of the shoe- so I had to return them.
These shoes are way to expensive. I love the look of them..but really they arn't that comfertable. I think that they need to lower the price!

Just arrived and best described as a slipper.No separate insole or structure. The soles are very narrow so the upper in the D width must hang over the edge. I have been wearing deerskin moccasins for 50 years or so. The quality seems to be going downhill.

Got my third pair of these boots just 3 weeks ago and have been wearing them about 3 times a week and, just like the others I have had in the past, they are already comfortably broken in. Waterproofing has been very good and I re-spray them about once a year. Very good on trail with firm support especially good on rocky conditions. Relatively light weight.

I bought these because I only want zero heel drop shoes to run in. These things have great traction for any type of surface. I've run on the track, the road, and even on the back country of the Carson/Iceberg wilderness in CA. They do what they are intended to do- provide a lightweight fast ride, with little support. These are not the right shoes for heel strike runners as there is about 1/3 the normal amount of cushioning at the heel. I think it's becoming common knowledge now that we all need to not heel strike anyway.The only drawback is that the shoes are not as durable as a heavier shoe, but that's what has to be sacraficed for the weight reduction. I've had them for about 6 weeks and have worn out some of the rubber lugs(does not affect performance or feel) and there is a tiny tear in the fabric on the side. But, like I said, I took them out for a couple of true cross country(miles of off trail) excursions where even hiking boots would have gotton some wear. I've put about 100 miles total on them so far, and will likely get at least 200 more- pretty good for a sub $40 shoe.Overall great shoes, and I plan to purchase some more!
My son wanted either red or green Chuck Taylors which are fairly difficult to find. The shoes I bought arrived quickly, were good quality, and were priced very reasonably.
The product came quickly...at a good price...very happy with the service...so much so...my mother knicked them from me!!

The boots are comfortable and easy to wear. Are not heavy, which was the main reason I was looking to replace my other pair. The boots are durable and appropriate for the snowy winter in Boston. Water does not penetrate them at the bottom. Nice buy!

I like these shoes very much, i have bought over 12 pairs of shoes from amazon, and these rank in my top 3 pairs. Very white, very easy to keep clean. I have wide feet, and these are not tight at all.
I think the shoe is fairly comfortable, but a little too clunky and heavy around the sole area! Eccos are better!

When I first opened the box, I was disgusted. They looked like "old people shoes," but I figured I would try them out anyways, and within a few hours they looked great. Last week I found out that they meet my school's dress code. Since making that discovery, I've been wearing them for eight hours every school day, and they are holding up well, and they are amazingly comfy.You can rock them with jeans, cargo shorts ot khakis.

I just couldn't ask for a better pair of shoe than this. The fit is perfect. The leather uppers are just a jo to behold. They have remained shiny and clean the past 6 months that I have been using them. I am just hooping that French Shriner could come up with more shoe styles to choose from. Also this particular design doesn't come in saddle brown nor tan. Wish they'd make more colors of the design. Just love it!!!

We love the color, very comfortable, my niece just love them. These are high quality product let me tell you :) Order came as I expected, we are so happy with Capezio products :) and amazon has better prices than at the stores, I compared the prices :)
I love these, I fine them very comfortable, no problem to break them in, I have been wearing this brand for the last three year.

This is my fifth pair of ballistic so far. I bought my first ones about 14 years ago and was immediately satisfied with their confort. This is a product of excellent quality that, on average, tends to last more than 3 years without breaking apart. Please, keep in mind that I do use them often and I am not a sedentary person. They are a bit tall compared to other sneakers, but that has never been a problem. Really confortable and highly recommended.

Got the shoes really fast, however they didn't fit. Called the number got the information to verify they had the one I wanted in my size. Returned and got the replacement even faster than the original order. Excellent service. Will definately shop here again.
this shoe is the most comfortable running if have ever had.Thanks

Before I ordered these shoes I was worried over choosing the correct size. The reviews were very up and down on what was the best size to order. I ended up ordering my daughter her street size 9.5 and one size up 10.5 to be sure that one would fit. I also ordered the Ms because my daughter has normal sized feet. Ns are always too narrow. I also measured her foot to make sure that the shoe sizing chart in inches matched with her normal size, before ordering.I ordered them on a Wednesday night and received them by Friday afternoon. I was very surprised and happy about the fast delivery since her ballet class begins next week. The 9.5 ended up fitting the best and they left just a bit of wiggle room for her tiny toes. I plan to keep the 10.5 for when her feet grow. I suggest sizing your child's foot and then comparing it to the size chart. I am very happy with my purchase and think that these ballet slippers will be very useful for her class!

I really found these shoes thrown away; they looked new, so I keptthem. It was several months before I tried them on because theywere a little larger size than I usually wear. Early last summer,I needed a pair of shoes just to ruff around in, so I started towear the ones that I had found. To my surprise, the K.SWISS tennislike shoes were a perfect fit. I have worn them most of the time,and I am amazed at how well they have lasted and how comfortablethey are. I got on the computer just this evening wanting to knowhow expensive they were, and I was amazed at how inexpensive theyare for being such an excellent shoe. I wear the heels out veyquickly on most of my shoes, but these K.SWISS heels are just asgood as the day I found them. I would reccommend them to anyone.For me, this has been a real gift from the Lord, and I am onlysorry that I did not reccognize this long before now or I wouldhave taken much better care of these fine shoes.Henry in Lancaster, PA

Sizing was good. I usually wear 8 1/2 extra wide shoes. The mediums have plenty of room. They are not shoes I would wear all day because I need more support for all day wear. They are great for quick trips out or wearing around the house.

There seems to be some mixed reviews when it comes to buying the correct size but I did some research online and read that Capezio Daisy 205 Ballet Shoes go by street size. So, I purchased size 10.5 for my daughter who wears 10.5 in street shoes. And, the fit was perfect. The shoes seem to be well made and very strong... cute too with the little flower print on the inside.

Have worn out 2 pair of these shoes in past years. The only thing I don't like about them, they are not made in the UNITED STATES now.. I needed them or I would not have bought them. Hope they will give me the service the others did.

I love these shoes. I have them in black & I wear them all the time because they are super cute and comfortable. They look really cute with skinny jeans & crop pants. They seem to be durable but are made of a silk-like fabric, so I wouldn't buy them if you live in a wet climate. They also run large, so size down. I normally wear a 8 1/2 to 9 and I had to purchase an 8. I would highly recommend these shoes.
Wonderful shoes! That's the simplest way to put it. Very comfortable and breathing. Helped in maintaining arch support and biomechanics

I was in need of a new pair of bowling shoes and I seem to have chosen the right pair. I ordered them and they came in less than a week which was great. They fit nice and they look nice as well. I rated them 4 stars.

the boots were nicer than expected, I was very happy with my purchase, until I tried them on and realized they were too big:(After I returned them, which was also a very simple process that went without a glitch, I realized I had paid 2/3 of the cost of the boots just in s & h. Therefore, I did not reorder. I still want the boots, but can't afford taking another chance on size problems-I will have paid more in s & h then the boots cost.
I got the shoes really quickly. They were very well priced. They arrived pretty quickly in the mail, although I wish they had arrived slightly quicker.

I ordered a different model with the same brand for my daughter and the sizing wasn't even close. She had a 1.5 last year in the model that uses velcro so I ordered a 3 this year. They were smaller than the 1.5 last year. Her true foot size is a 3. Nothing bad with the quality of the shoe but the sizing needs some work. If you need to order this shoe, size up 1 to 2 sizes.

As i say i bought it for a friend and he says that is great. He wasn't wait too long for it (thanks!). He got a RDV with girl, he planned to wear it at the rendez-vous. He was worry thinking will he get it at time.

Ordered yesterday and I received today. These are soooooooo comfortable. I love them.I ordered three pair in different colors. I am getting married in two weeks and the ivory pair will be worn, due to a ankle break. No heels for me, for a while.My seamstress will be covering them to match my dress (beaded).Great for the feet.

My ex bought these for me for $70 to get me into hiking here in the Cascades around Seattle (I have always hiked wearing regular shoes, but on flatter terrain in Northern California). I have always worn them with hiking socks and liners and they have been phenomenal. I think the longest hike I've done is 8 or 9 miles in a day, but I've done quite a bit of vertical including Mailbox and Snoqualmie Mountain and these have never let me down. After two years I can still slosh through creeks and melting snow and I've never gotten wet feet. The boots have held up well and look as though they'll last another year or two of hiking and snowshoeing.

I have been buying these boots for the last 5 yrs they are great. I buy a new pair in the late fall and use them for around the house and out and about during the winter months, then I cycle them into my work boots during spring and replace them the next spring. They stay waterproof with no care taken and the soles do not split away like a lot of boots do, at work I 'am outside a lot in all kinds of weather snow, rain, and bitter cold they keep your feet warm in winter and they are not hot in the middle of summer. I highly recommend these boots, people are always asking what kind they are and the answer is Hi-Tec Altitude IV! (And no I do not work for Hi-Tec) but support any company that makes a great product.

good morningthe excellence of the purchase is that I arrive in the estimated time and are products that people want to buy is a great way to buy cards by providing this optionto shop and provide good service and hope to continue buying the best of you waiting felicitacciones
It is ok for this price. But after 2 months, there are small holes on the bottom of shoes.But after 2 months, there are small holes on the bottom of shoes.

My friends call them my "40s shoes" and I get compliments on them all the time at work which is pretty much the only place I wear them. They are sturdy and comfortable but I had to add no-skids to them to keep from slipping on the hardwood floors. Even on stage I used to have to do that. I wish they made these for everyday wear like with a real heel cover and weatherproof bottom sole but hey - these arent for wearing around town after all. Still I love em and think theyre great! I also have them in black.

I bought a pair of Eccos every year for many years, until the sole of my Seawalkers fell apart in a sticky goopy mess. Ecco said since it was over a year they couldn't do anything for me. I haven't bought any Ecco's since. It's a crying shame because they were the best thing I could find. It's very weird to have your soles turn into a slippery sticky mess.After a couple years, and trying a couple other hiking boot brands, I thought I'd give Ecco another try, but the size I used to wear was too big for me by a lot, and the next size down was too small. The ding dong at the store said my feet got smaller (that doesn't even make sense). So I took 3 old pairs into the store and the new shoe of the same size and same model (Track II) was obviously bigger than the old shoes I brought in, by nearly half an inch.Ecco shoes are not exactly cheap. I wonder why the quality control is not working. It's not like they are $15 shoes from Kmart or Walmart, that you kind of wonder how they can even afford to make them.I used to think Ecco was terrific, but with the soles disintegrating, and the sizing inconsistencies, I wonder what has gone wrong at Ecco Headquarters. My Seawalkers disintegrated a few years ago, but searching the internet, it still seems like a problem.I'm still hoping for signs the company turns around. I loved my Eccos.

I've used these shoes for 2 years now, and I bowl 3 - 4 times a week. These shoes are great for the bowler who doesn't bowl often and are looking for a good shoe for a good price.The good things about this shoe:~ Great arch support~ Good value for the price~ Holds up well with wear~ It is easily found in a wide width (And there aren't many wide width bowling shoes!)~ Looks like an athletic shoe - some like that lookThe not so good things about this shoe:~ This shoe is a little small. I have one foot that is a size 10 and the other is a size 10 1/2. Normally, I can wear a size 10 - except in athletic shoes, where I need a size 10 1/2. Heck, it's difficult enough to find a wide width in bowling shoes, let alone a size 10 1/2! And a size 11 is just too big. This worked for me, but not always the most comfortable.~ The shoe is white, and I swear it picks up dirt faster than any shoe I've ever had! I know I'm tough on shoes, and I know bowling alleys are not the cleanest places, but dang!~ Ater 2 years, these shoes look "old." Now, I bowl 3 - 4 times a week, and when we travel, we take our bowling bags and bowl on the road. It just seems these shoes break down quickly. YMMV~ These shoes look like an athletic shoe. Some might like that, others might not. I'm not thrilled with it. It was the only wide width bowling shoe I could find at the time.~ Does not really slide all that well. (Which may be a plus, depending on how you bowl)I don't mean to come down too harshly on this shoe. If you are a casual bowler and don't want to use the rental shoes, this is a great little bargain shoe. If you bowl more often, you might want to look for something else. This is not the most comfortable shoe, but it will see you through a couple of games one or twice a week.

I love Reebok so much. The shoes are so comfortable and the other stuff is also really great! All my friends and I have at least 6 pairs of reebok shoes in our closets. And the designs are really great too.

I bought these boots for my son last Christmas. He has loved them since he took them out of the box. He said they wear great. These boots are going into their second winter here in Michigan and they still look great. These are great boots and worth every penny.
awesome shoes even though made in china. shoes seem a little larger than advertise. but nevertheless awesome value for these clarks brand shoes. couldn't be happier.
I was so intent on finding "wide" toddler shoes, that I overlooked the shoelaces. We wanted velcro shoes, so ended up returning these.
One of the most comfortable pair of heels I've ever owned! They're great for walking and looking fashionable!

Actually allowed me to put my orthotics inside these shoes. Usually my orthotics only fit in athetic shoes, so I was pleased. I do have hammer toes, and got a few red spots on top of my toes, but I don't know how I could have avoided that.

This is the most comforable shoes I have every worn. I bought a pair about 5 years ago and was searching in local stores where I live. They were no where to be found. Then I searched on-line. I recommend them highly!!!
I've been wearing this shoe for years. It has always been very comfortable and long-wearing.

I gave these a five star based on price and performance. I purchased these boots for about 50% off at 50 dollars. They have served well in the snow- waterproof and warm. I probably would have liked the black color more if it was available. As a workboot, the only things lacking are a steel toe and an oil resistant sole. Overall a great shoe.

The title says it. This is a great product! My second set of Reef Fannings and I don't think I could be much happier with them. Very comfortable, looks great for kicking around town, and perfect for a day on the boat. Plus, you never have to worry about forgetting your bottle-opener. Also, shipping was quick and painless. Only downside is they are a bit pricey. Also, be careful about size. I am usually a US 9.5, but I got an 8.5 and it fits me perfectly... Overall, great experience!

Beautiful shoe and true to size. I have always been happy with the Anne Klein brand...but the description said "fabric". I received velvet shoes. The description should say velvet not just fabric. I returned the shoes because really how often do you ever need velvet shoes...I wanted fabric for special occations.
These sandal have a great comfortable feel. Good quality material and very lite. Not just for man. If you need comfort on you tired feet these sandals are the best.

I sent these shoes back because they were too small.I could have got 1/2 size larger. But, I wasn't sure 1/2 size would work. Probably would have. I recently broke my ankle.It's a nice looking shoe. I'm an old timer and like the retro look. Not into outer space shoes of today.The padding wasn't that good. I've had a lot of shoes with better padding.
It isn't perfect but it cleaned up my suede shoes. The bar does deteriorate a bit when using but this is expected. It does so at a very slow rate. I don't see myself running out of it at any point.

Great boot in every way. Looks, comfort, performance. Price was very competitive price. I live in these boots. Due to the heel height, a problem I have due to an injury does not affect me as it would in a low heel shoe. I play baseball in these boots. Yeah, they are great!
I absolutely wore my other pair out. I have wide,high arch feet and hard to fit.These are great walking shoes

I have 4 pairs of these Clarks sandals in different colors and the soles of my blue ones finally wore out. I found these on Amazon.com and immediately bought them. They are a couple of shades darker than my blue ones but just as comfortable and will go with the blue items in my wardrobe. This shoe style has been around for many years. I would have to travel a distance to a Clark's store and then there is no guarantee they would have the shoe and in the color I was looking for. When I saw them on Amazon.com, I quickly purchased them and they arrived a few days later. They are extremely comfortable and completely adjustable because of the 3 straps with buckles.

This very attractive little sandal would probably be very satisfactory, but it runs both short and narrow. It is not true to size by any means, so rather than return them, I gave them to a cousin with smaller feet. They were on sale. Now I know why.

I love how comfortable they feel on my feet. I did forget that Timberland's are usually sized a bit large when compared to shoes. Normally I'm a size 12 shoe but only in Timberland's I would be a size 11. Luckily for me I ordered a 11.5 size so it wasn't bad enough for me to return. Just have to lace them up tighter but still not an issue when it comes to them being comfortable and durable. It did take me a couple of days to break them in so now the size issue is none existent.

The boots were very nice, warm and extremely comfortable but not much on looks. Also, I followed the advice of reviewers before me and ordered a size bigger and they are too big. So I would say they must be true to size.

This is the second time I have purchased this boot, and I would have to say "Its a great deal, and a good work boot". Even though these boots "Can" last up to a couple of years on the outside, I purchase a new pair "Every year" just because the inside comfort doesnt last that long. I use these boots for climbing poles and standing on ladders 30ft in the air. Only found two downfalls about these, 1. Moisture does seem to get to my socks and feet after a couple of months of wear. 2. You can feel the steel shank on the bottom of your foot when wearing the boots, wich make them a little uncomfortable. I will continue to buy unless I find a more comfortable boot for the same price.
These boots were exactly what I was looking for - waterproof, warm, comfortable and they actually fit! I have been enjoying these boots very much. They do not hurt my shin bone like duck boots do.

Finally got my 2nd pair of these. Had my first pair for about 3+ years of heavy use. When it came time to replace I wanted to try a higher end boot. Got a pair of Merrils and had problems with the fit of the right boot, then they started to rub the top of my toes, again, in the right boot. Was frustrated and decided to go with "tried and true" and ordered my 2nd pair of these. So with HEAVY use I can say...Pros:-fit right out of the box, don't really need to break them in-waterproofing held up and still is on my original pair, I'm impressed-they're very light weight and VERY comfortable-they look good-they're great on downhills (not all hiking boots are)-not too badly priced; especially if you get them on saleCons:-The traction isn't as aggressive as I'd like-the tread wears a little quick and since there wasn't an aggressive tread to begin with it seems they wore down too soon. I continue to wear my old pair for dirty jobs as work boots and they're fine but on slick surfaces or muddy slopes they got a little to slick a little too soon-the laces that come with these boots won't stay tied for anything; plan on replacing them immediately-The insoles are cheap; I used the originals for the life of my first pair but bought new insoles for my 2nd pair and it almost transforms the boot in a good way. I LOVE my 2nd pair a 100% more with the new insoles.-They eyelets have never broken on mine as others have reported but they are a bit sharp so they wear thinner laces (the kind I prefer) rather quickly.-You can really feel rocks through the sole; these are better for smoother trails; for really rocky terrain they're a bit thin.When I wear out my 2nd pair I'll try again to find my "ultimate" hikers but frankly for the money you'd be hard pressed to get much better than these. I know I listed quite a few cons but don't shy away; just get them on sale and buy some better insoles and you'll have a great boot. The fact that my 1st pair are still waterproof after such heavy use is really impressive to me and the old pair are still more than serviceable.
Great shoe, as always. I buy nothing but Croc's for all of comfort shoes. Price was great also.
I have worn Easy spirit Women's shoes for years and they are really a good shoe.Gives good support and always fits well.

Very pleased with this item, it was exactly what I was looking for. It's very comfortable and true to size (I got size 9 sandals but normally wear 8.5) and have had it for a year now and its lasted and is in good shape still.

I'm very pleased with these sneakers. They are sleek and fit well. They are very lightweight and will be good for outdoor terrain. The spikes are easily removed for indoor use. They are ventilated so that your feet don't overheat. The order was shipped in good time and the package arrived in excellent shape.

For the price, you can't get any more comfortable than these. From the first time I slipped my feet into the sandals, I knew I needed more than one pair. They are awesome. I purchased a pair for my teenage son and he loves them too!
I have neuropathy and the Birkenstock Sandal is the only one that is comfy to wear, stylish and very reasonably priced.
This shoe is perfect for keeping at the backdoor, slip them on and it's play time.

these are a great classic shoe. not a ton of support but thats what i expected.when i opened the box i thought amazon had sent me the wrong color. i was expecting something more grey/khaki but got something that was more like army green. i guess i read khaki green in the description and overlooked the green part, ha. nevertheless i am enjoying these shoes. styyyyyyyyyyyylish.
High quality, a perfect gift, check back with me in 10 years, but I think they'll make a good run for it, pardon the pun...
The shoes were great, but I have such a small feet they were too big. Sorry I had to return them.
This shoe is extremely sexy. I will warn you that the heel is REALLY high and can be uncomfortable after a while. But then, what high heeled shoe isn't? The price is right and the company is solid.
These shoes are awesome! they look great with everything. you will not be sorry you bought them.

After I wore the shoes the first day, they turned into a dog magnet. Not sure I can wear them now, but they are very comfortable and the width can be adjusted in two places. If you don't like your feet to hurt, buy these shoes. Dressy enough to wear to work.

I bought this shoe (in black) along with 1 Lifestyles and 1 Clarks sandal. All three of these shoes are supposedly known for it's comfort. Out of the three, this was the least comfortable one...(Overall). I bought this in Wide. (These don't hurt by the end of the day.. however, after 3 days of wearing it, it'd start to hurt on the sides. The heel of the shoe was a bit narrow and there wasn't as much padding as the other two brands. If you're looking for a comfortable shoe, try out Clarks. (You can practically run in those!!!). One good thing about Naturalizers are that they come in Wide.
I just got these shoes- the soles are uncomfortable, but they were on $13 and they look pretty nice- a good deal on a shoe you will just wear every once in a while for the looks.
I ordered these for my mom. She has always wore these even when she was a waitress. Both pairs she wares all the time. Shipping time was excellent!

I have a heavy gait, and a wide foot. These shoes fit perfectly, and they last. I just retired one pair after 400 miles (compared to the typical 185 miles I got on the NB 991).I couldn't disagree more with the first reviewer. I think these shoes are great.
very cute boots for toddlers. stylish and practical.gore-tex is a great technology to prevent soaking.I gave only 4 stars as they are rather difficult to put on
these boots a great just gotta break them in. which will take me prolly a good week of wearing. got a good deal too. about 2 days after i placed my ordered they went up like $20!

This is a nice looking shoe, well made and good price. But I had to return them because the medium width was too narrow for my usual size B. A wide width probably would have worked, but was not available. Too bad, because I liked the style and construction, and basic oxfords for women are hard to find these days. I usually buy Timberland oxfords, and wear a 7 B, but they have no oxford styles for women at the present.
very comfortable , a bit wide ,but soft leather and beautiful color -good for all day standing on your feet
Reebok's Classic Ace is not a bad shoe but, for me, not as good as the true classic. I bought a pair of these when I could't find the Classic running shoe.
I wore out my first pair after 2 years. I have to have these in my shoe rack, have alot of other more expensive shoes but these are far and away my favorite!
Great product. Have worn these for years and they never disappoint me. Comfortable and good fit. Wouldn't hesitate to purchase them again.

I live in northern Minnesota and these are great for winter. Warm, waterproof and good grip on the icy sidewalks. Very comfortable too. I have a very nice pair of Sorel winter boots but they are HEAVY for day to day activities. During the winter I wear the Sorels to work and then keep a pair of tennis shoes in my office to change into once I get there. No need for that any more. Driving is nicer too. Have you ever tried to drive a vehicle with giant winter boots on? Not fun.

Like walking on air. They are well cushioned and adjustable width. I'll buy these in other colors for sure. The ankle strap provides some support. I've had a couple of ankle surgeries so I need really well padded soles and these provide the comfort I need.
My sone wanted a pair of these for Christmas. He loves them. Wears them to work with his dress pants. He just got out of the army and these work very well for his feet.

What else can I say? Converse's Chuck Taylor High-Tops have been tried and true for decades. They are comfortable, fun and in my case, red. I am 51 years young and I receive more compliments on these shoes than any other item of apparel that I own. Love them.

I have been wearing these shoes for about 6 months now and really like them. I plan on buying another pair to put back for when these wear out. As for those reviewers whos say that the soles wear out soon, take them to you local shoe shop. They can be re-soled.

I bought a black pair of these wrongly thinking that the nubuck leather was a compromise. They're quite stiff initially and have that slightly hairy suede look. After about 25 km in them now the leather has become soft and flexible, and after polishing with boot wax they're very smooth too much like the more expensive Ultra models. I've worn Hi-Tec's own carbon rubber sole before and consider it just as good as Vibram - will likely outlast the rest of the boot. So far have kept my feet dry in wet conditions. Only small criticism is that up top they're kind of chunky and it's a fine balancing act getting the lace tension just right so that your shins don't rub, though that should get easier with more wear. All up very good value for the price (the international price, not the Australian price).

Like most Earth shoes, these shoes are quite large. If you have larger feet, they may exaggerate the size of your feet and are very noticable. I kept mine, but I'm finding I don't reach to wear them. They aren't the most comfortable to walk in - it definitely takes some getting used to. The slope in these shoes feels larger than other Earth shoes I've worn.
The shoe itself is sturdy, well designed and well made; however, the width is actually one width less. For example, a Wide is actually only a C and not really a D.
Super-cute shoe. Heel has great shape and is not too high. Sole has a lot of flex, which makes them a bit teetery. You wouldn't want to have to run in them.

I just bought these to use in the woods to play paintball, but also for general yard work, shoveling snow, etc. They weren't too hot, and give good support. I didn't test out their waterproof-ness, but I am happy with these boots for the price.

I've had them for about a month now, and they are FANNNTASIC!!!!!!!You HAVE To Bring Them BACK to Buy!!!!They go with Everything! and they are SOOOOOO Comfortable!!!!!!!!!I Have the GOLD Color!!! and I want to buy another two more pairs!!! of those!!!BRING THEM BACK!!! PLEASE!!!!!!!!!!!

This is a great looking boot that fits perfect after reading other reviews I ordered half size smaller. The other reviews helped,my normal size would have been too big. An american boot at good price.

I can't believe how comfy these mules are. I like the fact that the middle and back of my foot feels supported w/o the mule looking too clunky. They are a tad heavy, though doesn't make me feel like my foot is carrying major shoe weight so doesn't bother me.I haven't worn them in summer (got it just before xmas at an unbelievable price) so will be interesting to see how the very soft lining will hold up. No my feet don't sweat a lot but you KWIM - mules and clogs ain't always summer-friendly.I plan on wearing these in the Fall and Spring mostly, and so far, so good as winters here are mild. Loving these mules, even went for a walk in them yesterday. An added bonus - they look very nice:)

I ordered these approx. March 2010. My feet are so happy I did! Warm, cozy, and supportive...they are a delight. These replaced a previous pair of Minnetonka slippers and are definitely an upgrade - thicker lining and stronger sole. Sizing is accurate (my foot measures 7.5 US, average width, and the 7.5 fits perfectly).

I just re-purchase that shoes, around yr ago, i bought the white color speers, when I found out is discount item, I re-purchase another pair (Black/gold). The crocs I ordered were comfortable and of good quality. I loved the blue color. The fit was just right.

I am a major supporter of Minnetonka Moccasins - they're cute, comfortable, and "different - looking." I usually go for the brown shades, but this time I tried the red color. Great decision. I love the red; it is a really unique color, and it's just as comfortable and wearable as the more neutral colors.

I was debating whether I wanted to buy a pair online or just go into a store and buy them there. Boy am I glad I went to go buy them in person... as other people have mentioned, Converse run a little big so a size 11 (which I am) is really a 9 or so. I ended up getting an 8/5 and I haven't worn 8/5 size shoes since I was 13. You really want to go and buy them in person and completely avoid this problem.

Just what I expected. Awesome. I wear a 11.5 in most shoes and got a 12 here on purpose so I could wear thick winter socks. Even with the socks they are a bit roomy in the toe- so believe that "run a half size large" thing for Converse i guess. Other than that, this Pair of Chucks are exactly right on.
The wrong item was shipped. Ordered a 1M child's size and received baby-sized shoes (some bizarre number not anywhere near what we had ordered). Return was easy.
I love these shoes. This is my third pair of them. Good running shoe. Light weight.

I have worn only these flip flops for years and loved them. I ordered some recently only to find that the rubber they use for the sole is now made of a much cheaper material. It used to be dense rubber with some weight to it. The arches were what i loved the most and the durablity. The new material is lightweight and doesnt hold up well. The arches arent as good because the rubber is so soft. I wore them around the pool and they got a bit wet and I left them in the sun. When I returned the sole was acutally curled. I am so disappointed. I can only hope that they go back to using the old material or I will need to find another brand to replace them with.
have been wearing this style of sandle for years, don't know what i would do without them. and i am a shoe person!

These covers work well for what I bought them for, but they're really a bit small. I got them for my husband to step outside to carry a dog out into the back yard, and they work fine. They're disposable, so we're not expecting multiple uses from them. But.......they are a tight fit over his shoes and he wears a 9.5. I followed recommendations from others who reviewed this product before me and ordered one size bigger. I didn't regret my decision. Those shoes fit perfectly and they are very comfortable. Definitely well worth the money and a great purchase for someone who just started.
I'm really happy with these Chucks. Seller sent them in perfect condition a couple days before expected. Good Price. Good Purchase. Good Day!

I've had several other Indigo shoes and loved them. I have a pair of kitten heals in a 8 1/2 but in flats I always wear a US size 9 and have never needed to 'break them in'. I wear a 9.5 and purchased a 10.5 and I actually hesitated but I am so glad I did. Again this is a great shoe with a price that won't break your purse.

I ordered these slippers after reading the many positive reviews for them. It feels like you are walking on a cloud of puffy wonderfulness. They keep my feet really warm too. What a great boot this Caribou by Sorel is. I have had an older pair for years and decided to upgrade. I am so glad I did. They have updated this boot dramatically. Warm and wonderful.

Now, if you're a typical person, you'd probably find this shoe to be soft under foot. However, I stand for hours a day (teaching) and I found this shoe to be lacking. It ain't soft enough for my long-suffering feet and it's certainly less comfortable than a typical running shoe. If your workplace allows you to wear running shoes, just do it. You'll be happy you did. In that case, may I recommend to you the Asics GT-2170? It has a super-soft MIDSOLE, which is the IMPORTANT PART for comfort. I'm basically a shoe expert at this point in my life, and I must advise those who are looking for a comfortable shoe--I mean really soft!--to LOOK UNDER THE INSOLE AND PRESS THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF THE MIDSOLE. If the midsole (under the insole) is hard, or even hard-ish, you will NOT be comfortable unless you have numb feet that are immune to pressure. So don't be fooled by super-soft-feeling insoles made of puffy, fluffy, light foam. They will compress on top of a hard midsole, and you'll be hurtin' and as irritated as two wet cats in a bag.

Converse are great for your feet. They contain little padding, so you maintain a natural walking motion. Its basically one step above being barefoot. I actually use them to weight train. They are also very stylish. Who doesn't love converse?

I ordered these flip flops in blue and in black. The black pair fits well and are comfortable...The blue pair are the worst flip flops ever! They hurt my feet and feel too small...I'm not sure how the same shoe can have two different fits! I love reefs and have been wearing them year round for 15 years now but I am very disapointed in these.

These are adorable shoes, but they are more like slippers since there isn't any tread on the bottom. So if your little one can walk and wears these outside, they will get really dirty. Like most people have said, I'd suggest a half size up from your regular shoe size. I love love love these shoes! I have wide feet, and sometimes it's hard to find shoes in wide or that flatter my feet, but these shoes are so perfect! I think I will buy a pair in every color now!

I bought these for my wedding, as I wanted something comfortable and cute. They have a nice arch support, but the sole is not as cushy as other styles of Reefs. The thong part between your toes is made up of the two fabric sides sewn together instead of a ribbon that's folded inward (as with other styles), so the seam can rub wrong if you have sensitive toes. Overall, though, they are still more comfortable, stylish, and well-crafted than cheaper flip-flops.

I really love this boot... but everything great about it is superficial. They run narrow and have a cheap foot bed. Very poor support. But the style sure is what I like.I ordered an 8.5 wide and they were more like a medium... they were snug but after I broke them in they seemed to stretch out and felt better. They didn't last a year and a half before the insides were all tore up and I pulled a metal bar out of the footbed, lol. Huh?! That never happened before with any shoe. I didn't even use them everday... but I did do some walking in them. Nothing extreme. But the outside held up fine.Even though I knew better and feel they are waaaay overpriced for the quality... I love the look and ordered a second pair. This time in a size 9 wide so I could put some padding in there for better foot support. It seems to help. I will only wear them to work now as I don't know how quickly these will also fall apart...

I have not been overly impressed with this boot. I really wanted to love these boots, and I do love the vintage look but they just won me over. They are quite comfortable for a stroll in the park, but they are too low in the back and really dig into my lower angle when I get on the trail. The leather that the boot is made out of seems really soft and began to show signs of significant wear early in their life. They are great in terms of waterproofness, and temperature comfort but the just don't seem like they are made to take a beating like I typically expect from my boots. I do product testing for Gore-tex and have worn a lot of boots in my day and I probably should have paid more attention to the use of "light" in their name. If you are looking for a very light duty boot that looks really cool, and you don't need much for ankle support, this might be the boot for you. When I was a kid in the 70s, there were all kinds of new sneaker designs coming out, but nothing ever beat the reliable old standards, either Converse Chucks or Pro-Keds Court Kings. Those sneakers were great for any sport, they held up under abuse, and never went out of fashion for boys and girls alike. These Pro Keds are a bit of a play on the old design, and come in a wide variety of cuts, colors & materials. I've got several pairs of low-cuts, one pair in suede with natural (translucent brown) rubber toe, another made out of bright yellow tennis ball fuzz with white rubber, and this pair, shiny navy blue leather with light blue & white rubber. There are a variety of color combinations to pick from, in fact on the Keds website you could even make a custom pair for awhile. They are some of the toughest, well-made sneakers and incredibly comfortable as well. They're the ultimate casual weekend shoe, and the most recent ones I've gotten come with a lighter, shapely molded insert rather than just a flat foam rubber & canvas insert, giving better support. I wear a lot of Vans and Converse sneakers too, and honestly, the Pro-Keds are constructed more solidly than either of the other brands. They can stand up to serious abuse, especially the ones made out of leather.

These were top-of-the-line shoes, when sold new, back then in 2003 (or what ever year it was). However, from what I remember, the size 8 shoes had a slight quality control problem, or at least it seemed like it to me. The right shoe would sometimes be a little flatter in the sole, or maybe slightly uneven, or something like that. The left and right shoes would not be the same, in some way. If you happened to get a good pair, then you lucked out. They were comfortable, springy, and an excellent fit.They were also recommended for heavier runners, and I found that they definitely cushioned out and reduced any pavement shock on my knees and other joints.That's why when I saw recently that this particular model was still available, I bought a pair. The pair I recently got are not perfect. The right side feels a little bumpy in one spot. However, even so, they are currently my most favorite and most comfortable pair of shoes, which I wear all the time.

I hate the boots! I purchased a pair for $110 in October of 2012. After a couple of days the shoes started to squeak progressively getting louder. Regardless of the floor surface; carpet, concrete, or grass the boots would squeak getting louder and louder. It got to be a joke at work because people could hear me coming several offices away.I called Timberland and stated my problem with the shoes and they gave me an RMA number to return the shoes and requested a letter stating the problem. I wrote the letter including all contact information and sent the boots back to Timberland insured and return receipt requested at a cost of $15.Thanksgiving goes by, then Christmas, then New Years with no word about my shoes. Finally after New Years I called and gave them the RMA number and they stated they would replace the shoes. A week later I received a new pair of shoes from Timberland. I wore them for a week then they started squeaking again. I am out $125 dollars and all I have to show for it is a pair of shoes that make a lot of noise.

This shoe ran big and I needed a half size smaller and a D width rather than a wide. The ad states the shoe has a soft crepe type sole but it came with a hard synthetic sole. It was not very flexible and it's been my experience that if a shoe needs much 'breaking in', it won't be very comfortable.
My 17 yr old son loved the shoe but was so disappointed how big it was. We returned it for a size smaller we r hoping this one will work.

These are extremely good sneakers! I bought a brand new pair of black womens Keds Champion sneakers at a Sal. Army store I frequent quite a bit for only 4 dollars. These are great basic shoes. An older relative saw them and said they wore them during jr. high school in the 1950s as part of their gym uniform. I prefer these classic everyday shoes over something with more padding and more modern. These are very flexable shoes, the laces are better than other brands. These sell for around $30 generally. For that price I feel that makes them one of the most affordable shoes on the market. If you like old school Converse, Jack Purcell, Vans then I think you'll be very happy to own these classic shoes. A lot of the skateboard companies make copies of these and classic Vans. Just go with the originals! If I could afforf it I'd own 10 pairs but am thinking about buy 2 more pair right now. The other styles Keds now makes look great as well. If you happen to go to thrift stores check out the womens footwear. I find lots of Keds there and scored another new pair for $5 about 2 weeks after finding these.These shoes feel right and work well for all activities. No downsides to these that I can see. 5 stars!!

I saw another review that mentioned that the Passports squeak. I have the same issue. They are a good looking shoe, and they're pretty comfortable. They do have a larger, boxier toe that does make them more of a casual look than something you would wear to dress up in. I'm mostly wearing them in a business casual work environment with some weekend duty. The leather has a pebbly grain to it that looks good when they start to break in. I have the "redwood" model.A lot of reviews comment on the style, but I find very few mention the sizing for some reason. Since it's easy enough to tell if you like them or not, I'll discuss the fit. Normally, I wear a 13 in athletic shoes (Nike, Brooks) and a 12 in a boot or dress shoe. I ordered these in the size 12 and found them to be a little larger than my usual 12 fit. After breaking in over the weekend with a lot of walking, it seemed like they loosened up a bit and are now about a 1/2 size too large. I wear super-thick Thorlo socks with them, so it might be a full size with "regular" socks. Arch support isn't as much as I would like, either. But arch support and fit can be addressed with an insert.If I buy these again, I'll get them a half-size smaller.

Wearing a AAAA shoe, it is very difficult to find a nice shoe in such widths. I have purchased several pairs of this shoe in many colors over the years. Goes with both skirts and pants. Just wish it came in silver!
