The break in period is almost non-existent and best of all, the sole wears out before the upper leather portion wears out. For the price and dependability, you cannot lose with this shoe!

I have 2 pairs of this model shoe and love them. After being a Nike fan for years I decided to give something else a try. This shoe is lightweight and very comfortable. I also love the classic style. And you can't complain about the nice price.
No complaints for this gift. They get worn a lot and so need to be replaced occasionally.
My daughter loves her shoes. We all have this type of shoe, and they can wear the anywhere. Very versatile and comfortable. It works with their active feet.
The shoes looks good and are well made, I know how young people like to stay in style and they arrived well in the time frame given.

Most comfortable and good looking classic sneakers on the market for unbeatable price. I have already bought a second pair cause am wearing them everyday. Do not get me wrong, they are durable I just wanna have one dry extra pair for exchange.Be careful with sizes, ezample my regular size is US 11 1/2 for 90% of shoes am wearing, but all Onitsuka shoes fits 1/2 size down som wearing US 11.
Christmas gift for my daughter. She got to open them early and she looooooves them!! Shipping was quick and no worries about the Uggs being authentic!

I thought I was ordering the Pedini Femme, which has no buckle. too confusing and I have returned this one to order the Femme version. I'm sure it is a fine shoe, but knowing there was a big difference in the Pedini's would have been nice to know up front.thanks.

I purchased the Emerald Dansko Women's Professional Box leather clog because of its good looks and Dansko's good reputation with the hospital crowd.Unfortunately, I have a small bunion and the clog was torture to wear on the troublesome foot.Bottomline, beware of this clog if you have a bunion!

I love how comfortable they feel on my feet. I did forget that Timberland's are usually sized a bit large when compared to shoes. Normally I'm a size 12 shoe but only in Timberland's I would be a size 11. Luckily for me I ordered a 11.5 size so it wasn't bad enough for me to return. Just have to lace them up tighter but still not an issue when it comes to them being comfortable and durable. It did take me a couple of days to break them in so now the size issue is none existent.

I bought these shoes for a vacation to Costa Rica where it frequently rains. When I put the shoe on it clung nicely to my feet, and I was hoping it would be enough to keep water from pouring in. It doesn't and once this sucker fills up with water, it's over! Also, my foot got EXTREMELY hot, there is no breathing in this shoe. With that said, I think for cold rainy days when I won't be subject to sloshing through deep water, these will be great. If you want them for traipsing through the rainforest and wading in puddles, get some waterproof socks (or go bare inside shoe) and some mesh drainable shoes like solomon tech amphibians, or my favorites, New Balance SW920's. With those shoes you expect to get drenched and will appreciate the water draining out and nice comfort too.

I was wanting some red shoes for an upcomming event and these seemed perfect. The website showed a red smooth patent leather shoe and I loved the heel heigth. However, when the shoes arrived they were rough in texture, not patent leather. I would have been ok with them if they had been the red croc skin ones also avaiable, but they were neither of the red shoes shown on the site. I was extremely dissapointed, so I have returned the shoes. Amazon was quick to refund the money, but I had to quickly look elsewhere to find the red patent leather shoes I had thought I was receiving from Amazon. The heel heigth and the Berry style look great, but not in the color and texture I received. Don't trust the picture, because it is extremely missleading.

I have worn these shoes for about 15 years. I just purchased my third pair. They are comfortable and have a good arch support. I am on my feet in my job for about 12 hours a day and have no foot problems and I would like to think it is because of these shoes. I was so happy to see amazon had them in stock as the local store where I bought the first 2 pair had shut down. Amazon even had them for 50$ less. Received them in a very timely manner too. Thanks Amazon!!

Very please with my boots .I usely wear a 5E and the 3EEE fits like a glove.Has a nice shine and finish .Excellent quality boots.Thanks Double-H and Amazon came to the rescue again.A very happy camperDavid M. from the cold country

I ordered a pair of these boots last week, When they came I was disappointed in the quality of one boot's leather, which was very thin, more like glove leather than boot leather. I am reticent to return items and for fifty years I never did. However, something priced over $200 seems a good candidate for a return if it doesn't meet expectations.I shipped the floppy-leather pair back to Amazon myself. I might say please take advantage of their UPS pickup option as the price to ship them yourself is way above the reimbursement you will receive. The return was received yesterday and the new boots arrived today.One thing I immediately noted about the new pair versus the old is that the new came wrapped in tissue paper, with several inspectors tags in the box and with a product tag zip-tied to the boot. The other pair had none of these, which confirmed my suspicion that I'd received someone else's return the first time.The quality of these new boots is much better than those of the previous pair, more like the Danners that I've worn since the I was discharged from the army in 1980. They still don't seem quite as heavy as the old-timey Danners but this is to be expected because the company is making boots advertised to have no break-in period. Right out of the box, they are soft and comfortable and my 10-year-old Danners are quite jealous of their bright new look.

"Chucks" are the only shoes that have ever existed. Ever since 1923, Chuck Taylor All-Stars have been "just a piece of rubber and canvas"- they haven't changed one bit from the sands of time. These shoes are devilishly simple, and customizable in every way. Everyone may be wearing Chucks these days, but you can still make them your own. There are so many ways- what color would you like? One of the core colors- black and white? Monochrome black? White? Red? Green? Blue? Pink? How about the latest pattern or print? Every year Converse also pumps out new seasonal colors, and different styles such as double-tongued shoes, "tear-aways", faded looking ones, everything. You can buy different color laces or you can go crazy with a Sharpie and draw up some art all over your shoes. And for something seemingly so flimsy, they're pretty durable. My shoes have withstood countless running and hitting the asphalt, games of soccer, basketball, jumping from everywhere, the basic abuse a teen can dish out to his feet. Granted, they may not be too comfortable at first, but once your feet gets used to them, well, you don't even notice you're wearing them anymore. Nevertheless, it does have some setbacks, but if you look at modern shoes, you can see the differences in design. But for something from over 3/4 of a century ago, you've got to admit they're pretty darn impressive. The skinny:PROS-customizable in any way- laces can be easily replaced and be done up in any pattern you wish-look great with anything and everything; the unisex casual sneaker that will even draw you the occasional compliment from coworkers or friends.-lightweight compared to most shoes of today-so many colors- from your basic core colors (black, red, green, blue, white, or pink) to different designs (60s tie dye, camo, skulls, flames, etc.)-also different kinds of shoes- from the classics to the newer double uppers, tear-aways (shoes with two layers of canvas, and some parts are already torn away to show the brighter underlayer), double-tongued, and also DIFFERENT MATERIALS like leather or suede.CONS-the color fades; especially in the harsh sun. My navy blue Taylors have been bleached to the color of very faded blue denim.-the rubber parts of the shoe can get dirty rather quickly, but are easily cleanable.-overall the shoe is pretty comfortable, but not recommended for prolonged running or a whole day on the boardwalk. It depends a lot on the shape of your foot- if your feet are flat, you'll find that these shoes are a match made in heaven. Otherwise you may have some issues, but not so bad they're unwearable.-I don't know what it is about it, but they make your feet look bigger than they really are.-NOT TO BE USED AS A SKATE SHOE. Converse shoes are made from canvas, which won't give you any mercy from runaway boards, and they do NOT have adequate cushioning on the top, bottom, or sides for such an activity.NOTE: BUY A HALF-SIZE SMALLER THAN WHAT YOU'RE AIMING FOR. A Converse size 10 is, in reality, a 10 1/2.ANOTHER NOTE: If this bothers you, then you should know. Chucks are no longer manufactured in the USA. They are now outsourced to other countries, mostly China. Your Chucks won't be falling apart on you or anything, but know that Converse is now a subsidiary of Nike, a company known to use sweatshop labor to make their shoes.
I have ordered my son two pairs of these shoes. Good quality and the size is accurate. Will order in a larger size soon.
I love my shoes. They are comfortable and stylish. They are going to be the perfect little white tennies for the summer.

I only buy boots every thirty years. These are lighter and better feeling than the heavy clod-hoppers they replaced. My only complaint so far (I've only worn them once to date) is that the bow-part of the laces tends to slip behind the tongue of the boot, coming to rest on my socks.
I own 6 pairs of these shoes in different colors. They are classic flats! I wear them to work and for both casual and semi-formal events. You simply cannot beat them for comfort and style!

Just a line to say how comfortable these shoes are. Anyone who has ever put ECCO shoes on their feet know this to be true. I am truly singing to the choir but to those that are considering a purchase of ECCO shoes...do it! You owe it to yourself and your feet!
I ummm actually haven't worn these shoes yet but. They get props from me just cause they look good. And they is original. so poo poo to you.

Im a Flight Nurse, so I work in EMS. These boots were extremely comfortable from day one. They are my favorite boots Ive owned so far. Ive had Bates, Rockies, Oakleys....these are the best. I think I would order 1/2 size smaller next time, there are a tad bit large, but my foot doesnt slip. Also, I meant to order side zippers, but these boots slip on and off very quickly so Im not slowed down in the middle of the night.

Classic Vans. The style hasn't changed in more than 10 years. I've had mine since 2002 I dont skate so much but I love the style, this shoes was a little bit bigger but it's ok..good choise VANS OLD SCHOOL

One of the best features on the shoes, in my opinion, is the fact that the back strap has elastic on one side so the skinny slingback doesn't dig into the back of my heel -- there's a lot of give and I don't feel too restricted in them.Just to toot Cutesy's horn for a second: she has the hottest styles & colors at THE best price. We all have our high-end, expensive, designer-like shoes that we love, but at the same time, we like to be able to afford several pairs of cute & trendy, lesser expensive shoes. I always check out Cutesy's eBay store to find those styles that are so hot at an uber-affordable price! And the quality is still there! LOVE CUTESY!!!

He was absolutely thrilled and they immediately went on his feet and the fit was excellent (I ordered them 1 to 1/2 size larger than what he is wearing so that he will have room and not outgrow them immediately). The styling is really nice and the quality great. What a deal!

I purchased the shoes one week before my volleyball tournament and was little bit worried that I will need little bit more time to break them in before playing 7 hours non-stop game. The fit around the heel area is not loose = not allowing the heal to go up and down which is great especially for me with skinny feet. The front is little bit more roomy but again I have very skinny feet so should not be a problem for others.The performance is great, nicely balanced and cushioned so even when playing on a very hard surface the impact on joints and spine is minimal.Design is nice for volleyball shoes even I know that running shoes looks much sexier on women :-) LOL.

I had the originals back in grammar school in 1969 & always loved them.I have gained weight in the ensuing years & needed a very supportive shoe, so I looked into these again.This is a great shoe with lots of support for very overweight people, & highly recommended for them.

I purchased these boots to have a better foot/ankle experience while hiking in the local mountains. They definitely helped my feet and ankles be more comfortable. The one down side has been the top of my toes keep getting rubbed raw while hiking. The first time I hiked in them I thought it was due to breaking in and maybe another pair of socks would help (I had on 1 pair of good hiking socks). So the next time I went out I wore 2 pairs of socks, but the same thing happened. I have now hiked many times (so boots are broken in) and I always have rubbed some toes raw. Not sure why, but I think it maybe there is too much distance between the boot and the top of my foot (I have normal size feet and have never had this happen before). So overall I like the boots, but they don't seem to like Me.

I never owned a pair of Adidas before and I really regret that. I picked up a white pair a year ago and liked it so much I immediately bought a second pair in black. Boots served me very well for about two years of occasional light (weekend) hiking and wintertime wear. But after this period, they started falling apart, with the upper splitting and tearing right at the sole line, stitching letting go, etc. Per the recommendation on Columbia's warranty page, I sent in photos of the failure, and of the sole (documenting the very light usage they had received), to see if they might offer a repair or credit towards new boots or something. Was informed that since the boots were out of warranty, they would do nothing.These were the fifth pair of midweight hiking boots I've bought since I was a teenager, all of similar weight and stiffness. All other brands (Timberland, Asolo, EMS, Vasque) have lasted until I wore the lugs off the soles (five years at least) and have survived much more abuse than these boots did. I'll give them three stars for their good comfort, support and water resistance, but given the short service life and Columbia's lack of concern about it, they get no more stars than that, and I won't be buying any Columbia boots in the future.

I have bought these shoes for a while now. I work on my feet 10 hours a day as a Front Desk Manager and need comfybut dressy shoes. I always keep a black and a brown pair on hand and they last at least one to two years. I never had any tear up just wore down the soles from use over time. Love these shoes!

My mother-in-law has so much trouble finding comfortable shoes Between diabetes & problems that should be surgically corrected, but her high blood pressure prohibits surgery, finding shoes is like the proverbial needle in a hay stack search. Aetrex offered a full grain leather comfort shoe with velcro closures for easy adjustment. One look & I thought,"That's the shoe for Mom!"...and it was! She put them on, grabbed her cane, & wore them for her weekly shopping outing, & kept them on when we arrived back home. Amazing!!! Thanks, Amazon, for leading me in the right direction, & thanks to Aetrex, also, for solving the comfort dilemma!

A fantastically comfortable boot, well put together and gives a sense that they will out last their owner! Outer packaging was a little damaged on delivery but all internal boxing and goods were in great order.Have all ready recommended the boots to friends.

I like the shoes but the black around the ankles comes off onto my hands and feet. No matter what i did it just kept coming off. Then the zipper began to rip up the back of my legs after just a few minutes of wearing them. I would not buy shoes from this company again but loved their other items. would of lowered the stars but wouldnt let me. Throwing out the shoes.

I am delighted with this product. previously bought addias trainers,but found these are lite, hard wearing and very comfortable . This shoe looks awesome and once its broke in feels great. I got a blister breaking them in, first time ever in a New Blance shoe.

These are the most comfortable sandals in the world. My wife only wears this type, and she wears them out. I should buy multiple pair at a time, but one pair every year ain't bad. Amazon has the best price compared to spending almost twice in a retail store. Thanks for the fast shipping!

I purchased 2 pair of Converse Chuck Taylor tennis shoes for my granddaughter's Christmas gift. They were delivered before the projected date and were exactly what the girls wanted. I will not hesitate to order from them again.

I bought these boots to wear at my job on a drilling rig in the Gulf of Mexico. My employer supplies us with boots (mostly Red Wing) but the boots that they order in my size (11 EEE) don't fit properly.These boots are working fantastically. Walking around for 12 hours per day, 21 days in a row on a steel deck can be murder on anyone's feet. These boots are very comfortable. I suffer from Plantar Fasciitis in my left foot, and after several hours of use my foot does start to get sore.I would definitely recommend these boots. They look good and go well with different clothing styles. Also comfortable. However, I expected them to be warmer. My feet were still freezing when I used the boots out in extreme cold weather (~ 0*F).

I was able to find the pair pretty easily via name and number and make sure with the very accurate photographs. I then compared prices. I got a great bargain and ended up ordering two pair. Hands down best shoes ever made. Yup, that's right. Comfortable, versatile, look great with everything - jeans, chinos, shorts, or a swim suit.

These shoes are amazing. From the moment I put them on I knew they were special. I work on my feet all day, and these shoes have been the most comfortable pair I have ever owned. I got these a few weeks ago and have loved them. Good support in the arch and heel and no rubbing. The spikes are pretty sharp so they make good trail running shoes. You can take the spikes out with a key (provided) and they make good track shoes.
good looking and well madebut ...so hard to walk withfeel like wood not leather

I purchased my rampante last week and tested it for twice so far. I have to say I am kind of dissapointed because I thought these were the perfect soccer shoes for me. The truth is the shoes are a little bit too narrow, and there is no improvment in shooting compared to cheaper shoes. I used to have lotto primato before and the shooting accurecy is same in reebok rampante. However reebok rampante's heel comfort is way advance than lotto primato, or other cheaper shoes. Nonetheless if you don't wanna pay $200 for a puma or adidas predator mania, reebok might be the second choice for you.

I hike several days a week all year in rough mountain terrain, much of it off-trail and over rocks. I've gone through several pairs of these Hi-Tec Altitude boots over the years. The factory supplied insoles are comfortable initially, but are made of a compressible closed cell foam that eventually does not rebound from compression well after some months of use. When the foam becomes compressed, the padded effect is lost and my feet begin to hurt. This can be solved by purchasing and installing an aftermarket pair of insoles such as the Sole Softec Ultra foodbeds, or another quality insole.This problem is not exclusive to Hi-Tec, as I've seen it with other boots and running shoes also. Some aftermarket insoles/footbeds are made of resilient material that does not tend to stay compressed with heavy use. I am not sure why the manufacturers of boots and shoes don't just use suitable footbeds in the first place, but I assume that they save a little money by doing what they do.Aside from the poor insoles, the boots themselves are comfortable, keep my feet warm in fairly cold weather even though they are not insulated, and the soles provide good traction.UPDATE 2-26-2012My son purchased a pair of these Hi Tec Altitude boots in the last year. After only 100 miles of hiking, the traction lugs on the soles were deteriorating very badly and coming off. Suspect a bad batch of the sole composite material. I purchased some of the very first Hi Tec boots when they first came out and they held up very well. Then, some years ago, our family had backpacked twelve miles into a designated wilderness and the sole of my daughter's Hi Tec boot completely separated from the upper. Lacking any repair material, I had to hike 12 miles out, drive to town several hours away, purchase a new pair of boots, drive back, and hike twelve miles back in with the new non-Hi Tec boots, just in time to join the family on a 12 mile hike out! I'd assumed that perhaps in the years that passed, Hi Tec had solved the quality control issues, that the experience was a fluke, and I went back to them. A mistake, apparently.

Good fit and great for softball if you don't like wearing full cleats. Very light and comfortable, except for the staple that protruded on the inside. Easily removed though, but a design flaw none the less.
My wife loves it, it's really comfortable, i'd like to get another pair for my mum or anyone else. Also not expensive.

I have been wearing Hi-Tec Altitude hiking boots for more than a decade, and I am now on my fourth (and probably last) pair. There are several reasons that I like them: 1) they are comfortable from the beginning, at least for me, and and don't require "breaking-in" (blisters are rare even after hiking ten miles a day); 2)they are reasonably priced (but I almost always buy on them on sale); and 3) they are relatively waterproof (however this doesn't last too long, but can be restored by treating them with Sno-Seal or a similar product as needed.I started buying and using these boots after owning an expensive pair of Vasque hiking boots and replacing the soles on those twice. For a little more than the cost of getting the soles replaced on those I could buy a pair of Altitudes when they were on sale. I've worn out three pairs of Altitudes (each lasts about three or four years for me with moderate to heavy use).The biggest drawback about these boots (for me) is that the glue used to attach the rubber sole and sides to the leather is ineffective. The rubber/synthetic materials start separating from the leather not long after I start wearing the boots. For years my solution has been to reattach and somewhat seal the edges with copious amounts of Shoe Goo. It makes the boots look ugly, but it does the job for a year or two, and then I need to reapply the Shoe Goo in smaller amounts. I've been hoping that Hi-Tec would start using a superior system to attach the sole and sides to the leather, but this has never happened. At this point I've given up hope and will be trying out other brands. It is really a shame, because I do like these boots otherwise, but I am tired of the lame glue issue. If it weren't for that perpetual problem I'd be giving these boots five stars, but as it is they only get three.
I wear Ked sneakers always and I was over joyed to find this show at such a low price. It is just as expected, great quality and reliable shoe!

First off, the shoe I received is not the shoe pictured. I need plenty of support for my poor ole dogs and this shoe doesn't have it. It is truly a light walking shoe. I have since ordered the correct Easy Spirit and love them.

Timberland is a good product. I have a few pairs of shoes from Timberland. Theses boots do have a solid fit, as one customer stated, but the fit is very comfortable! Gives a sold footing with walking in the unpredictable winter weather. Highly recommended. The price is extremely low for a Timberland product. This boot is a winner!

This shoe is the most comfortable shoe I've ever worn for exercise walking on the treadmill or fitness walking outdoors. They allow my feet to breath and the cushioning makes my feet feel like they're walking on pillows. I wish I had bought two pair when I'd had the chance to get these on sale!
this is a christmas gift. I already got one least year for me and my husband. It helps us when we clean our driveway from snow and ice. great product!
Nice to have multiple closure options but some of the topical material came off with first washing.

I have just received and opened these timberland (medium) boots. They are my third pair of "Tims," beautiful and a perfect fit. For women who love black boots with jeans or even with jean shorts (summer will be here soon enough!), these are a must. When I submitted my order I was a little worried about some reviews that stated the medium size was too narrow. Well, after putting these boots on and showing them off to my husband, I find them to be perfect. Also, for those with a slightly larger foot (like me!), I was pleased to find these boots give both a slimming and smaller effect. Either way, if you are a woman who likes the comfort and security of wearing a boot with your jeans during your off dress days, then this boot is for you. Lastly, shipping time and packaging was great. Leather around the ankle is a little stiff, but as all leather goes, I am sure it will relax after a couple of wears. Do not pass this up. Go Timberland.
This is a great product. I wore it for a week to break in. It gives great balance, comfort and handles the terrain very well.

This is my third pair of this shoe. I love it. I can stand or walk all day in this shoe in comfort. They may not be the top line of fashion but for a casual shoe it is hard to find anything more comfortable.

My first pair of Wolverine boots. I have read nothing but good reviews, so I tried a pair. These are the most comfortable boots I have ever had. I use these 10 -12 hrs a day on concrete, gravel, slanted surfaces, etc. and these are sturdy and look nice. Almost like walking on air! Uppers made in Dominican Republic, assembled in the USA. I will never buy cheap Chinese (communist) made boots again.

I have been a Converse fan for years and have always bought my 4-year-old Converse as well. He asked for PF Flyers because of the Sandlot. Honestly, I might have to switch to PF Flyers. I watched Converse's slow slip into mediocre material that doesn't last as long. My son went through his Cons within half a year from wear and tear. These have been holding up very well and I see no obvious signs of wear on them. The soles aren't ripping from the canvas material which is a big pet peeve of mine with other shoes.

I am very pleased with my new Classic Tall UGG boots. I followed the recommendations of others and ordered an 8 (I usually need an 8 1/2 or 9). The fit is amazing. They are so warm I forget I am not wearing socks. I live in Maine and usually wear wool socks all winter, this is incredible! I did read the reviews and used almost an entire can of waterproofing spray to protect the suede. I gave them two coats a day for three days before I wore them. I will avoid wearing them in really sloppy weather (I have boggs to wear in the slush and med) but for the regular cold and snow - I don't know how I managed without them.
Had to cut with scissors the front tongue where the sewing begins so that I could wear the slippers. The slippers are fine now.

I love Reef shoes and I love these...they are comfortable and have nice arch. I have a high arch and are able to wear these all day. I have the brown/pink combination. Nice looking, sporty shoe for a "flip flop".
the mid stinks compared too the old high-top iseemed to me it was sized abit smaller. if you liked the 4600 high top you'll be disappointed in its "replacement"2 thumbs down

I really like this shoe. I wear a narrow shoe and it is sometimes difficult to find narrow ones. However, this shoe runs quite narrow. I'm quite confident that it will "streatch" out with some wear as the shoe is genuine leather. All in all, I am pleased with the shoes.
My grown daughter always preferred K-Swiss so I knew this would be a good fit for my grandson.They are true to size and fit great. He loves them.

I love this shoe. It is the same style that I had twenty years ago. The shoe is light weight, comfortable, and durable. I would highly recommend them because you would not want to wear any other tennis shoe.Sincerely,csh

I bought a pair of these for my teenage son when we moved into a house with tile floors (it is chilly on the feet in the mornings!)--despite the fact that my son is occasionally picky about his footwear, and that he has very wide feet, these worked nicely!He wears them every day, and I don't have to keep reminding him; when I asked if he liked them, he said they were more comfortable than socks. Given that he is very blunt about disliking things, I'd say that ranks as high praise!
Boots are as described, fast shipment. No concerns with the product. These were a Christmas gift, my nephew loved them.

Teva has the best shoes for those of us who have bunions and/or high arches. The shoes form to your foot shape and provide adequate padding. If only they could come up with a flip flop type shoe that also is somewhat enclosed so that they can be worn at work.

The boots are very comfortable and fit well (I ordered a half-size smaller than I wear in regular shoes because I was afraid they would be too big and I'm glad I did). They are very cool and a bit trendy with the very square, somewhat elongated toes but I like them because they're not too dressy or too casual... can wear them with just about anything. I will definitely buy more Steve Madden shoes!

When I got these shoes I thought they were great. I put them on and they had great room for the toes and also felt great on the feet. I got the green one and the green color looked alot better in person than on the website. I loved the color!The only thing I see wrong with these shoes is the paint or what ever it is starts to come off very quickly where your laces are in the middle. Another thing is on the back the thing that says 3N2 peels right off and doesn't stay on. I do like the product but there needs to be something done about these problems!
I love Propet shoes but these were not my style. They are clunky compared to what I have ordered before, maybe I can break them in this summer.
The heels of this shoe were rubbing my heel very uncomfortably but perfect other than that not anything seller could have done diffrently, would order from seller again. Thanks

I am not an outdoor person nor a hiker. I work in IT and often walk a lot. I had the normal work shoes, even a pair of Dr. Schols. My feet around the balls of my feet HURT. It was to the point i was going to see a doctor as I felt like an old man. I decided to try these boots since all my walking was like hiking. This was more then I ever spent on a pair of shoes, but that pain was just too much. I began wearing these shoes and within a week I could feel the pain in feet going away. Now I am pain free and I wear the boots EVERYWHERE. Money well spent.

I just purchased my third pair of Bonnie Lites and own wine, black and taupe. I have knee problems and a hard insole really hurts my knees. The Bonnie Lites are well padded and like walking on pillows. Stylish and comfortable!

This is the second pair of Carolina boots I have purchased in succession. I do not remember the model of last years pair but I paid about $30 more. I work in a metal fabrication shop and am pretty hard on boots. I expect and depend a pair of boots to last a full year as our company does provide a limited boot allowance. The sole on these boots wore as well as any pair I have owned. I have owned Caterpillar and Wolverine in the past. This pair (8510) took a few days to break in so I had to alternate with an old pair but once broken in I was very satisfied with the comfort. Eventually I put in some neoprene inserts to help with cushioning. I walk briskly and put on many miles in our large shop and I was happy with how the support held up. The only problem I had was the leather around the steel toe came apart earlier than last years pair and toward the end of the year I was concerned the toe would actually fall out. Keep in mine that working with steel and sheet metal is brutal on foot wear. I decided to move up a bit this year and just purchased the 1809 model and though early they broke in much easier. I intend to buy some Toe Guard or Gorilla Toe Guard to protect the toe. If it wasn't for the toe leather falling apart I would have given it five stars
I have been wearing this type of shoe for 20 years, because I have a left foot war injury and these shoes make it possible for me to walk without foot pain.

The mocs were beautiful, soft and supple, and didn't fit at all. With feet swollen from a recent accident, I thought they would be perfect for the times I actually have to wear shoes, and was crushed because they didn't fit. Other shoes, marked less wide, do. They made a wonderful gift for a loved one, who wears a narrower width, and she was ecstatic, but I was/am disappointed.
I bougth it for my 23 years old son, he told me they are great and they are so comftable.

Brought these shoes couple months ago & have been happy with them. I generally am US sz11 or AU sz10 but found these are running a little bigger so when I purchase my next pair of these will be getting US sz10.5 instead of 11. I find them very comfortable for working long shifts & they are wearing well so far, but am thinking of adding a little more arch support but they are ok without added extra's.Update: I've had these shoes for near 12 months & they are great. I want to order more but amazon dont have them only other shoe sellers do that dont do shipping to Australia.Plz Amazon get these shoes back to being able to be shipped to Australia as I need another 2 pairs.These shoes fit my insoles for Plantis nicely & am finding that these shoes are the only ones I can wear atm because of hip ligament injury

These boots replaced a pair that had finally worn out after over 10 years of frequent wear. I was expecting and dreading an uncomfortable break-in period. To my surprise and immense joy, these boots -- size 9.5D -- slipped on easily and fit comfortably from the very first wearing. NB: I wear them with insoles and they fit snugly but are not tight.The soles of the boots provide sufficient and safe grip/traction on slippery surfaces but still slide well enough for dancing. They also take and hold a shine extremely well.I've had several occasions to wear them in rainy weather and my feet stay completely dry even after wading through shallow puddles.I wasn't happy with the tags on the exterior. They are easily removed.All in all, these boots are a great value. I wear them almost every day and highly recommend them to anyone wanting a comfortable, dressier style of cowboy boot.

I've been buying K-Swiss laceups for my daughter since she was first walking. They're very stable and are not so easy for her to remove as shoes with velcro. The teachers at her daycare really appreciate that! I had a good local discount source for these shoes but couldn't find a 5 -I was thrilled to find them on Amazon at such a reasonable price.
The moccasins were as advertised. They are very soft and just the thing for wearing in the house.
I love these shoes, unfortunately, I've worn out two pair and I can't find my size 8 any where........you have'm, I'll buy em!
My wife loves these. She has perpetually cold feet once the weather turns chilly, and the kids picked these out for her. Great gift.

I ordered these shoes for my boyfriend and he absolutely loves them. They look great and are true to size. He said he wishes these shoes had more arch support because he has to wear insoles, but that is typical of this particular shoe.
The shoes are versatile and very comfortable. Sizing is accurate and the price is right. I am pleased with my purchase. Good buy.

This shoe fits great and is very comfortable except for the interior. It has tiny little bumps that, when you first wear the shoe, are uncomfortable. I had to wear socks the first few times before my feet became used to the bumps (or perhaps the bumps weren't as sharp because the shoes has been worn.)
These are so comfy and are really walking shoes. I liked them so much I ordered a second pair. Shoes are difficult for me to buy as my feet are small and narrow but these fit.

This is the third pair of these boots that we have purchased. They are very sturdy and last about one year. The soles wear out much faster than the rest of the boot. My husband is a carpenter and wears them everyday to work. I am going to take the other two pairs and see if I can get them re-soled. Love the fact that they are made in the USA!

These are nice but I do think they run small compared to OTHER ballet slippers. Their quality isn't as nice compared to, say, Bloch brand slippers but for a little kid to practice or play in they work just fine.
My 23 y/o son asked for these for Christmas and he was ESCATIC! He loves them so I guess this would be a positive review! Shipping was fast and came in great condition.

Shoe is a bit narrow. The heel is higher than I wanted-2". Could use more padding in the ball of shoe, which is where you put your weight when your dancing. I'm a beginner dancer and the leather sole is slippery even after using sand paper to rough it up. (I found a suede sole to be less slippery for a beginner.)
My son loves the boots. Seem to keep his feet dry even on rainy and snowy days. These are durable all-purpose boots.

I'm a woman with a long,wide, foot with a high instep. It is hard to find a good womens boot that fits well. Thats why I choose a man's boot. They fit like gloves, give me the support that I need, and look good,as well.

I danced for years as a kid, and these split sole capezios were one of my favorite types. They don't shape to your feet as well as leather shoes, but they hold up a little longer (and because my toes are on a slant/angle, the shape looks better anyway). I ordered a 10.5 as other buyers complained they ran small, but they ended up being true to size - I am a street shoe size 10 and needed size 10 for these shoes. I had to exchange them, and the exchange process was hassle free and quick - had the new shoes within a few days.
This slippers do the job. They are very cozy. The only thing I would suggest is to go up a size. Other than that there are not any problems with them.

I used these for my wedding.I wore them for about 4 hours and they were comfortable until the end, they started to hurt a bit. But definitely good for several hours! I added a gel pad prior to the wedding, because due to the height the ball of the foot can tend to hurt. Also, these shoes tend to run narrow, so buy a larger size than your average size. The bottom of the heel and the front part of the foot are very flat. I didn't try to dance in these because of the height. Overall they add the needed height, and are very secure (unlike the average "stripper" shoe). One bad thing about these shoes are they tend to scuff easily. This won't be noticed by everyone else, but you may notice the scuffs yourself.

I currently own two pairs of the Danner Mountain Light II Boots because I liked my original pair so much, that I bought a second pair. In fact, had I written this review many years ago, when I first started using the original pair, I would have given them five stars. But alas, I cannot now do so.Yes, they are very comfortable boots, assuming you throw out the insoles they come with and use Superfeet Green insoles instead. Yes, the leather is buttery soft and very tough and durable. Yes, they can be resoled, which generally cuts down on your boot budget if you hike and climb a lot. Also, the Gore Tex liner keeps your feet dry except in extreme conditions. And, I give Danner a big thumbs-up for their recrafting department, which is super helpful and efficient.The problem is with the Vibram Kletterlift soles that are used. I have used boots of innumerable types with Vibram soles for as long as I can remember. My original Mountain Light pair had Kletterlifts which lasted a very long time before needing replacement. Unfortunately, Vibram soles are no longer made using the same formulary as they were a few years ago, so they wear terribly, especially in the lugs. I wear mine down to the mid sole in about a month or so of very hard use. As I live in Argentina, where no cobbler is capable of resoling these boots, I must return them to Danner in Oregon, an expensive proposition.This Vibram wear problem is not just with my Danner boots but also for example with my two pair of La Sportiva mountaineering boots, which have different Vibram soles, but the identical wear problem. With my La Sportiva boots, the soles are shot after just two weeks of hard use. I have spoken to people in the industry and they have assured me that it is not my imagination, that Vibram has changed their formulary.I can understand the dilemma for boot companies. Almost everyone insists on Vibram soles because of their past reputation. If a boot does not use Vibram its sales may suffer. The customer's desire for Vibram forces companies to use them. They are darned if they do and darned if they don't. But, I would like to think that the boot companies have enough influence with Vibram to get them to change the formulary back to what it once was.Danner, I beg of you, please rattle Vibram's cage and get them to change back!

I like the design, but the bottom was kind of weird. They feel kind of strange walking around in them, but I'm not sure if that's just because I have yet to break them in, or because the design inherent in the shoe is messed up. You have to do up the laces all the way up the shoe's tongue yourself.
These shoes are cute and cozy, my feet love them, people go crazy about my Naughty Monkeys'.

I'm a nurse in a busy facility. I rarely have the luxury of sitting down during my shift. I am always walking and standing. I really don't have foot problems but saw this ad and thought I'd buy a pair to see how they feel. First - the sizing is a bit odd. I wear a standard size 8 - medium width, and I guess I was too quick to order the 8M- which turns out to be US size 8D. These shoes are a bit snug around the toe area, and my feet are not wide at all. The heel also comes up a bit high on my ankle, which is a bit uncomfortable.They are sturdy shoes and I expect them to last a long, long time. Compared to the nurse shoes I usually wear, these shoes are pretty hard. I'm not 100% sure I'd order them again.
They fit and felt great right out of the box. I would recommend these shoes to anyone.

lighter and more breathable than anything i've worn before (great for hot summer days) - so comfortable, it's hard not to wear them around casually - i hope they hold up for awhile, but i'm ready to buy a new pair when these wear out - definitely buy .5-1 size bigger as recommended

This product works as advertised. My only complaint is that it doesn't really feel sturdy enough to hold 4 heavy boots at one time. The arms flex rather easily, and I would be afraid that they would crack and break off if you tried to dry 4 ski boots at once. I'll do two boots and two gloves, or 4 gloves, but not 4 boots. If you really think that you'll need to dry 4 boots at once, I would recommend that you get two of the boot dryers that you insert down into the boots.

I wore these all through the 80s - but when the 80s ended, I could never find them again. Now, thanks to the internet, I can buy a new pair anytime I want to. Now, if they only came in tigerstripe or leopard print..

Very comfortable. Good sandal for walking. Delivery was prompt. I bought the natural color although I was really interested in the multi color one. The computer images made it look too dark and/or colored and I was more interested in a subtle tone.

I love the new reebok shoes but they should make them for women also. Because they are wonderful they feel good when you were them. The reason I gave the shoes 4 stars is because they don't make them for women becuse most women play sports like: basketball, and other sports. I think that they are wonderful as a matter of fact you should buy some and I mean right now! Go, run and get these before there is none let. Serious cause knowing me and all of my friends and family are going to be wearing them. I love reebok shoes!!!! Buy them NOW I mean it!!!

I really like these ballet shoes. They are a little snug, I ordered my actual shoe size (8.5) and probably could have used a 9, but they will stretch out with wear. They are comfortable and were a great value!!

For over 25 years I have relied on Softspots for casual wear. The shoes are durable and very comfortable. Great for travel and slip off going through airport security. The range of color choices (black, navy, brown, taupe) add a plus.
I previously had the same Keds sneaker. Liked them. Ordered a medium width, not a wide width. Had to return them.

The last time I went to Brazil, I was really young and was able to bring back a couple of Havaianas. Ten years later, some of those shoes worn out because of so much wear! This shoes are super comfy like walking of marshmallows. So I had to restock so I this one on Amazon. I love them and I just can't stop wearing them!

I'll be staying in the hospital for a few days in a couple months and I was looking for some type of slipper that I could throw away before I came home (I'm a germ freak when it comes to hospitals). This is perfect. It's cheap enough to be able to throw it out before I come home, it's more substantial than the hospital socks, but it's not as clumsy as slippers (for being in bed). I'll probably get another set for around the house.The only thing that is bugging me is that the elastic strap around the top is a little too tight for me and is digging into my skin. It may need to just loosen up a bit.

Before I extoll the virtues of how cute the boot is, all buyers should be aware that this style is known to run 1 size smaller than your normal size and they do not have half sizes so you MUST order one size up.Beyond that, they are great quality, cute, comfortable and practical for colder areas and very trendy for this fall ...wear with pencil thin jeans or with boot socks and minis. I highly recommend them over the typical UGG look for this trend...just a little something extra to them in style.(It is also advisable to put a suede protectant on them to prevent damage from water and such.)
Great product....and this coming from a reformed CROC hater. You'll never wear a more comfy pair!!!
Great purchase! Great service! Great delivery! my boyfriend was very happy with his present. Thank you for making it so easy

This is my second pair of these boots, and I bought a pair for my son, also. Though I would like the soles to last longer, I realize that I am hard on my boots. There is that balance between softness/traction and hardness/longevity to consider. The uppers stay in great shape. I am very satisfied with the boots, and Amazon is a very reliable company to work with. They ship accurately and quickly.

My eight year old received these for Christmas and wears them constantly. They are durable, comfortable and look great! I did order them in his actual size and found them to be roomy, but with a heavy sock it's fine. He absolutely adores them!

I write this after having just received and unboxed the boots earlier today. After only a few hours they appear to be amazingly well built.I have been an avid hiker and backpacker across the years, but have scaled back the last few as I entered into fatherhood.Merrells tended to be my brand of choice, with the all leather ones faring the best.As time went on, I changed my boots for my budget, from Vasque to North Face, and most recently to the Asolo FSN95s.The last pair I bought based on both price and glowing reviews.I had thought I sized them correctly, but they have always felt rather narrow and tight overall.I wear size 11 for nearly all my footwear and did the same for those, but should have gotten the 11.5s in hindsight.They were adequate for day hikes, but I nearly tore off my heels on a recent backpacking trip into the Adirondack high peaks.Enough was enough, and I began my look elsewhere with more of an eye on comfort, fit, and quality than on overall cost.Again my eyes tended towards my faithful Merrell Wilderness boots, but then I found the Danners.These are all leather, and gore tex lined for breathability and waterproofing, well fitting out of the box, and better yet - USA made.The price on these retails as the Merrell Wilderness, but with sale pricing they were nearly half off, and a far better all american bargain (which Merrells are no longer.)I had purchased these in 11EE, so it should have been wider than normal.So I was rather surprised to find the fit as good as it was on the sides, which tells me these tend to run narrow - so size your pair accordingly.The cost is more than your average sneaker style boot, but considering how well leather will mold to the feet, I expect these to fit and endure far better after a short breaking in period.The boots can also be resoled (only by Danner for a fee), and there are many reviews from long time users all over with 10-20 years of wear with nothing but pride in their written words.I look forward to fully breaking these in, and expanding on my review, but the hours I've walked around the yard and in my home, are enough to tell me I've certainly made the right choice for a quality product that can easily outlast 4 pairs of other branded boots, and cost far less in the end.I will be applyingObenauf's LP Boot Preservative (8 oz)in the next few days, which will enhance the leather, speed up the breaking in, and help them last.Bring on the years and miles!

This is the first pair of cowboy boots I have owned in a long time. I bought the boots because I was needing more arch support. These boots are great. Arches are supported, boots are very comfortable. I wore them the first day for 8 hours without any problems. I am thinking about buying a second pair in a different color.

I really like the look of these shoes. Everyone who sees them thinks they are cute. The feel like flimsy flip-flops on, though. If you are not OK with essentially walking around barefoot (no support) don't get them. Also, if you break off one of the sequines, the rest start coming off since they are just threaded on one string. I covered the toes with clear nailpolish in the hopes that they would not unravel more and to stop the other one from starting. It seems to have worked so far.
I have been buying Ecco shoes for years and find them to be very comfortable right away and they last a long time. I like them better than Rockport. I currently own three pairs.

I just received my "navy"/black shoes. They are not the navy shown in the picture. The color is almost exactly the same as the blue in the blue/orange shoe.I haven't decided if I will keep the shoes or not. Shipping was quite fast.

just love these boots. needed a plain black pair.. didnt want a heavy boot or a ridiculous price. so of course i went to Amazon and looked for timberland boots. my favorite place to shop and my favorite boot manufacturer. got a great price- fast delivery and a pair of boots in perfect condition. very happy with this purchase. i am a womens size 7= a 5.5 big kid in almost all timberlands. this is the only place that gives me the 3 things i need when buying tims, size,variety of design and prices i love! best part is i can shop in my pajamas :)
This is a nice sturdy shoe, but no matter that it is advertised as a "slip-on", a shoe horn is very much needed to put it on.

I had read the reviews to order bigger, because they run small, so I did. I ordered a full size larger, and they were still too small. I also ordered narrow, and they weren't very narrow. I had to send them back, and did not order a different size, because I didn't get the full refund. Very cute, but not worth it.
My three pairs of SAS shoes arrived this afternoon 2/9/11. I am happy with the speedy service and quality of product. I will order from Papa Shoes the next time I need SAS shoes.

Unfortunately Steve Madden has the dumbest policy on returns and exchanges for sale items. YOU CAN'T RETURN OR EXCHANGE THEM! I think I would have better things to say about this shoe if it fit me more appropriately..From past experiences with previous Steve Madden products, I found that I had to buy my shoes a 1/2 step up in order to get a more comfortable fit. I ordered these shoes online, so I went ahead and ordered a 7.5 thinking that would be the perfect fit. To my dismay, they were slightly loose and flapped when I walked around. Thank God there are "heel snugs" that you can buy at the grocery store in the shoe section (where the shoe polishes are, shoe laces, etc.) and once I applied the heel snugs into my shoe, it made a WORLD of difference. Now they fit perfect and at last I can give a review those shoes deserve.They are definitely dressy enough to wear with dress pants, yet casual enough to wear with jeans. The toe is pointy enough to give the illusion of slimmer legs. For those of you looking for comfort, I can guarantee that you will get a lot of mileage with these cute shoes!
I bought the reefs for my daughter and she loves them and says they are very comfortable.

The boots were very nice, warm and extremely comfortable but not much on looks. Also, I followed the advice of reviewers before me and ordered a size bigger and they are too big. So I would say they must be true to size.
Love the looks and confort of this shoe. Fit true to size and required no breaking in period. Goes with so many of my summer clothes.
good looking shoe, well constructed, but size runs small, at least 1/2 size.

hola todo fino Excelenteeeeee muy hola todo fino gustaooo muchoooooo everything right all excellent recommendy poreque esta muy buernono em ha llegadotodo bien lo recomiendobuenoooooooooooooooooooo recomendado
It's been awhile since I have worn Adissage sandals, but they are just like I remember..maybe more comfy. I like that there was a wide width choice..and the pink is pretty!!

Absolutly the best money I have invested on shoes. I live in a VERY cold part of the country and these are perfect for my 14 month old. Totally non-slip, and the fur goes all the way through the boot, so well made. Perfect and worth every penny!
This show is not only cute and wonderful color, but so very comfortable. Almost like wearing slippers. True to size and width.
I have only had these shoes for a short time and maybem they need to br broke in a little, but the arch area is a little uncomfortable.

I was so happy to receive it on the day it camebecause my other sneakers was worn out becauseit was torn, and I finally put my other sneakers inthe trash because I finally got this new sneakersto wear.

I have wore these since I was a kid, but now sadly these are hard to find. If you are looking for both quality and a product made in the states then these are the shoes for you. muy bien lo que se esperaba y en el tiempo estimado 100 % recomendado muy buena la compra del articulo
These came earlier than what was promised. They are durable and exactly what I was looking for at a reasonable price

If you have worn soccer shoes before, it will not come as a surprise to you that they fit VERY snugly at first. I like to wear-in my soccer shoes slowly, so I wore them during school, and took them off right afterward. It took about a week for them to stretch out, but now they fit my feet perfectly.

These sandals are the most comfortable shoes I have worn in a long time. I have several pairs in different colors and practically live in them all summer. I would recommend them to anybody who wants a pair of sandals.
We received the sneakers rapidly. They were just what we ordered and at a better price than I could find in the store.

I had to order a pair of these for my daughter for a play she is in. Normally she is between a 5 1/2 and a 6. We purchased a 6 1/2 thinking we would be ok... nope! Way too tight! We are returning the 6 1/2. After calling around we found a place about 35 minutes away that has one pair which turns out is a 7. My advice if you order these.... order 2 LARGER pairs at the same time and return the ones that don't fit since size seems to be a common issue with these shoes.
These shoes are great - comfortable and durable - exacly what I was looking for! I have worn them for multiple performances and they still look great!
You can never go wrong with SAS shoes. The delivery of the shoes was great and in a timely fashion, I'm sure I will order again, and the prices can't be beat!
nice and confort but bigger than real size.maybe is because they are men shoes.anyway, they were enough confortable to use in daily life.

Propets are good shoes & I have happily owned several, however this particular model# 3902 runs large. Advise you order a half size smaller than your regular size. These shoes are very comfortable and durable. They fit very well. Would reccomend them to anyone looking for a comfortable pair of shoes
Love the shoe! It's kinda retro but it feels great. Exceeds my expectations. What more can I say? It's a Reebok!

These are good shoes that will save your feet lots of trouble. They will accommodate inserts such as orthotics if you need to use them. They do not, as the copywriter suggests, "feel like going barefoot" -- they are a bit warm in summer as closed leather shoes tend to be. They are well made and give your foot plenty of support where it is needed. You'll notice they mostly come in colors suitable for nurses, but I am not a nurse, so I wear the black ones and sometimes children see my feet in bathroom stalls and think a man is there! What I'm trying to say is, while these shoes look quite respectable, they are not very feminine. However, if you get foot problems from less structured shoes as I did, these are great.
I love these shoes. Durable, dependable, flexible. I use a different pair for winter weather but for every other season converses always fit.
Product was exactly as expected. Extremely satisfied with the purchase. Word twelve thirteen fourteen fifteen sixteen seventeen eighteen nineteen and twenty-one.

The shoe needs to be ordered a full size up. I did, and the shoe fit perfectly. However, I was dissapointed with the quality. The fur was very weak. In fact, it was already bold on the back of the left shoe, and I have not even worn them! Also, the fur was poorly sawn in and splitting on the same shoe. Comfort was there. However, I could not envision being able to wear the shoe more then a few times before the fur would complately disapear, leaving a bold and tired looking spot. Not worth it!

I love these tap shoes, which are replacing my original patent leather shoes I bought prior to my first tap lesson. These are soooo comfortable and the sound is great. I wished I'd purchased them a long time ago. Some reviewers have complained about the screws falling out. I haven't had that problem but I have only had these shoes for a month.I originally purchased a half size larger than my shoe size, but they were too snug. I hesitated about ordering a full size larger (thinking they would have to be too roomy), but they are a perfect fit.

I have always like Grasshopper shoes and was pleased to see Amazon had a pair that would suit my needs. They arrived promptly, but sad to say, they were the wrong size. I had omitted to notice they were a W width and I have a narrow foot. The cost and trouble of returning them is not worth it, and nobody here that I know of wears a size 11W, so I'm stuck with them.

Sent these to my daughter in law in Calif I live in Indiana very convient. She let me know what size and color also sent her a picture and a birthday message Very nice. very happy very very satisified
Arrived in 2 days.Still the same wonderful shoes I remember from high school 25 years ago.

I have no idea what everyone is talking about when they say that these are poor quality. They appear to be the same exact keds that you would buy in any store. I'm not sure if the other reviewers received a different shoe, or just aren't familiar with ked's. Also, the sizes are the same as normal ked's. I regret listening to the reviewers who said that they run small. I ordered a half a size up from what I normally wear, and they're too loose. I'll keep them anyway because they're so inexpensive, but I wish I hadn't listened. Probably unrelated, but I ordered these on friday at 8pm and chose one day shipping and they arrived saturday morning at 9:48. Excellent shipping.

I was debating whether I wanted to buy a pair online or just go into a store and buy them there. Boy am I glad I went to go buy them in person... as other people have mentioned, Converse run a little big so a size 11 (which I am) is really a 9 or so. I ended up getting an 8/5 and I haven't worn 8/5 size shoes since I was 13. You really want to go and buy them in person and completely avoid this problem.
I asked for a black converse all star. Shoes arrive on time as schedules and in perfect condition! They came in their original box.

I use this shoe for training and for racing, for long runs and for interval workouts. My weekly mileage is in the 30-38 mile range, and the Green Silence is a nice, light ride. I believe the weight is advertised as 8.3 ounces, and without getting out my wife's food scale, I'd say that's a pretty accurate estimate. My sense is that there's a limit to the number of miles I'd take this shoe. The cushioning is limited, but the overall feel is pleasantly surprising. Short distances feel really smooth; longer distances slightly less so, compared to traditional trainers. The payoff, though, is the lightweight feel and speed--the exact qualities I want in a shoe when I'm looking to do faster training.
They are not only made well but comfortable and durable. Timberland makes a good product and they last (my last pair must have been 10yrs +). Throw in a good price and you can't loose.
I normally wear an extra wide shoe. I ordered these in size 4E and it was too narrow to even start getting my foot into it.

So I ordered these shoes, thinking they would look just like the picture. I was wrong, they came exactly on the day they said they would deliver. I opened them & I was so disappointed at what I saw. The shoes were not only the color I didn't want, but also HUGE,WIDE & not what I expected. They came in a nice box though, but besides that I would not Buy these. I was so disappointed & I paid $71.00 for these? There's So many shoes out there...that you can BUY for less..& look just as good. I shouldn't' have paid this much for these shoes..

This shoe is a high quality product of the Capezio Ballet Shoe, manufactured in Vietnam from Leather (upper) and Suede (sewn sole as shown). Contrary to other reviews, the ONLY man-made fabric/material is the inner lining, thread, strap and bow. These are genuine leather shoes.BEWARE: Sizing is WAY off. See photos for comparison to size 3 street shoe for reality.They come packaged in tissue paper and a small compact end flap box (not a "shoe box"), suitable for wrapping.Pros --Excellent quality for the identical shoe costing $30+ at local outlets-Leather+Suede with Fabric man-made breathable lining.Cons -Sizing is the only issue here. Consider fitting your Ballerina at a local store, and then ordering these shoes here, or at worst, adding 2 sizes to the "street shoe" size shown.All in all the shoes are a great buy at the sub $25 price range, and smell like Ferrari's (Leather) out of the box.

I am on my fifth pair of these sandals, yes 5th. pair!! they are the BEST!!!! Bought my first pair in Old Branson, Missouri and in love with them ever since,hope they never discontinue these planning on purchasing another pair,like to have an extra pair on hand!!!

My first pair of these were stolen by a relative so goes to show how nice they are that I felt compelled to replace them. These shoes go with everything. You can dress them up slightly and they won't look out of place. (Great for those of us who aren't too fond of heels but who don't want to rock regular tennis shoes all day long.) They're comfortable. A good weight. Durable. Easy to clean. I love them.
My granddaughter asked for these at Christmas. She thinks they are awesome and can't wait to wear them to school in the new year.
Bought as a gift for my son. They were true to fit size, comfortable and a very good price.
I purchased shoes from Overstock.com and the shoes were perfect. They arrived on time and the fit was exact. Will certainly order from the manufacturer again.
I just received my first pair and they were not true to size (9 1/2) so I have to return them and get larger size. Beware.

I have worn these for many years and will keep buying them as long as I can buy them. I usually get a year out of them. Very light but supportive. If you're looking for something comfortable and durable these are very good shoes and conservative enough that you can wear them working in an office.

I have had several pairs of these boots over the years and liked them. The most recent pair had a manufacturing defect that was biting thre inside of my left ankle. I had to lace them so loose that the support was inadequate. I guess with Chinese children making boots you can't expect perfection.
This shoe is so comfortable and got to be one of the best running and basketball shoe. Plus your getting official Iverson shoes!Great shoe!

Dada's are some of the best basketball shoes i have ever had. The only bad thing i have found is the price difference between youth and large. $20.00 more for a bigger size is rediculous, but other than that they are really cool shoes especially how you can personalize them with your teams colors and your team name, your name, and your number. Some of the reasons they are really good shoes are because they are comfortable, have good traction, and just look good.

i have had several pairs of these boots over the last 4 years, all desert (5'7", 135). they are extremely comfortable, like a tennis shoe, very flexible, breathable, lightweight. however, if you are going to be doing much of anything beyond a couple hours in the field with a light to moderate pack, i couldn't recommend these. there just isn't much support, anywhere. the ankle and the 'shank' are the most obvious areas where the lack of support is apparent. also, several of my mates have had the stitching fail around the forefoot of these boots. but for light work, i haven't worn a boot yet that is more comfortable.

I have bought this shoe two times. The first time I went to a Stride Rite at the mall and paid much more for them. The second time I bought them online for a better deal. I continue to be satisfied with this shoe. My daughter has loved them as well. They go great with anything. She is outgrowing her second pair, but I will wait until they have her size.
I love these shoes. Durable, dependable, flexible. I use a different pair for winter weather but for every other season converses always fit.
These shoes are great for work. They are comfortable (not too wide either so I'm not swimming in them) and look really nice to boot. Overall happy with my purchase.
I bought a size up mostly for ease to slip them on and off and this was the right choice for me. They are very warm and comfortable.

For the money, I don't think you can buy a better hiking boot. In fact I think these boots are a great buy even at full list price. At least for my feet, Hi-Tec boots have always been long on comfort and durability. I've had these boots for several years and worn them for hiking, birding and general outdoor stuff. They're great for keeping your feet dry crossing streams or walking through wet grass. They require little if any break in. There's really nothing wrong with the laces that come with the boots, but for just a few bucks I prefer some good round boot laces on them. For me these are easier to tighten and have a more substantial feel.
A great boot. I've been using the Copa Mudial for 15+ years. They last a long time, feel great and are just a classic.

These were represented as Gray and Navy. They are SILVER and Navy Blue. Luckily they are running shoes for my son and color is not as important as fit. He is very happy with them. They are true to size and very comfortable.
relatively comfortable. The front of my ankle hurts if i lace it too tightly. We will see if this improves with breaking it in.

This is a fairly nice shoe, with moderate comfort. It is easy to slip on, but not as "cushy" as I had hoped. Overall, I am pleased with the shoe, but thought it was a little high priced considering the lack of comfort.

I recently purchased two pair crocs from Amazon, the Dahlia one featured on this review and a pair of yellow ones. I love both of them. I have also purchased other Crocs from Amazon in the last few months. The reviews I read at the time I purchased my first pair from Amazon was quite helpful as it mentioned that the sizing was off from the usual size you wear,that you need to go up one size,so that is what I did,and they all fit perfectly. I love the large variety of colors Amazon offers.I hardly ever wear any shoes other than crocs. I have two kinds of arthritis,so it is difficult to put on shoes other than those into which I can just slide my feet,plus they are so comfortable.
These shoes are very narrow so it is important that you as the consumer buy a whole size bigger if you are interested. Other wise they are comfortable and stylish.

I love these shoes! I bought a pair almost ten years ago and wore them until the rubber fell apart on the sole. They are durable, go with lots of outfits and last forever in today's terms. I would buy them again and again.

This is a good looking shoe. But they are narrow. I was surprised because I have bought many pairs in the past and never had this problem. The bad thing is I bought 3 pair and all of them are them same, narrow. I wish now I had bought a 1/2 size bigger.

This is a beautifully classic shoe and quality is nice. The heel composition is the exception. It is a hard, hard plastic or rubber. It is very slippery on tile or brick floors. Be careful. As other reviewers indicated, the sizing is off. Consider ordering a half size larger.

The Shudoh Cellerator is a great shoe. It comes with two puma cell inserts, one for added comfort, one for added stability. These insoles slip right under the normal insole. They are great but the only problem is that the insoles make the boot tighter, so i would advise anyone who is buying these to buy a half size larger. Review of product purchased from Amazon.com: I find the shoes good quality for the price. They are just what I ordered, and I have several colorsof the same shoe.
