These flip-flops are extremely comfortable once they form to your feet (which seems to take about a week), and hold up well to extensive wear. I wear mine on a daily basis for at least 8 months of the year, and have used them for everything from going to the store to short hikes in the woods. I'm now on my second pair, but the first pair lasted over 2 years under constant use, so I definitely feel I got my money's worth. The plain colored options (black and brown) are classy enough to wear with some skirts, making these flip-flops extremely versatile. I've worn them to amusement parks where I've been on my feet all day, on canoeing trips in the Everglades, and while hiking trails in PA and NJ parks, and I've never gotten blisters or had trouble with them not being comfortable. Can't recommend them highly enough!
The boots arrived before expected, which was good. The boots fit very good and I wear them almost every day.Couldn't have a better pair.

You cant go wrong with Chucks. I have been wearing them for the passed year out here in Afghanistan. These sizes published are off an inch. I can get my feet in them, but the top arch makes them to tight. I've been buying these shoes for over a decade, same problem with size today as a decade ago. They are very soft, and super comfortable if you get the right size, zero break in time. i love natural comfort and own 3 pair of this brands platform wedges as i an totally into the bohemian look for summer. they are comfortable i work in retail so i am on my feet 6 to 12 hours a day and these do the job as far as me not limping home after a shift they are great for providing the hieght you need for all of your long wide leg jeans and pants minus the discomfort i would recommend going a half size up but thats because you should always size up when wearing heels particularly open toed ones since your foot will slide forward a bit while walking i would recommend this product and brand to anyone especially if you are wobbly on heels or just find them extremely uncomfortable id also recommend amazon.com because the service is great fast easy and hassle free

was bought for my daughter! she wore them under she prom dress. She has many pairs of converse shoes! She loves them!
Bought these for my daughter and she absolutely loves them. Super comfy, great quality! Would recommend them to everyone. Very nice.

i've been looking for mary jane's for a while and decided that i'd give these a try since they were so reasonably priced. they also come in wide sizes, and that's a plus. i just received them and i have yet to wear them. i did try them on. while they are super cute, they are also really big. my feet get wider the closer you get to my toes, so my feet are sort of like...ducks feet?! lol. anyway, i imagine these would be comfortable enough for people that have the longer second toe. my second toe is much shorter than my big toe, that combined with the duck-like shape of my feet, causes these shoes to be a bit uncomfortable. the way the toe area is designed it leaves a huge gap between my smaller toes and the end of the shoe, and presses my big toe into my other toes.i realize that the shape of my feet are not the norm, but i know a few other people with similar problems and i thought i'd point these things out. to be make it clear...the toe area has it's longest point in front of where the second toe would be. anyone with a wide width across their toes might find these uncomfortable.they are also a lot bigger than i expected. i usually wear a regular 9 1/2 and these wide width 9's feel a lot more like a 10 or a 10 1/2 to me.they are cute though.

My daughter needed them for a performance. I ordered them in a size 7 and she wears a 6. We tried them on at a local store first to be sure. I ordered them with a 2 day shipping and the arrived right on time. Overall, super satisfied with this purchase! Great product and great job by Amazon!

These slippers were ok, but definitely run wide. In street shoes I wear a 10 or 10.5 and I often size up to an 11 in loafers or ballet flats to accomodate my slightly wide feet. I ordered a 10W since these slippers are not offered in an 11, and they were loose even with the drawstring completely tightened. I ended up exchanging for a pair of Blochs, which come in longer lengths.
This shoe lives up to the Grasshopper name. Comfortable and washes well. It is true to size and cool on your feet.
Nice boots, very comfy. Still not sure about these crepe soles, doesnt feel like much impact resistance. Either way a great desert boot

So far I'm extremely pleased with these shoes. Quite comfortable, stable and supportive. Really don't know what more you could ask for in a sub $40 pair of tennis shoes. Thus far they have exceeded my expectations.
Love the sandals. Ordered black and would definitely order another pair. They have a true fit to the size ordered.

Cute, inexpensive, name band, Tennis shoe for my 6 year. She loves them & finds them very comfortable. It's cheaper to purchase them here on Amazon, rather than in a shoe store like; Footlocker, Shoe Carnival, or Kids Foot Locker

best shoes i've bought. Rollbar technology works wonders for the normal person, keeps your heel stable and supports. Great if you have fallen arches or are overweight.New Balance make the truest sized shoes out there, and in wide sizes. Highly recommended...

This is my fifth pair of ballistic so far. I bought my first ones about 14 years ago and was immediately satisfied with their confort. This is a product of excellent quality that, on average, tends to last more than 3 years without breaking apart. Please, keep in mind that I do use them often and I am not a sedentary person. They are a bit tall compared to other sneakers, but that has never been a problem. Really confortable and highly recommended.

I purchased these shoes because I have a hard time finding my size 5. I have purchased these before through another place and they seemed to be more comfortable and softer inside. I can only wear these for a short time before my feet start to hurt and I have to remove them.

I looked high and low for this type of boot slipper. Deerfoams used to make them but apparently not anymore. When I wear sliipers I want them to keep my ankles warm too and these are perfect. I only gave four stars because within a month one of the pull straps broke. Otherwise I love them.

Timberland is a good product. I have a few pairs of shoes from Timberland. Theses boots do have a solid fit, as one customer stated, but the fit is very comfortable! Gives a sold footing with walking in the unpredictable winter weather. Highly recommended. The price is extremely low for a Timberland product. This boot is a winner!
This brand fits me very well, making it easy to order online which I have done more than a dozen times.
Lamentablemente, Aún no he recibido el producto que compré. Todavía estoy esperando respuesta del vendedor. Agradezco hacer lo APROPIADO a fin de saber ¿Qué pasó?. Muchas gracias.

I ordered a pair at 6 1/2 WW (EE). For that size and width, according to standard sizing charts, the sole should be 3 3/4-4" wide at the widest. These are 3 1/4". According to standard size charts, that would be a C width at most.It's really too bad, as these appear to be very attractive boots otherwise. Why bother advertising and supporting widths if your widest size is so narrow.

I got these shoes in 2 days ago ... I had to place a pair of Heel insoles in them for a little more cushion, but over all they are great!!! Paired with the insoles, they are like walking on a cloud - the shoes are true to size.2/18/13 - So Fast forward a few months - These are not what I thought - no more walking on clouds - I had to put insoles in them after the 1st month and they squeeze the top of my foot too tightly- Have not been wearing them in the last month and 1/2. Purchased Sketchers Go Walk to replace them - Have insoles in these too for the heels, but It's more like walking on air and my feet can breathe.

I ordered these in fall when I was going for a backpacking trip and I could just forget about twisting an ankle or anything. Wear these, step on any kind of surface with confidence, lots of grip, good support for the ankle. Will highly recommend these for snow as well as adventure!!

For the shoe, I dig the look, the ease and the functionality. The price is fine around fifty.The problem is here they want to say you save against an MSRP. Converse doesn't even sell their shoes on their site for the MSRP. The savings is fictional.
i got these shoes back in like early January and all ready the side is coming apart there is a open on the side. but there good shoes.

They need to note on this listing that in Capezio world woman's size 3 is a child's size 1. So if you buy your kid with size 3 feet a size 3, you are going to get a shoe that is way too small! It's very irritating, cause at this age/size, you can't buy from the listing that have child sizes anymore. Otherwise the shoes look very nice. You do have to start sewing on the elastic now - not like the Daisy's that come with it presewed. Just do the math and make sure you get the right size.

This is my first pair of character shoes that I was asked to purchase for an opera I am in at my school. I was very worried about ordering shoes online as I have a somewhat weird, pretty wide foot. I typically do not buy a wide size, however, and all of my shoes are either 9 or 9.5 (okay- the occasional 10 for my winter boots because of thick socks). I went up half a size and ordered in wide width based on Amazon's suggestion and all of the reviews. I immediately tried them on and they fit perfectly, and will fit great with a thin tight as well. Very happy I decided not to go up a full size as that wouldn't have worked. However, everybody is different, so trust your gut! They're very comfortable, well made, and I can't wait to use them on stage. Best of all, returns were free if they didn't fit!

I clicked on the blue shoe, 5th in line on this page, and it was entitled "Garden" and I received green shoes. The green shoes that the official chacos website considers "Garden". I am very upset because if I am going to spend this much money on a pair of shoes, I expect to receive what I ordered and I did not.
I got these for my daughter and she loves them. They are just as described and are very good quality.

These boots are comfortable from the very beginning. The leather is soft, supple and water resistannt, yet thick enough to provide adequate support. Fit is true to size and the black rubber sole blends perfectly with the black leather. The insole is removable, but not very substantial. At least it can be easily removed and replaced with a better insole. I would have liked to have seen speed-lace grommets for easier on/off capability and maybe a greater number lace pattern than the four this shoe provides. Other than that, it's a great shoe for the money, and I have yet to lose an inch square chunk from my sole, as the previous rater experienced.

I purchased the Naturalizer shoe, Scout, Since I already have bought 4 or 5 pr Naturalizer shoes through Amazon, I knew the quality of the shoe, and what service to expect and I have not bee disappointed. Easily, a 5-star experience!
Chucks are always awesome and this one came in an awesome condition! My only qualm about this line of converse is that it provides no support as do most converse.

i have owned several pairs of these! they are the best sandals i have ever owned. the last pair lasted over 2 years and i wore them when i walked in the breast cancer 3-day walk....yes, i wore them to walk at least 40 of the 60+ miles of the three day and my feet felt better than they did when i walked with expensive running shoes! what makes them so awesome is how they conform to your feet! they feel better than walking barefoot! enjoy!

I ordered these over a week ago after a long search for inexpensive Gore-Tex boots. They are comfortable, offer no pinch spots for my medium-volume feet, and performed well on a five-mile hike in 20 degree weather.I have two gripes - one, after such a short period, I've already noticed slight separation between the leather upper and the rubberized outer sole. Secondly, my sturdy-looking laces have already begun to fray and weaken in one spot.Both of these issues are minor, though, and easily repairable. I'm pleased with their waterproof qualities so far, and found nothing comparable in their price range.

I was very nervous ordering this shoe for my husband for Christmas, without him trying it on. After reading other reviews, I decided to do it, and I'm glad I did. He really likes the shoes and has commented on how comfortable they are. We will buy another pair in Brown!
I bought these for my son, since he needs wide shoes to fit him comfortably, but these were really not wider than other shoes. Very disappointed.

I love crocs. I seriously can't believe I do, I mean I hated them for so long and finally gave in to all the excitement. To my surprise they are wonderful and comfortable and all around enjoyable. I wear them to the grocery store, to work, around the house and they never get old. If you're a doubter like I was, I say just try them, you'll never know how they feel until you do.
These boots might have an economy price, but they aren't cheap. They probably wouldn't stand up to road work, but for everything else they'll keep your feet dry and comfortable.
At first I thought these shoes seemed a little small. I wore them around the house for a while and they are correctly sized. I am happy with the look, feel and quality of this shoe.

The dye on these shoes comes off. I bought this to wear around the house and they are comfortable enough per the other reviews, but they turned the soles of my feet black after an hour of wearing it on the first day. My clean feet looked really dirty after wearing these although I was just walking around on carpet at home.

This is a very comfortable well wearing shoe. This is my second purchase. When the time comes to buy another new pair of shoes, if these are still available, I WILL buy another pair. My only problem was that the liner in my first pair wore out, after two years, before the rest of the shoe.

I love these shoes!! I have a pair of black and silvers and they really are my favorite pair of shoes. I'd say they give you at least a good inch in height, so my pants aren't dragging on the ground and it makes me look leaner. It's a simple style that is really good looking! I own the suede/nylon ones opposed to the all leather ones, and my only con about them is that the suede can fade due to too much walking in the snow or rain. This may be eliminating by spraying them and avoiding those conditions!! Otherwise they're comfortable and I wouldn't give em up for the world!!

The mocs were beautiful, soft and supple, and didn't fit at all. With feet swollen from a recent accident, I thought they would be perfect for the times I actually have to wear shoes, and was crushed because they didn't fit. Other shoes, marked less wide, do. They made a wonderful gift for a loved one, who wears a narrower width, and she was ecstatic, but I was/am disappointed.
It's amazingly comfortable. It took about 2-3 days to break in the leather. The arch helps support my balance when walking and the shoes ventilate really well.

First I like the boots, but I have calf's that are larger than 14"s. That is why I ordered a lager size. They fitted fine, but when I was removing them the zippers got jammed and on one I had to destroy the zipper to get it off and the other I was able to remove with the zipper still jammed. I whish they made a boots that are not all the way to below the knee. I do superhero costumes and I like the range of colors they have. I would to liked to know more information on getting boots for a larger calf's I am not the only person that has this problem and now I may have to order a second pair of boots to replace the ones that got damaged.

Disclaimer: I did not purchase these boots from Amazon, and I would recommend trying these on prior to purchase unless you don't mind exchanging them, but I feel that way about all shoes.I have had these boots and worn them just short of five days a week for over a year. The best thing about them is the sole, which feels like a pair of NB sneakers (read: good support, comfortable for all day wear). The construction is excellent, I got these for use riding a motorcycle, so they get a decent amount of wear, and in the past year the only noticeable damage is to the ribs along the vertical seams on the sides of the boots. The seams are all undamaged, just the edge of the leather has frayed some. For me, that is excellent. Normally, my sneakers will have torn seams, noticeable wear-through on the sole, and often the sole will start to become unglued. None of that has been an issue with these boots. Well-built and well-designed, sturdy and comfortable.

This is my 2nd time ordering these shoes. The shoes are well made, and long lasting. I feel like I am wearing house slippers when I wear these shoes yet they are supportive to my high arch. The shoes seem to run true to size. They are of good quality and long lasting. i highly recommend these shoes for those of us who do a lot of standing and/or walking.

I ordered a pair of these shoes in size 12 EEEE and was not at all satisfied with the width of this shoe; it is at best a D or E width. Also the leather uppers are very stiff and will require extensive breaking in.
Excellent made and very comfortable. I wear these shoes all the time. They are more comfortable when I am moving than when I sit. Highly recommend
speedy shipping, package arrived before estimated time of delivery.gladly do business with seller again any day of the week.

After reading multiple reviews that the wide is really not wide enough, I figured I would order a wide. I generally do not have a problem with regular shoes, although some feel slightly too narrow. I measured my foot which seemed to be between an M and a C/D, so I went with the wide since apparently it was not wide enough for most people. Unfortunately, the shoe is wayy to wide for me. I am generally between an 8 and an 8.5 and I went with the 8, which fits fine length wise.I got the wheatfield leather. I am a student and I walk at least a mile a day and live a generally active life, and I needed real shoes for my weak feet and ankles! I was hoping to wear them day-today and mostly at my restaurant, which has no dress code. I have been wearing slip on vans with 0 arch support. At the end of each 7-8 hour shift, my feet and legs ache and after I sit for a while after a shift, I end up hobbling around until my feet readjust to walking. These shoes seem like they'll help with much better support. I was hoping they would look even better than they do, but they look more like old lady shoes than I anticipated (I am 22, so perhaps I define old lady differently!). The top of the shoe ends pretty far down my foot, which means if I wear skinny jeans my socks will definitely show. I suppose this means I should start wearing matching socks.But I still think its worth it to return them for an M.

I love crocs. I seriously can't believe I do, I mean I hated them for so long and finally gave in to all the excitement. To my surprise they are wonderful and comfortable and all around enjoyable. I wear them to the grocery store, to work, around the house and they never get old. If you're a doubter like I was, I say just try them, you'll never know how they feel until you do.
Very good fit and a great price. I would recommend the shoes to anyone. I prefer shoes from a company that makes shoes a part of their major product lines.

For years my two sons have not been able to find a soccer shoe that properly fits their feet.So we special order size 15 for one son and a size 12 1/2 for the other. Neither shoe can be bought in stores. A size 12 is too small and a size 13 is too big. My sons have been using Copas for several years now and will probably keep getting them as long as they can be purchased in their sizes.

These are probably my eighth or ninth pair of Enzo Liberty Loafers. I have had them in many colors over the years; they wear well. I do have to replace my basic colors occasionally and these are replacing my old black ones. Thsey are comfortable from the first wearing forward, are a flattering fit and look good with casual and work clothes. When they are on sale, they are an unbeatable value.
Perfect for many costumes and not all that uncomfortable. Very happy with the product and price!
Classic slaps, but with light and "Cooshy" Sanuk footbed..."Broken in" feel right out of the box, Great price...Why aren't you ordering yours right now ?

I bought these shoes because they supposedly have good arch support and help with pronation. Well, neither is true for me, but with my custom arch supports inserted in them, they are tolerable. I like how they look and they are comfortable otherwise. They fit true to size.

Ive worn Converse Hi-tops for 26 years,since I was a 13 year old skater.I saw my heroes growing up wearing them also-The Ramones,Stray Cats,The Dead Boys,etc. & various skateboarders of the 80s & 90s.Theyve been around for decades,& the design hasnt changed much.They are the most comfortable shoe in my opinion,and the Hi-tops give great ankle support for whatever sport or slampit its put thru.
Great,comfortable finally a sneaker in my B with not medium like Reebok etc. Fits nice and snug and wears well.
Very cool shoes, decent price and a very quick shipper. what more could you ask for?
These are amazing! The most comfortable walking/hiking shoe ever. I have no regret about purchasing these. They are great.

just love these boots. needed a plain black pair.. didnt want a heavy boot or a ridiculous price. so of course i went to Amazon and looked for timberland boots. my favorite place to shop and my favorite boot manufacturer. got a great price- fast delivery and a pair of boots in perfect condition. very happy with this purchase. i am a womens size 7= a 5.5 big kid in almost all timberlands. this is the only place that gives me the 3 things i need when buying tims, size,variety of design and prices i love! best part is i can shop in my pajamas :)
Great shoe! Love the selection of colors! A must have!

These are nice and soft slippers but they are very large around the they were much to short for the given size. I kept them only because I knew they would stretch a bit and have but still to short which is sad. I do not like slippers with rubber or synthetic soles for our doors and these are soft leather which is why I bought them.

I am in LOVE with these boots! They fit great and are oh-so comfortable. I bought these to wear because they are so versatile and go with absolutely everything. I have worn them with shorts, jeans and they look great with dresses! Now that I own a pair of Ariat boots, I am hooked!!! The only odd thing about the boots is the way they size them. I normally wear a 9.5, but I had to get these in a 9.5 wide because the fit is so narrow.
My daughter shamed me into wearing these comfortable and stylish shoes, claiming that I was "dated" in wearing my regular running shoes. They are comfortable and I receive many compliments.

These shoes are very comfortable and good looking for casual dress. Furthermore, on a really rainy day I found out how waterproof they are. I stood in 2 inch deep puddles and my feet stayed perfectly dry. 5 stars from me.
Got a fantastic deal on these shoes and am very pleased!!

I usually get the more target brand converse in a size 8, which fit great, but when I ordered these in a size 8 they were uncomfortable. They felt just slightly too big and didn't fit well around my foot, I don't think ordering a half size down would have helped. I tried to break them in, but they gave me blisters, twice!

I ran in every generation of this stability-control shoe since gen-2. By gen-9 they have totally trashed the shoe. The ride for slight over-pronators has definitely degraded, but the maddening and absolutely inexcusable design flaw is the d*mned squeak that sets in anywhere between 50 & 125 miles of use. There's a tubular insert in the heal (just look at the bottom)that obviously loosens fairly quickly and then--squeak-squeak-squeak...every plant! (even when you're walking.)I've moved on to Mizuno Nirvana's--heavier, but what a great ride. Farewell, Adidas, I guess you didn't love me as much as I did you. Your loss, though, and likely forever.

I really enjoyed these tennis shoes. I had never heard of them until my husband saw they were recommended in consumer reports, and I felt that they were very comfortable. It is time I buy a new pair...

I have a wide toe box, but a narrow heel. Wide 4E widths in New Balance or Asics fit me fine in the toe box and heel. The Spira in a 4E was a tad narrow in the toes and my heel popped up and down. Their wide width would be great for those with big, huge, fat wide feet all around, or those with wide heels. I tried Spiras a few years ago, and could feel the spring in my step, but NOT with these. And the cheap Chinese craftsmanship was very apparent--I had to cut the top holes of the shoes all the way through myself with scissor tips to make the laces go through. These classics were a real let-down and have promptly been returned.

For a person with a high arch and skinny heel, I have had a really hard time finding a fashion athletic shoe that fits right and stays put! This style is great - love the larger criss cross elastic straps.

Very nice leather version of a classic. significant savings over surf shops for same sandal. Needed a couple of weeks to break in, but now very comfortable, and I always have a bottle opener on hand (or under foot, whatever).
These shoes look so comfortable and cool. I wish i could get them, but I think they're way too expensive!

I ordered thise for my son for Christmas. He usually wears a 13 but would have needed a 12 in these. He didn't really like them for hiking; they are more of a work boot. You can't just ship these back to amazon; you have to pay to do it.

I have always enjoyed the sensation of allowing my feet to be free and bare, however it's not possible to safely wander the world barefoot anymore. I discovered crocs almost three years ago. Since that fateful afternoon, I've worn nothing else (aside from the necessary pair of galoshes during the very wet days). I work as a preschool teacher, I am on my feet all day, running around, walking, standing, scrunching, taking my shoes on and off, and these are the only thing I willingly wear. I refuse to be bothered with pretty, comfort is my king! I wear them with socks because walking in tanbark can cause discomfort, and I usually do wear them in the rain and just carry socks in my bag. Since I wear these daily, they do tend to wear out after a handful of months and need to be replaced. The cost is low enough that it's still cheap enough to consider. Plus, there is no question, these shoes are always comfortable, every time with every new pair (I've gone through several). It seems unrealistic to expect that such a comfortable shoe will last forever. I highly recommend these shoes, I will be heart broken if they ever take these off the market!

My first pair of the keen sandals, I love them. They are very comfortable. I purchased them through Amazon at a very reasonable price, they usually cost in the hundred dollar range. That's all I have to say about that!
You would expect a name like timberland to have reached a certain level of expertise to be able to build a $ 100.+ shoe that can compromise between comfort and toughness... ,but it doesn't .

I received these slippers for Christmas in December 2005. I got the Pine green, a very nice looking slipper with lots of comfort. I am ordering another pair in Charcoal, as I want 2 pairs to have at both places I live. It's all about comfort for me when I am home, so these fit the bill. Good value as well.

I bought this shoe because others mentioned how comfortable it is and I work on retail and my job is essentially an eight hour workout. They were comfortable when I put them on but by the end of the day the bottoms of my feet were hurting bigtime. A pair of Dr. Scholles (sp?) fixed that but it is something a buyer should be aware of
This shoe is very comfortable and am planning on purchasing another pair. Glad I was able to find mens size 14.
Excellent quality shoes, great price and they look great with work clothes or for Friday after work outing...Love these shoes. I wish I could find another pair!

I love these Eastland shoes but can't seem to find them anymore. I was excited to see them on Amazon as my old pair is looking quite worn. When I got them, they were too small! I guess I learned my lesson and won't purchase shoes online again. I just did my first ever return to Amazon and will see how that goes. By the way, I have worn the same size shoes for years!
product received in good time and we liked it because it was requested by me to give away and use

I bought these shoes because I have foot problems and my doc said they could help me walk better. They really did- for about 2 months. They stretched out quite a bit and no longer gave the support I needed. That's not good enough for the price. Now I am looking for something better.

I purchased the pink Highlander Sheepskin Cuff Bootie slipper. I wear size 8 1/2 shoe and ordered the size 9 slipper. At first I thought it felt a little snug in the toe area on the top of my foot, but after wearing them 3-4 times, this area loosened up and they fit just right. After a year of wear, they have become plenty loose enough - that's how sheepskin works.These slippers have the traditional slipper thickness for the sole, which some reviewers did not like - they wanted more padding. After about a year of wearing these, I would agree. The sole could benefit from thicker padding, as it would add to the overall warmth factor of this slipper. The bottoms of my feet still feel the cold from the floor in the winter, although my feet generally stay warm enough in spite of this. The cuffs are warm and sort and you can fold them up or down.These slippers are fine for the price, and if you live in a relatively warm climate where the winters stay above 32 degrees Fahrenheit, they will provide more than adequate warmth. If you need a thick-soled slipper for whatever reason, I would recommend you look at something else. I doubt these will ever wear out - sheepskin is sturdy stuff. As a side note, these are cute pink slippers.

I think these are nice. Nothing extravagantly fancy, just good boots at a good price. the leather is soft. I bought a size up and I think I could have gone down half a size. Heel is high but not too high, and they walk comfortably.

Good shoes for the price. Havent had a bad day in them so far. That includes all the excessive daily usage as well as the great compliments. Only con I can see is that maintaining the shine it came with, does require a bit of an effort. But it pales in comparison to the comfort of these great shoes. Must buy for office goers!

These are not just super cute and perfect for fall but they are actually comfy. Thanks to the other reviews on sizing I ordered a 7 but I am a 7.5. THey do run a little big! Also shipping was super safe!Overall, completely satisfied!
I have bought this shoe for work, play and just plain walking for 5 years. They are the best. I use special insoles inside and I have the best fit and feel ever. Highly recommend them to everyone.

I have purchased two pairs of these brand shoes and I love them both. I wish they were in other colors. I put them on right out of the box and wore them all day. I also wear them on sunday when I come home from church. I would recomend to any one looking for comfortable walking shoes.
i am very pleased with my product- it was a gift for my son who is an avid skate boarder and vans has b come 1 of his favorite shoes
I purchase this sandals for my mother. She likes this sandals because they are very soft and easy to put on. Also the leather is very soft and comfortable.

I'm a Vans girl, but these were on sale dirt cheap and I needed a pair of brown shoes because black doesn't really match everything no matter how many people insist that it does. These shoes are very comfortable, and if I were basing the review on comfort alone they'd get closer to five stars. However, they're not easy to slip into. They require tugging and pulling, which wears on the back of the shoe. Mine are already starting to break down, and I've only worn them a few dozen times at most. If I had paid any more than $16 for these, I'd be pretty ticked off. But since they were cheap, and they are comfortable, I'll let it slide.

I've gone through three pairs of these shoes in the last decade. Yes! Ten years! I'm about to turn 29 years old and got my first pair at the end of high-school from a friend. The second pair is still with me and has worn all the way through the sole but they are still comfortable and very wearable. IMHO there isn't a better casual styled shoe out there in terms of comfort, retro style and look.I will admit that I have fairly flat feet, and the slight lack of support might be part of what makes these a little more comfortable for me.In my opinion, for fifty bucks or less depending on where you buy them, getting three to four years out of a pair of shoes is simply awesome. And I don't own a bunch of shoes I wear these every day!

I had been out of bowling for over 12 years and didn't have my old shoesany longer so I purchased these shoes and I'm very glad I did. These arevery well made shoes and are extremely comfortable to ware.
These shoes are beautiful and look great on, but aren't that comfortable. I love them, but I don't wear them for more than an hour or two without having to take them off.
I bought the shoes about 6 months ago and they still look nice. Even though your not supposed to get them wet, I have worn them in the rain and you cant even tell.

I have been running in the top of line New Balance for over ten years and have bought every top brand running shoe to try to compare. Even though they are overpriced - still best shoe on market - especially for those with injury or pronation problems as I have.
A little long but fit well overall. Width is fine for me (I'm a little wider than normal/medium usually).Check around for price - I got these off amazon for around $30.
Bought these for my daughter as she is in a musical and needed a good shoe. Great heel height for her and the shoe fit true to her normal shoe size. Very fast delivery too! Thanks Amazon!
It is true that they come larger than the regular size. They are comfortable casual shoes but would recommend them for long walks, they give me blisters.

I haven't had these for too long, but, so far so good. Soft leather with rubber soles. Double stitched for the most part. I ordered a 1/2 size smaller as they recommend, and they are a perfect fit. Nice color brown, with a small black beading down each side. Inside says made in China. Nevertheless, a lot of boot for little money. Only time will tell, how well they wear.
These were purchased for my fiance to wear in our upcoming wedding. They are all leather, even the soles. They have a classic look and will last for years to come.

I've gone through three pairs of these shoes in the last decade. Yes! Ten years! I'm about to turn 29 years old and got my first pair at the end of high-school from a friend. The second pair is still with me and has worn all the way through the sole but they are still comfortable and very wearable. IMHO there isn't a better casual styled shoe out there in terms of comfort, retro style and look.I will admit that I have fairly flat feet, and the slight lack of support might be part of what makes these a little more comfortable for me.In my opinion, for fifty bucks or less depending on where you buy them, getting three to four years out of a pair of shoes is simply awesome. Now, if you're a typical person, you'd probably find this shoe to be soft under foot. However, I stand for hours a day (teaching) and I found this shoe to be lacking. It ain't soft enough for my long-suffering feet and it's certainly less comfortable than a typical running shoe. If your workplace allows you to wear running shoes, just do it. You'll be happy you did. In that case, may I recommend to you the Asics GT-2170? It has a super-soft MIDSOLE, which is the IMPORTANT PART for comfort. I'm basically a shoe expert at this point in my life, and I must advise those who are looking for a comfortable shoe--I mean really soft!--to LOOK UNDER THE INSOLE AND PRESS THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF THE MIDSOLE. If the midsole (under the insole) is hard, or even hard-ish, you will NOT be comfortable unless you have numb feet that are immune to pressure. So don't be fooled by super-soft-feeling insoles made of puffy, fluffy, light foam. They will compress on top of a hard midsole, and you'll be hurtin' and as irritated as two wet cats in a bag.

When I'm serious about all day wear, I'll look for something better. The Justin line has been made in China for years and the so-called Basics I just bought are completely truthful in revealing that the upper and sole are manmade. That said, the vamp and upper both look good enough in the Bay Apache color. They have weird bright white stitching (even on the black model) at the top of the sole. I used three coats of heel black applied with a fine paint brush to kill the white and make them look normal. But I've always liked the Roper look so I'm willing to work for it.The arch support on the Basics is non-existent so that they feel like you're wearing empty Kleenex boxes. Since I'm flat-footed I assume that all my shoes will require fairly stiff arch support inserts so this didn't bother me much. The manmade uppers are not as soft as real leather so you need long socks to protect your calves from scratches, etc.If you just want some knockabout boots that look good with jeans for a casual day or evening, these are okay. They are available at a lot of sporting goods stores, Tractor Supply Centers, etc, and they're certainly cheap. But if you expect heavy use, all day comfort, great value for you money, etc. you need to spend AT LEAST $110.00, on higher end Justins or Ariats or other big names I know nothing about. Other boot experts will say you need to spend a lot more than $110.00 and I will defer to them. If you have problem feet, consider hand-measured, hand-made from a local boot maker, but bring lots of money and months of patient waiting.I can't imagine buying boots online without extensive local legwork to make sure of my size and comfort. Justin boots are sized MUCH larger than Ariat and when it comes to any pull-on boot, your regular shoe size is meaningless. The Justin website has a simple and helpful video about how to find the right-sized boot here [...] DO NOT accept a boot that is the least bit uncomfortable. Within days, you will be in agony and you will eventually give your boots to the Goodwill box.Frankly, even some relatively good manufacturers and catalog houses are sloppy about their color photos on their website, so don't be sure of the color until they come out of the box. You could be in for a surprise.

I live in Michigan and work in the elements 95% of the time. I found the Danner Telson boots to be decent all-season duty boots.Prior to the Telsons I had a pair of Danner Acadia boots that gave me five solid years of work but they eventually got pretty sad looking with slick soles so I had to move them to the motorcycle wardrobe where they still serve.The reason I changed to the Telson was that I needed something more comfortable to stand on all day, and I needed a pair of boots that would allow me to run easier. The heavy lug sole on the Acadia was extremely durable and fine for walking around but if I spent a day standing in one spot (court security or directing traffic) my lower back and feet would just ache. In addition, if I had to chase someone down it felt like I was running on bricks. The Telson solved both issues. They fit more like a gym shoe, they are much lighter, the sole is more flexible, and the leather is softer than the Acadia. I would even argue that they are a bit more slip resistant due to the running shoe type sole over the lug sole.The biggest con to the Telson is that you give up quite a bit of durability by making them lighter and more comfortable. I just finished three years on the Telsons and the soles are now completely smooth with no traction left and the softer leather upper is so warn that they just laugh at me when I pull out the polish. Over their life the Telsons were much harder to keep looking Class A than the Acadias due to the exterior plastic-like ankle support and the softer leather. Speaking of the ankle support, I understand that they were designed with the exterior support rather than the steel shank in the sole in order to keep the boots lighter and more flexible which worked for the most part, but I wouldn't necessarily call the Telson boots "highly supportive".In the end it was nice to pay the cheaper price (vs Acadia) but considering that I lost 2 years of service I'm not sure it was much of a savings. I still find the Telsons pretty comfortable overall and they are certainly better for running/agility but I think I'll keep searching for "the perfect duty boot" since these are just OK.

I've been wearing Clarks Natureveldt shoes for at least 7 years now and have gone through about 4 pairs during that time.Previous pairs had been made in Europe, however, the two pairs (one black and one brown leather) that I recently purchased were made in China. So far, the fit is the same between the Chinese manufactured shoes and the European made ones. There are however some design differences, of which the tongue is the most apparent as it appears to be made a little bit cheaper than previously. The laces also appear to be a bit cheaper.Should note though that overall the design/build of the shoe appears to be about the same or better in most areas. Time will tell however, as these shoes are pretty much legendary for lasting a long time.The main thing that I've always liked about these shoes is how comfortable they are even from the first wear. They do not require any break-in whatsoever due to the type of leather used, how they are constructed and how they fit on your foot.They just feel good on my feet. They are also pretty comfortable to walk in and since I have flat feet, this is a must have in a shoe for me.I personally like the style of the shoe, although some might find them to be a bit too classic, laid back or casual for a leather shoe.All in all, these are the only leather shoes that I really feel good about buying these days, however that might change if the move to China significantly decreases the useful life of the shoe.

The GOOD: I bought a pair of Hi-Tec many years ago. Paid around $85 for them. I loved them. They were the most comfortable boot, and I liked the way they laced up. Because of some of life's circumstances I was not able to use them very much until recently. As I am getting older I try to keep active and try to walk every day, but mostly on pavement rather than hiking trails.The BAD: Several months ago I got out my Hi-Tec boots, which still looked like new, and enjoyed using them again. Several days later I put them on again and about a quarter mile from home I heard a slapping and thought I had something stuck to my boot. When I checked, I realized the sole had come loose, and that what was flapping. I turned around and started back, thinking that I could take them to a shoe repair and have it re-attached, but when I got home and looked at them found that the sole was actually crumbling. Then I noticed the other shoe was also starting to come apart. Unfixable.The UGLY: I found the Hi-Tec company net site and sent an email explaining all this along with pictures of the crumbling soles hoping they would respond and at least give me a break on a new pair, but apparently they have chosen to ignore the problem.

I spent several days researching the right pair of boots. I narrowed it down to UGGs which had very positive reviews but were pricey, and EMUs which seemed to be basically the same product for half the price. Sounds too good to be true? It is.Here is what I found:- UGGs are made of sheepskin inside and out, and cost $130-$160 forthe most popular type (called Classic, short or tall), more for the"fancier" varieties (but I honestly prefer the look of the Classicmodel)- EMUs have TWO types of products: (1) sheepskin inside and out, and(2) cowhide outside, merino wool inside. The first variety cost thesame as the UGGs, the second one (not as cozy, not as comfi) costabout half the priceSo, I went with the UGGs which appear to be the more original/popular and am VERY VERY happy - these boots really insulate you from the harsh cold completely. Happy feet are worth the $$ for me in thise case. I got the tall variety in grey, and LOVE LOVE LOVE them.Another misconception that I'd like to correct - NEITHER is 100% waterproof - as in they'll basically keep you warm and dry in a reasonable amount of rain/snow, but if you drench them it will show (common sense). UGGs has real waterproof models which are more like regular snow boots etc. UGGs also has a water-resistant treatment to improve the durability, but friends I spoke to didn't do that and haven't had any water seeping in when she's worn UGGs in the rain.So basically, the real deal sheepskin product costs the same (and is similar in quality, comfort).I had such a hard time figuring this out - shame on all the websites for sneakily pretending that the cheaper EMUs are made of the same material, which they are not!

My situation was rectified and I am extremely satisfied and would not hesitate to order again from this vendor. It is wonderful to still have people who care about their product, reputation and their customer base
I have owned Prowalkers for years. This the 5th or 6th pair. They are solid, comfortable, and wear well and are reasonable.
i was soo happy to find my shoes in the style, color and size i wanted. I looked everywhere and this was the ONLY store that had them.Thanks again!!!

the shoes were perfect and came right on time. however, the very first time i wore them, they got scuffed by a tricky curb. i wish you could have installed some kind of invisable force field around them so that they would stay so white. you really need to work on that.
Nice-looking shoe, but too expensive. For big foot guys like me, makes your feet look a lot smaller.
They are hard to get on my son even though there is plenty of room in the shoe once his foot is in. I won't buy this style again. But they are good quality and were really cute once we had them on.
I ummm actually haven't worn these shoes yet but. They get props from me just cause they look good. And they is original. so poo poo to you.
Very cute and comfortable but sweating in them seems to draw out the dye from the sole and causes my feet to blacken. Will try soaking sandals in soapy water to dilute dye.

Since Nike bought Converse the have altered the shoe. There used to be an extra piece of stitched canvas on the inner part just below the big toe and stitching through the back heal of the canvas. The show is basically the same, except without this extra stitching and canvas they do not last as long.
These are the greatest sandals I have ever bought. They are comfortable, lightweight, and durable. Everything you might ever need.

Great for the person that is on their feet for long hours. They may not be as nice as the Hi-Tec Magnum boots but they are close and about half the price. The best way to break them in is still to get them wet and wear them all day while hiking or just walking. By the end of the day the boots will be fitted to you feet and broken in to perfection. You may find youself wearing them more often then you thought you would.

I have a pair of North Face pack boots that I purchased last year and they weren't very breathable so I decided to get the trusted Sorels and I couldn't be more pleased. They are even better than the pair I had in high school. if you need cold weather boots with good traction get these!
Ordered 2 for my sister and wife. Sizes are 1 full size smaller than US standard. Has to exchange the item. Be careful...Thanks/.
These shoes are true to size and very comfortable - no break-in was required. The color is a rich dark brown. They are a cross between a clog and a sneaker. I like being able to just slip into them.

I LOVE disco, and these shoes really do complement any outfit. I was afraid that they would be difficult to walk in but they really aren't! I also read the reviews that if you are a half size to just order the next size up (since there are no half sizes for this shoe) but I ordered a 6, I am a 6 1/2 and it fits snugly (which is how the shoe is supposed to be). Great product, I will probably be buying another one of these in pink soon!
have been wearing this style of sandle for years, don't know what i would do without them. and i am a shoe person!

This shoe fit true to size; i.e. regular street shoe size. Medium width. I have been dancing in them a few weeks now and they were easy to break in. I prefer to have snaps instead of a buckle so that costume changes are easier but the shoe seems to be well made over all.

The color did not go with the outfits & the fit was not narrow enough. I really wanted just the camel color without the croc look, made the shoes look cheap. Sent them back, will try again. The seller was excellent, will buy from again.

This shoe is aesthetically superior to anything on the market, particularly the latest version, a unrivaled gem which sports a navy blue faux-suede. If you don't actually want to PLAY basketball in these, definitely get a pair.However, if you're using the shoe for its intended purpose, I hope you have narrow feet and strong ankles. As a huge fan of the original T-Macs (didn't get the T-Mac 2's because they were too narrow), I was hoping that the 3's would restore my faith in the shoe. I'm a serious baller - I play just about every day and participate in 3 corporate/city leagues.That being said, after only owning these shoes for just three few weeks, I had to return them because I sprained BOTH ankles (never happened with the T-Mac 1's) AND severely bruised my medial and plantar nerves (never happened in my life - ever). Though ankle injuries are all too common in basketball, these injuries did not occur in the typical "landed on someone's foot" fashion, which is cause for serious concern. I consulted my podiatrist on the issue and she informed me that my shoes provided poor support and suggested I look into a pair of New Balances.Additionally, the outside of the shoe will dig into your ankle if you lace your shoes up tightly, as there is no cushioning around the top rim of the shoe.Proceed with caution - do not be wowed by looks, particularly if you need support or have wider feet.

I loved these shoes when I got them. They Rock. The company Dress Code is great also they were really good to me when I received my shoes unfortunately they didn't fit so I had to return them for a pair one size bigger. Anyway I didn't have the money at that time to send them back right away so I told them I would send them back as soon as I got paid and to my surprise a few days later I received a prepaid return label from them it was great. Now I am able to send them back right away I am very happy with everything.

Oh, how I wish these were evenly constructed and a little wider, because they are a nice shoe, and the price is reasonable. I had the same problem as the previous reviewer, except the right shoe is the one that was uneven. It looked a little "wonky" upon taking the pair out of the box; but, I thought it was the way they were packaged and/or my eyes playing tricks on me. However, I could tell *immediately* when trying them on that the right shoe was not "right".Also, I normally wear a medium-width shoe, and even though these are marked as such, they are a little narrow (even with thin, "dress" socks).

The Keds sneaker is a classic, same style as always, and worn by everyone. I was surprised, however, that they tend to run a little small! My foot is between 9.5 and 10 in size, so I bought 10, and I can't wear them with socks. I am trying to stretch them with shoe trees in hopes of being able to wear them more often. I have to say, that's a little disappointing.

I purchased a pair of these after reading reviews praising their arch support, but had to return them. They were the correct size, but too narrow to accommodate my orthotics. If you don't need custom arch supports, these shoes would probably offer decent support for high, weak arches.

They are a good fit, size and width were true. They are good looking shoes and lightweight. However, some of the seams are a little sharp and dig into my ankles, have to wear thick socks! I think that this may be improving as they break in.
I now own five pairs!!! All in different colors! Hope they never stop selling them!
These boots not just look good but are very comfortable, this is my third pair .......I would recommend these to any one who is looking for a low price hiking boot
I do park hiking, up hills and steps. These are fantastic. I never slipped once, even on ice. I'm so glad I bought these.
I bought these for my daughter and she loves them. They are good quality and fit great.
ESTE ES MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO, MUY BUENO..MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO,MUY BUENO, MUY BUENO..MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO,MUY BUENO, MUY BUENO..MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO,MUY BUENO, MUY BUENO..MUY BUENO,,MUY BUENO
I bought this shoes, are really nice and fit well done. At six months the sole of the left shoe damaged without apparent reason. Nice shoes but expensives, I could pay at least US$40.00.

This is my 2nd pair of Propet walkers. I have the other pair that has mesh instead of solid leather, which are good for summer time but not winter when it's wet outside. I wanted a leather pair to keep the moisture out of my shoes when I'm outside & I do walk a lot so a good walking shoe is a must.I'm type 2 diabetic & was having some ingrown toe nail problems. After buying my 1st pair of these shoes, within 3 months I was able to get rid of the ingrown toe nail. The shoes have more toe room & are stable to keep my foot from rolling out when I walk. I was having lots of back pain, and if I don't get a good shoe like i said my foot rolls out & my ankles start to hurt.With these shoes I have no pain, am steady on my feet & the rubber sole is good to keep me from sliding around on wet floors: an added plus.I wanted to mention that these shoes are comfortable, they have a snug fit feel to them, but not so tight that your feet feel crammed. Earlier I was wearing these shoes because my feet were so swollen I couldn't get anything else on except slippers. These went right on, did not make my feet feel crammed, & with the heel pain I was having from the swelling i couldn't feel it.These are really some nice shoes, they are light weight & feel good after being on my feet all day walking around, even when I take the dog for a walk.I've cleaned out my closet of all the other favorite shoes I had, and only have these 2 pairs now. Nothing else can compare to how these feel for me & how well they keep my feet healthy.

I have run for years in the 990's. It was time to switch to a shoe that would fit an "everyday" lifestyle. I was first fitted @ a NewBalance store (which I HIGHLY recommend). They determined that I had a wider foot (aka. "D") and also noted that instead of me buying my regular 10.5...I would be better suited for an 11.So I purchased an 11D. I am happy to report that I was pleasantly surprised with a great fit and comfort that rivals the 990's. If you need to take a break from a running shoe...these are a must for people with wider feet and need room in the front.Also, Amazon handled the delivery with high marks (under 2 days)! Well done NB, Amazon, and the NB shoe store!

I have to say I bought these to go with my halloween costume. But I really like them! I wore them around the house while cooking to get use to them. All of you who spend a half an hour in the kitchen cooking know that the last thing you want to be wearing are heals, but my feet were fine. Definately not sneakers, but not horrible pain either that comes with normal heals. I also love the height they give me! I'm only 5'2", so 4 inches is a big deal! They are pretty much what you see in the picture. The straps are soft and comfortable. The material for the straps are sewn together to form a tube, so there is a lot of material to them, which adds to the comfort. I have no idea what I would wear these with, but I'll have to come up with something because they are to great to only wear once!
The sandal is stiff and the quality is so so. The original price is marked much way too high compared to the quality.
My husband has loved these boots for years and I was happy to find them still available - he enjoyed receiving 2 pairs for Christmas.

So far they seem really comfy like everyone says, but they run very small. I knew this and order a half size larger. Still too small. Now I have to deal with an Marketplace seller return. Stock these yourself Amazon!
I ordered a few of these bags and was so glad I did! I kept one for myself and gave two as gifts. They are very durable, sturdy and huge! I had them embroidered and they made great gifts!

This is the 2nd time I am ordering these shoes. The first pair I ordered years ago and they lasted all this time with much use but are finally falling a bit apart. I was surprised and pleased to see that they are still being sold here. I really can't say enough about them - they look pretty and stylish and I've been complimented on them by people I know as well as strangers. For tall platforms/heels they are extremely comfortable - I've walked and walked and spent hours at a time in them with hardly an ache. The only minor issue as the other reviewer mentioned is the front is a bit wide so my feet slide in front but it's just a tiny thing that doesn't really bother me, if it does you they sell those shoe things that you put in the front to prevent your toes/front of your feet from going over the edge of the shoe.
I have bought these sandals in a physical store before and they fit better. The ankle strap just didn't have enough velcro on it or it wore off quicker than expected.

I bought these shoes for my husband/son on a Saturday and they were delivered to my house on the following Tuesday. Super, fast delivery I really like the colors they have in these shoes, they are in a cute style, the quality is good,and the price is great.

These boots look very nice. The problem with them is they are made really big. I bought the size my son wears in other shoes, but these boots turned out to be quite larger than he needed. They make his feet look huge.
Shoes are nice and durable like only vans are, however this classics are very harsh on your feet the first couple weeks

Shoe is a bit narrow. The heel is higher than I wanted-2". Could use more padding in the ball of shoe, which is where you put your weight when your dancing. I'm a beginner dancer and the leather sole is slippery even after using sand paper to rough it up. (I found a suede sole to be less slippery for a beginner.)
Shipping was way fast, this is my 5th pair of Chucks the black on black is slick, they breath better than any other shoe ive ever owned and it definitely wont be my last pair.
The size was right. Don't buy too big. 2.5 size are 2.5 size. Shoes themselves look good.Colour good like other shoes you see/
Excellent leather slippers.From Amazon. Easy to wear and comfortable to dance in. You must try them. I gave them excellent reviews.

I bought these for my Bronco fanatic husband for XMas and he just loved them!!! They came faster than i expected, like 3 days or so and they were packaged perfectly........i will definitley buy again from Amazon!!!

I am a 6'1" female and ordered a size 12. The actual shoe part fit fine, however, I could have fit both legs into one boot. The sizing was utterly ridiculous. You will also be charged 20% restocking fees for any returned merchandise. Don't waste your time.
The Yaktrax Walker Traction Clease for Snow and Ice have been a great help during this long snowy and icy winter.
Comfortable!Love it! Looks great with skinny jeans. DIdn't know it came with white laces so I bought it beforehand.. oh wells. Love it! looks so clean and cute.
I like the retro style of these shoes, very well made and a decent price. I wish the tongue of the show was wider and did not slide around as much.

I purchased some Converse Mens Chuck Taylor Sneaker from another store because they had some specials going on and I also had some coupons so I purchased them in the size I have always worn, size 9. Then I try them and wow way too big, felt like a clown at the gym :)I can fit a whole finger in the back of the shoe with my foot in it. Anyway I did some research here on Amazon and bought pair from Amazon, a size 8 and wow !!! I can't believe it Perfect fit, I was about to buy half size smaller but I went with the whole one size smaller instead and I'll say it again PERFECT FIT :)Buy one size smaller ,quality is amazing
Have been wearing Rockport shoes for years since wearing a brace. No breaking them in. They are comfortable from day one and good value for the money when purchased from Amazon.

Excellent shoe, it`s perfect with almost all clothes... Fits exactly in my feet, and even though I do not use it for skateboarding, it might be an unique shoe to do so. And another thing, it`s Vans!! Needles to say more.
These pumps are fabulous. Cool, iridescent, sexy. Just awesome for a night out or even showing off at the office. I love them.
Thank you! Quick service and just as described. Perfect fit!
These shoes are great for work. They are comfortable (not too wide either so I'm not swimming in them) and look really nice to boot. Overall happy with my purchase.
Recd the shoe, both shoes and box were in immaculate condition. Colour and design was exactly what I could not find in stores. Clarks make real comfortable shoes.
These were a Christmas Gift and the person who I bought these for loved them and were exactly what they wanted.
Excellent shoe. Especially for nurses. Make sure to order a whole size larger than you normally wear.

Great boots, well made although mine are a little unequal with the cut of the leather. Unless one of my ankles is half an inch bigger than the other one. Possible I guess. I would have given it 5 stars except for the fact that the little quick lace up doohickeys are a little problematic. They are meant to help you lace up the boots faster but they are very small and not as easy to use as the older design. Fortunately I was visiting my mom and had her put her finger on the strings so I could tie them up.:>
My granddaughter loved the shoes. She is three and loves playing princess and dancer, so the shoes were a real hit.

Super stylish and comfortable. Great choice for traveling and going through TSA security checkpoints at the airport. Easy slip on and off. I own these in both black and brown. Love them, but unfortunately, I can only rate these shoes 4 out of 5 stars because I stand on my feet all day at work. I started a new job about a year ago which requires standing all day. These shoes were well broken in long before then. At the end of the first day in which I wore these to work, my feet were killing me. I will still wear them, but only for travel and during off time.

They need to note on this listing that in Capezio world woman's size 3 is a child's size 1. So if you buy your kid with size 3 feet a size 3, you are going to get a shoe that is way too small! It's very irritating, cause at this age/size, you can't buy from the listing that have child sizes anymore. Otherwise the shoes look very nice. You do have to start sewing on the elastic now - not like the Daisy's that come with it presewed. Just do the math and make sure you get the right size.

Minnetonka Moccasins are my favorite shoes. I buy the plain tan ones. For me, they can be worn with everything. They are so soft, it is like walking bare foot, and the soles are slip proof! :)Minnetonka Women's Deerskin Gore Front Crepe Sole Moccasins,Mocha Deerskin,11 M USMinnetonka Women's Deerskin Gore Front Crepe Sole Moccasins,Mocha Deerskin,11 M US

First impressions (I have owned them for a month now).Good looking sporty look. Seem about 1/2 size smaller than expected.Have worn them in heavy snow and 15-30F temperatures.Have NOT drawn any water - feet stayed dry the whole time.These boots ARE NOT insulated - after roughly 15 minutes in 20F my feet were very cold - I am not saying this is a "fault" since I know these are not heavy winter boots - I just want people to be aware.I bought the darker "mud" color from sierratrading... might also order these "stinger".

My Reefs lasted 7 years, traveled to 5 continents, and traversed at least 5,000 miles. After a while they were perfectly molded my feet. I backpacked for 3 months across Europe, walking sometimes 10 miles a day, and wore nothing but my Reefs. Not a single blister and completely comfortable.I also own Havaianas, Chocos, Birkenstocks, and Tevas but haven't been able to wear any of them for multiple days of extensive walking without blisters or with the same comfort level of my Reefs. Recently the tread finally wore down to credit card thin and they needed to be replaced. I was thrilled when I saw that they still sold this model. These are hands down the best sandals out there for comfort and use.

Timberland is a good product. I have a few pairs of shoes from Timberland. Theses boots do have a solid fit, as one customer stated, but the fit is very comfortable! Gives a sold footing with walking in the unpredictable winter weather. Highly recommended. The price is extremely low for a Timberland product. This boot is a winner!
I was so happy to be able to purchase Uggs boots on Amazon. The price was great, and the boots arrived quickly. They were so sharp that I wore them the day I received them with my new outfit.

Great value for the price. The boots served me well this winter. I coach and watch hockey and used them during snow blowing my driveway in a northern climate. They were warm enough. They needed some support though, so I bought some cheap inserts to make them comfortable enough to wear. You will need something to cushion your feet.
EXCELLENT PURCHASE IS REALLY A PRODUCT QUALITY, SAME AS PUBLISHED IN THE PHOTO AND GREAT PRICE. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. It was very good buy.
did not wash well... price was great but doesn't seem like the same Keds that you buy in dept stores. Not real happy with them.
I did not think the bag was this small. should read description of item next time. I had to purchase another bag for my trip.

This slipper was very cute and stylish; however, I measure at a 10 1/2N. I ordered up and not only was it too long, it was also way too wide. My husbands slippers fit me better! I exchanged them for the 10N which fit much better; but I found to still be on the large side.

Why buy here when you can get the first pair at a Rockport outlet for $10 or more less and then a second pair for half off that lower price??Need to be careful. These days Amazon does not always offer the best value!

I don't know how many pairs of this shoe I've owned over the years -- maybe around ten. I've run thousands of miles in them, but they're my walking shoes too, and if you need to stand for hours at a time they're great for that too. They're one of the few running shoes that come in different widths, and they offer the kind of support, stability, and cushioning podiatrists recommend for flat feet. I use prescription orthotics and wear them under the insoles. I've tried the more expensive 2001's with leather in place of suede, but the 991's seem to last longer and hold up better. They're made so well they never fall apart, instead they just slowly lose the cushioning and support. And a great extra is, instead of being made by Third World slave children, they're made right here in the USA.

I have bought Hi-Tec Altitude shoes for a good 10 years and probably have purchased that many pair. Very comfortable to hike and work outside in. I have acreage and work for hours at a time thinning brush and the like and they always are comfortable.
I got my product on time and the same quality i have been use to in the past.. Hopefully these will last 10 years too..

I usually get the more target brand converse in a size 8, which fit great, but when I ordered these in a size 8 they were uncomfortable. They felt just slightly too big and didn't fit well around my foot, I don't think ordering a half size down would have helped. I tried to break them in, but they gave me blisters, twice!

I bought some white shoes similiar to these in the summer that were so comfortable. So, when I saw these, I didn't hesitate to purchase them. I got the black patent & they look pretty cute. I wear them with jeans or dress pants.
These are the best boots I have ever purchased, they are water proof and very comfortable... don't be afraid to buy these !

I've yet to find a better boot for the money. Can't say I'm fond of the yellow stripes, but they don't look too bad. Steel toe is a welcome addition, plus they actually carry these in wide sizes (unlike the majority of shoes/boots on Amazon.)
I got the shoes well before the date they were expected. Can't ask for better service!

I bought this shoe without having tried it on (which could have been a mistake) and was lucky enough to find my feet fit. Because there are no laces and the tightening system isn't that great, it would be advised to go down a size for a tighter fit. One of the shoes at the seam rubs on my ankle causing discomfort, however this could simply be my ankle and may not affect others rather than a problem with the shoe itself. The shoes are somewhat heavy (don't expect to be able to jump any higher) and the leather is quite soft and wears easily. I give these shoes 3.5/5, loosing points due to their weight and discomfort they cause me (again may only be in my case), however they look great.

Love the style of this sandal. Not my first pair. Very comfortable, good fit in the size I need. The only problem I had was that the color was not what I thought I was ordering, but would like to have more colors in the same style.

My knees were killing me and my toes were ate up with blisters and black toenails (gross I know, but you long distance runners know what I mean). My shoe guy put me in this shoe and voila, no more blisters and no more sore knees (well, it wasn't quite voila as my knees took a little while to adjust to the change in mechanics and heal up and the toes are still healing, but it was plenty quick for all that). Anyway, I'm in heaven. I didn't realize I was an overpronater, well I thought I was, but didn't realize how much a shoe could help. Also, these shoes are a little small (as are all running shoes) so size up a little to avoid the toes thing. I've run 3 half marathons and 2 marathons in these in less than two months. Hurray for no more sore knees. The 15 miler and half marathon right before that in the old shoes were terrible. I've saved those old ones for short trail runs in the mud. Btw, my shoe guy recommended inserts for these as he says the ones that come with the shoe wear out really quick.
A sneaker that you can wear to work. The opening falls lower on foot than expected. Fairly comfortable though.
The quality is good, but the cut of the shoe is much narrower in front than other Sebago boat models. I had to return these.
excellent converse all star. the product was well described and satisfied my needs. the shipment has been quick

Just arrived and best described as a slipper.No separate insole or structure. The soles are very narrow so the upper in the D width must hang over the edge. I have been wearing deerskin moccasins for 50 years or so. The quality seems to be going downhill.

I have a pair of these and they are my go-to shoe. They are soooo confortable and they go with any kind of jean and never fail to make a statment. I have own my pair of all black chucks for over 7 years and wear them often and they are only now starting to show wear. They are tough and confortable. I will never hesitate to buy chucks. If you don't find anything you like go to the converse site and create your own. I LOVE the ones I created there.

This is the second time I have purchased this boot, and I would have to say "Its a great deal, and a good work boot". Even though these boots "Can" last up to a couple of years on the outside, I purchase a new pair "Every year" just because the inside comfort doesnt last that long. I use these boots for climbing poles and standing on ladders 30ft in the air. Only found two downfalls about these, 1. Moisture does seem to get to my socks and feet after a couple of months of wear. 2. You can feel the steel shank on the bottom of your foot when wearing the boots, wich make them a little uncomfortable. I will continue to buy unless I find a more comfortable boot for the same price.

Ariat Roper Boots are the most comfortable Cowboy boots I've used. They are well made and look authentic, plus they are durable. The rubber sole makes them the most practical Cowboy boot you can own. They are well suited for everything but dress occasions.
The brand "Keds" speaks for itself. But I got it at a great price and came in just a few days. Like the fact they come in different widths.
....but my wife reports that it does not fil her foot very well. It is the smallest 5.5 shoe she has ever had....

Cannot complain about construction and quality of these shoes however, I ordered a B width but they were too wide for my comfort. Since I had saved a great deal of money on the purchase I gave them as a gift rather than return. The person was extremely pleased to receive such nice shoes.

Since Amazon's price point on these shoes is usually very good, I wanted to shop Amazon for this product that I have used for several years. However, the size wasn't right so I returned them.The product itself is excellent with built-in steel springs which makes for a lighter step, and the shoes are well built.

I haven't bought much on amazon. Normally the things I like can't be shipped internationally to Australia. I had no problems with this purchase. It took about three weeks for them to get here. I expected this.These boots are fantastic. Have been using them on my Harley the last few weeks. Comfortable to ride in and they look great. I highly recommend them. I will note that it took me about a week to break them in. But that isn't too bad in my experience.

I love how comfortable they feel on my feet. I did forget that Timberland's are usually sized a bit large when compared to shoes. Normally I'm a size 12 shoe but only in Timberland's I would be a size 11. Luckily for me I ordered a 11.5 size so it wasn't bad enough for me to return. Just have to lace them up tighter but still not an issue when it comes to them being comfortable and durable. It did take me a couple of days to break them in so now the size issue is none existent.

These are awesome shoes. I am actually wearing them as everyday shoes, not for dance! They are the most comfortable shoes, especially for someone who is on her feet all day as a teacher! My collegues have given me compliments on them and are thinking of purchasing somethemselves. Well worth the money.

i HAVE PURCHASED ANNIE PEANUT BEFORE AND THEY ARE THE MOST COMFORTABLE SHOES I OWN. I HAVE BEEN LOOKING FOR THE DENIM IN MY SIZE FOR AGES AND I FOUND THEM ON AMAZON, I SITE I ALSO HAVE USED MANY TIMES BEFORE. THEY ARE BOTH GREAT.
the shoes were great.. My daughter had all the girls askig where she got them.

Great shoe. The big toes start to wear through the tops after awhile. Very temped though to stick with Asics and go with the next shoe or save some cash and buy the same model just a lot cheaper this time around since it's a late model.
This is the third pair of these shoes I have bought. All different colors. They are great to wear in the office in the summer.
I bought these shoes for running a full marathon (my other shoes were getting old), and they are very comfortable even after 25 miles.

While my title says for you to try at store, i am not sure that wearing it for a few minutes will let you have a real feeling for this sandal.I got it a few weeks ago, and tried it for the first few times for at least a couple hours straight, just walking around in my town with my wife. I wasn't walking at a fast pace. After a couple hours i felt that it was hurting my feet, on top of my right foot. It is a beautiful sandal, but definitely not made to be at my feet for too long. Sad, i really wish i could take it would me on my trip to Europe in October.
This is my third pair. They are harder and harder to find. Very comfortable, easy to put on, just wish the tonge was sewn down, so it didn't more, but I do that and they are perfect!
These sneakers are very comfortable and I am very pleased with the look and price. I would highly recommend for a casual flat everyday shoe.
I have worn this style of Easy Spirit shoe for many years. I'm so thankful that it hasn't chaged. It's stylish, yet very comfortable and gives my feet excellent support. I thoroughly recommend it.
14+ hours and no pain...must have....you will love them and they last 6-8 months if you wear them everyday...just bring the price down and will buy in bulk...
The left show was not assembled evenly when compared to the right. Had to return them. Its a shame because they are the best boat shoes I was able to find.
I purchased these for my daughter for Christmas. She loves Adidas and buys them often. She loves her Christmas gift.

A classic shoe and still my favorite after all these years. Can't beat the price either with what sneakers cost these days. I no longer use my CTs for working out, exercise, aerobics, running or anything like that and wouldn't recommend that anybody else do so either. The cushioning is the same as it used to be back in the day, which is to say there is none. But for everyday walking, hanging out around the house, or indulging in a little retro fun these really are great shoes.

I love these flip flops! I had a pair a few years ago, and my dog chewed them. I searched on Amazon and found another pair. They have a great arch support, are comfortable to walk in, and feel great on your feet.

Hmmmm! where do i start, back in 1989I was in a bad car accident, which messed up my ankle Ipurchased this shoe and it worked perfectlybecause i knew that my foot would never get better, and concernedthat the "shoe" might be discontinued, I purchased 10 pairs!!after 22 years I was down to my last pair (i am rough on shoes.expecting to pay 99.00 per pair I was delighted to only pay about60 here on amazon.Jim from pa THIS IS A GREAT SHOE!!!
